1.content:
I awoke to the sound of a door opening nearby – opening my eyes, I turned to find my younger brother Glenn walking into the room. I chuckled a little bit when I realized how different everything would be after tomorrow. You see, I’m in the hospital awaiting a procedure that would hopefully help me regain the use of my legs. There was a catch, however, and that was that I’d be regressed to a 13-year-old state; thus making Glenn my older brother.

Looking past Glenn, I caught a glimpse of Mom and Dad arguing in the background. They were too far away for me to hear them, but I knew what they were arguing about. Turning to Glen, I said, “Let me guess; Dad’s trying one last time to convince Mom this
isn’t a good idea.”

“That’s right.” Pulling a chair up to my bed, Glenn said, “I can’t say I really blame him; I mean this procedure is untested. What if, instead of helping you regain use of your legs, it kills you?”

“The doctors wouldn’t have suggested it if there was a chance it could kill me.” Sighing, I said, “You can just admit it; you don’t think you’re ready to be the older brother.”

“That’s because I’m not!” looking at me, Glenn said, “You’ve always been my older brother; it’s just really weird to think that after tomorrow that’ll be different.”

“It’s not going to be that different, Glenn; sure I’ll be your younger brother, but that doesn’t mean I can’t kick your ass.”

“Oh you think so, huh?” grinning, Glenn said, “You really think you can take me?”
Flexing my left arm, which was pretty muscular, I said, “Hey it’s quite a workout pushing yourself in a wheelchair everyday for 4 years.”

“Can we please talk about something else?”

“I guess so.” Sitting back in the bed, I said, “Have you heard from Kat or Eric?”

Eric Williams was a childhood friend of mine, while Katherine Maddox was my next-door neighbor. “Eric sends his regards; says he wishes he could be here tomorrow but he’s got a lot of unpacking to do before classes start.” Looking at me, Glenn said, “Kat said she’s going to stop by later; I think she’s more excited about this then you are.”

Kat was 13 years old; ever since I told her about the procedure, she was excited about the fact that we were going to be the same age. Before I could say anything, Mom and Dad walked into the room. I could tell they were still angry with each other, but they were trying to hide it. Looking at them, I said, “Please tell me we’re still going through with this; because I’ll be really disappointed otherwise.”

Turning from mom to me, Dad said, “Against my better judgment, we’re going to go through with the procedure.” Sighing, Dad said, “I still don’t think it’s a good idea, but your mother is convinced that the potential benefits outweigh the risks.”

“Potential benefits?” staring at Dad, Mom said, “You mean like our son being able to walk for the first time in almost 5 years?”

“I want this to work as much as anyone, but I’m just being optimistic.” Pausing, Dad said, “I think you’re letting your guilt cloud your judgment.”

Glenn and I just watched as Mom slapped Dad in the face. “How dare you!”

I suppose Mom did hold some quilt about what happened to me; after all, I was coming back from the store with groceries for her when I’d been hit by a drunk driver. I didn’t blame Mom for what happened; after all this time I would’ve thought she’d have gotten past it as well.

Realizing what he’d said, Dad looked to Mom. “Gloria, I-I didn’t mean that.” Sighing, Dad said, “I’ve been a nervous wreck all day, I guess the stress just got to me.”

“I’m sorry too, Kent.” Pausing, Mom said, “Tomorrow’s a big day; Marcus doesn’t need to worry about us fighting.”

“Can I have some time to myself?” Looking at everyone in the room, I said, “I’d really like to be alone for a while.”

“Of course sweetie.” Kissing me on the forehead, Mom said, “We’ll be outside if you need anything.”
1.title: The Beginning

11.content:
I was watching TV, about an hour later, when there was a knock at the door. Muting the TV, I said, “Come in!”
As the door opened, I saw Mom standing there with a nurse. “Marcus, sweetie, it’s time.”

I knew what she was talking about; they’d come to bring me to be injected. Looking at the clock, a little disappointed, I said, “Man, I was hoping Kat would have visited before this.”

“Her mom called and told me they got stuck in traffic.” As the nurse started pushing my bed out of the room, Mom said, “She’ll be here in a few hours.”

Kat had been visiting her grandmother for the day; she lived about 2 hours away. As I was rolled into the hallway, I saw that Glenn and Dad weren’t anywhere to be seen. “Where’d Dad and Glenn?”

“Your father is calling everyone to update them.” Pausing, Mom said, “Your brother...well he didn’t want you to see him all nervous.”

“What’s he got to be nervous about?” rolling down the hall, I said, “I’m the one being subjected to an experimental procedure.”

“He assures me that he’ll be here for you after the injection; he’s just trying to remain calm.”

*****************


The procedure was actually a series of small injections; containing chemicals I couldn’t pronounce. Once it was done, Dr. Wilcox said, “Okay Marcus, the injections are finished.” Looking at me, he said, “I included a mild sedative in there as well; so don’t be surprised if you start to feel a little drowsy.”

“Thanks Dr. Wilcox.” Smiling, I said, “I really hope this works.”

I was wheeled out of the procedure room a few minutes later; to find Dad, Mom and Glenn standing there. Looking at me, Dad said, “How’d it go?”

“There were no complications.” Smiling, looking at my chart, Dr. Wilcox said, “Everything is on schedule and he should be finished tomorrow.”

“Thank you for everything, Dr. Wilcox.” Hugging him, Mom said, “You’ve given my baby another chance.”
After Dr. Wilcox left, the nurse brought me back to the room as my family followed. Looking at Dad, I saw him shaking his head.

“What’s wrong, Dad?”

“I truly hope this works out, son; but I still don’t think you should have gone through with it.” Looking at me, he said, “Aren’t you concerned that you’re the first human they’ve tested this on?”

“I’ll be okay, Dad.” Smiling, I said, “After tomorrow, I won’t need help going to the bathroom or have people on the street stare at me with pity.”

“I understand that, but there’s still some risk.”

“I want to walk again, Dad; and this was the only way to do that.” Sighing, I said, “Even if it means starting High School again, being a little younger is a small price to pay to be able to walk again.”

“You’re not just going to be a little younger, bro.” looking at me, Glenn said, “After tomorrow I’m going to be the older brother and you’ll be 13 years old.”

“But not for long.” Smiling, I said, “My birthday’s next week.”

“Yeah, but I’ll still be the older brother.” Pausing, Glenn said, “That’s just going to take some getting used to.”

“We’ll deal with whatever problems come up.” Taking my hand, Mom said, “Although it was difficult to arrange everything with the school, I’m sure there’s nothing we can’t handle.”
11.title: It's Time

111.content:
As I was wheeled back to my room, I saw Kat waiting for me, with a teddy bear and what looked like every balloon the gift shop had. "How'd it go?" she asked. "Did it, did it work?"

"We'll find out tomorrow," I replied. "Are all those for me?"

"Too much?"

"I think they used fewer balloons to lift the house in Up," I laughed. "Let's go in."

The nurse helped me into bed, then put the call button into my hand. "Anything you need, just push the button," she said.

Once the nurse was out of the room, Mom took Dad and Glenn by the hand. "Come along, you two," she said, "let's give these two some privacy."

As Glenn closed the door behind him, Kat turned to me. "Are you too tired?"

"Not yet, but they said the sedative might take effect soon." I took a good look at Kat. "What's wrong? Why do you look so nervous?"

"It's just that... I like you, Marc."

"I like you, too, Kat."

"No, I mean I like you a lot. I... I... I love you."

"Well, this is sudden."

"I've felt this way since the eighth grade. I couldn't say anything before, because... "

"Because I'm older?"

She nodded. "But you won't be for much longer, will you? So, now, it could happen, couldn't it? There's a chance?"

I opened my mouth to respond, and Kat kissed me like I'd never been kissed before.

When she pulled away, all I could say was, "Wow."

She covered her face with her hands. "Oh, God, I've ruined it, haven't I? I've just embarrassed myself in front of you."

Before I could answer, she said, "I'd better go."
111.title: A Visit

1111.content:
Glenn walked into the room a few minutes later, carrying a tray of food. Looking at me, as he closed the door, he said, “What’s gotten into Kat? She seemed to be in a hurry to get out of here.”

“Kat just kissed me.”

Nearly dropping the tray, Glenn said, “What?”

I proceeded to explain what happened; how Kat told me she had feelings for me and proceeded to kiss me. When I was finished, I said, “I probably embarrassed her with the way I reacted; it’s just that I wasn’t expecting that at all.”

Sitting next to me, Glenn said, “So what are you going to do about it?”

“What do you mean?”

“I mean, what are you going to do about Kat’s feelings for you?” looking at me, Glenn said, “Do you feel the same way about her?”

“I-I don’t know.” Pausing, I said, “Even if I did have feelings for her; my being 4 years older than her meant I couldn’t do anything about it.”

“That’s not going to be a problem after tomorrow, Marcus.” Pausing, Glenn said, “Instead of being 4 years older than her, you’re only going to be 3 months older.”

“She said the same thing; the age difference was the only thing holding her back.” Looking at Glenn, I said, “It’s not like there’s anything there for me to act on; I don’t feel the same way about her.”

“Are you sure about that?” pulling a chair up to the bed, Glenn said, “I saw the look on your face when you saw her standing there with the teddy bear and the balloons.”

“I was touched that she’d do that.” Pausing, starting to blush, I said, “That doesn’t mean I like her or anything.”

“Uh-huh, sure it doesn’t.” looking at me, Glenn said, “I saw the smile on your face when you were talking about the kiss.”

I sat on the bed, silent for a moment, as I thought about what just happened. After a moment, I realized that Glenn was right; on some level, I did have feelings for Kat. Looking at Glenn, I said, “Okay fine; let's say I do have feelings for Kat. What do you think I should do?”

With a grin on his face, Glenn said, “Is my little brother asking me for advice on girls?”

“You’re not my older brother yet, doofus.” Pausing, I said, “But yes, I’m asking you for advice.”

“I think you need to talk to Kat; figure out exactly how both of you feel and go from there.”

“I guess that makes sense.”

At that point I started to feel a little drowsy, I guess the sedatives were kicking in. Looking at me, Glenn said, “Are you okay,
man?”

“I’m feeling a little tired.” Looking at Glenn, I said, “I-I think I’m going to lie down for a little while."

"Sounds good - little brother."
1111.title: Talking to Glenn

11111.content:
I woke up around 7:00 to have a rather subdued dinner with my family in the hospital room. Much to my annoyance, Glenn decided to mention Kat’s kiss to Mom and Dad. They were shocked – both by the kiss itself and the fact that, on some level, I had feelings for Kat. “I’m sure you’ll get the same questions from her parents, Marcus. But,” looking at me, Dad said, “Have you ever...done anything with Kat before now?”

“No, of course not!” shocked, I said, “As if the age difference wasn’t enough; I never knew until today that I had feelings for her.”

“Maybe that’s a side effect of the procedure.” Turning to her husband, Mom said, “Dr. Wilcox said there might be some mental changes to go along with Marcus getting younger.”

I hadn’t heard about that possibility until now; but after thinking it over, I realized it made sense. “I guess that makes sense; I mean both Kat and I are 13 years old now.”

After a few more minutes of talking and eating, I started to feel a little drowsy again. While Dad and Glenn left the room, Mom stayed behind for a moment. Looking at me, she said, “Kat is a lovely young woman, Marcus.”

“I know.” smiling, I said, “She’s been so supportive the last few months; I guess I never thought of the possibility of there being something more between us.”

Holding back tears, Mom kissed me on the forehead. “My little boy’s got a girlfriend.”

“Mom!” blushing, I said, “Please; it was just one kiss – please don’t make this weird for me.”

“Okay sweetie, I promise.” Grabbing her purse, Mom said, “Your father and I are going home for the night; we both have some appointments tomorrow that we can’t get out of.”

“What about Glenn?”

“The hospital was kind of enough to let Glenn sleep in one of the on-call rooms down the hall.” Sensing my unease, Mom said, “Don’t worry; we’ll all be here tomorrow to see you take your first steps.”
11111.title: Family Dinner

111111.content:
Dr. Wilcox had mentioned that I’d feel tingling sensations going through my legs – something about the body repairing itself. The tingling woke me up a few times during the night; reminding me of what it feels like if my arm started to fall asleep.

The sensations were nothing I couldn’t handle; at least until I was awoken around 7:30 by what could only be described as though someone was poking my legs with dozens of needles. Panicking a little bit, I grabbed the call button and pressed it repeatedly. It wasn’t long before a nurse came running into the room. “What’s wrong, Marcus?”

“My legs feel like I’m being stabbed with needles.” Looking at the nurse, I said, “Is that normal?”

“I’m not sure I should answer that.” Turning off the alarm, the nurse said, “I’ll call Dr. Wilcox and have him come in.”

**************


It only took 20 minutes for Dr. Wilcox to arrive; followed shortly after by my mom. Looking at her, not seeing Dad or Glenn, I said, “Where’s Dad and Glenn?”

Before Mom could answer, Dad walked into the room; followed by Glenn. I could tell that Glenn had just woken up; his hair was a mess and he was still a little drowsy. Looking around, Glenn said, “What’s going on?”

"I'm starting to get feeling back in my legs."

Suddenly wide awake, Glenn said, "A-Are you serious?"

Before I could answer, Dr. Wilcox, said, "Let's not jump the gun here; there are still some tests to perform to be 100% certain." Taking a pen from his pocket, Dr. Wilcox looked at me and said, “Okay Marcus, I’m going to run this pen down your leg. Let me know when you start to feel it.”

I watched, with apprehension, as Dr. Wilcox moved the pen down my leg. It wasn’t until he got a few inches above my knee, that I started to feel it. Gasping in shock, I said, “I-I felt that!”

Glenn, Mom, and Dad tried to contain their excitement as Dr. Wilcox tested the other leg. He barely even touched the leg before I could feel it. Looking at me, Dr. Wilcox said, “It looks as if you’re starting to regain sensation in your legs.” With a smile, Dr. Wilcox said, “Now let's see if you can wiggle your toes.”

I concentrated on my toes for a few seconds; gasping again when I saw them move ever so slightly. Mom was unable to contain herself; she started crying as she hugged me. “My baby’s cured!”

While Dad and Glenn hugged me as well, Dr. Wilcox said, “I’d advise waiting a few hours before trying to walk, but I must agree that it’s likely the procedure was a success.”

Tears streaming down her face, Mom walked over and hugged Dr. Wilcox. “Thank you Doctor; for everything.”
111111.title: A Medical Miracle

1111111.content:
After a quick breakfast, the family followed as I was wheeled into the physical therapy room, and up to a set of horizontal bars. The physical therapist helped me up to the bars and said, "Okay, Marcus, I'd like you to try putting your weight on your legs."

I did it, though my legs wouldn't straighten up under my weight.

"You're doing just fine," she said. "Now, I'd like you to try and see how far you can get."

I took a deep breath, and put my right foot in front of my left. Then, I put my left in front of my right. I did it again, before my legs gave out under me.

I wanted to cry as the therapist helped me back into the wheelchair. "Three steps," I said. "Three lousy steps."

"That's three steps farther than you've been able to go for years," she said. "I didn't expect you to climb Mount Everest on your first day."

Mom came over and hugged me, tears in her eyes. "You walked," she said, her voice cracking. "My baby is going to walk again."

I realized that she was right. The therapist was right. I had stumbled, but I had walked before that. My tears of humiliation were replaced by tears of triumph.
1111111.title: First steps

11111111.content:
Kat and her family stopped by around 9:00; this time with flowers and another teddy bear. Kat’s parents congratulated me on a successful procedure. After a few minutes of talking, they walked out of the room with my parents; leaving Glenn in the room with us.

Kat and I were giving each other looks, but we were too embarrassed to do anything while Glenn was in the room. After a few minutes, Kat looked at Glenn and said, “Could you give Marcus and me some privacy, Glenn?” pausing, she said, “There are some things we need to talk about.”

It took him a few seconds to get the hint but finally, Glenn said, “Of course, I-I’ll be right outside.”

Once Glenn left, closing the door behind him, I turned to Kat and said, “I thought he’d never leave.”

“We need to talk about what happened yesterday.” sitting on the bed next to me, Kat said, “I never should have kissed you, or told you how I felt.”

“You didn’t do anything wrong, Kat.” Pausing, I said, “In fact, after you left yesterday, I realized something...I like you too.”

“Y-You do?” blushing, Kat said, “You’re not just saying that to make me feel better, are you?”

“Nope, I’m being totally sincere.” Smiling, I said, “I never realized it until yesterday, but on some level, I guess I always cared for you.”

“How come you never told me?”

“Probably for the same reason you never told me; our age difference.”

“So what you’re saying is, now that we’re the same age, that it’s no longer a problem?”

Without saying a word, I leaned over and kissed Kat on the lips. After a second’s hesitation, Kat reciprocated and we started making out on the hospital bed. Next, to regaining the ability to walk, this was the best thing that ever happened to me.
11111111.title: Kat Visits With Her Family

111111111.content:
It had been an hour since Kat arrived with her family and about 20 minutes since we stopped kissing. The two of us were now cuddling together on the bed, having just finished watching the video Glenn made of me walking earlier.

Kat’s head was resting on my shoulder, as she held my hand in hers. Looking at her, I found myself thinking how right it felt to be here with her. Apparently Kat sensed I was looking at her, as she turned to look at me. “What are you doing?”

“I’m just looking at you.” Squeezing her hand, I said, “Before all this happened, I never imagined that I’d be cuddling with you in bed.”

“Me neither.” Rolling over to face me, Kat said, “I sometimes wondered what it would be like, but this is way better than anything I could have imagined.”

“So does this mean we’re dating now?”

“I don’t know.” Smiling, Kat said, “Do you want us to date?”

“Had you asked me that question two days ago, I would’ve said no. But,” grinning, I said, “Now I can’t stop thinking about the prospect of us being a couple.”

“I suppose this means we’ll have to talk to our parents.” Sighing, Kat said, “Given the...uniqueness of our situation, I think they’ll need to know where we stand.”

“That makes sense.”

“There’s no need to rush anything.” Resting her head on my chest, Kat said, “For now, can we just stay like this?”

“I’d like that.”

Before we could get comfortable and watch some TV, the door opened and Mr. Maddox walked into the room. The look on his face told me he wasn't too happy right now.
111111111.title: A Short Time Later

1111111111.content:
Mr. Maddox glared at me and said, “What's going on here?"

Kat sat up with a start. "Daddy!"

Walking over to my bedside, looking at me, Mr. Maddox said, “I'd like to have a word with you, young man,” Turning to Kat, he added, "Alone."

Kat looked like she was about to protest, but instead, she got up and quickly left the room. Once she was gone, her father said, "Care to explain?"

“Well, sir, Kat told me yesterday that she had feelings for me.” Swallowing, I said, “Ever since the procedure, I've realized that I have feelings for her as well.”

“So this is a recent development?”

“Before the procedure, I just want to look out for her.” Getting nervous, I said, “Now that I'm only a few months older than she is, I realize it's something more...sir."

"I see. And what, precisely, do you intend to do about these... feelings?"

“W-we’re just kids, sir; I wasn’t going to do anything crazy.” Starting to sweat, I said, “We just want to, you know, hang out.”

As I lay in bed, with Mr. Maddox giving me the 3rd degree about my feelings for Kat, I was certain about one thing – I certainly didn't feel like a guy a week away from his 18th birthday anymore.

“I’m not here to bust your chops, Marc.” Sighing, a slight smile on his face, Mr. Maddox said, “The truth is, a few weeks ago, Kat found herself in trouble with a friend of yours; Eric Johnson. I just wanted to make sure that you two weren’t too much alike.”

That came as a surprise to me; I had no idea that Eric was capable of something like that. Looking at Mr. Maddox, I said, “I-I understand, sir; and believe me when I say I would never do anything to hurt Kat.”

“I believe you, but I just had to be sure.” Patting me on the shoulder, Mr. Maddox said, “Congratulations on your first steps today.”

“T-Thank you, sir.” Still nervous, I said, “Can Kat come back now?”

“I’m sorry, but we’re leaving in a few minutes.” Pausing, Mr. Maddox said, “Kat’s got a cousin who’s joining the Peace Corps; we’re flying out for a going-away party.”

Just then, Mrs. Maddox poked her head in the door. “We'd better get going. Between the traffic and the TSA, we wouldn't want to miss the flight."

Once Mrs. Maddox left the room, jerking a thumb in her direction, Mr. Maddox said, “You see what’s ahead of you? Good luck on your recovery, Marc.”

"Thanks, sir. C-can Kat come back in for a goodbye kiss?"

“Don’t push your luck, young man.” With that, he left.

I reached for a tissue to wipe the sweat off my face, and winced. My hospital gown felt like sandpaper on my chest.

I untied the gown and pulled it away. My nipples were pink and puffy.

Was this some kind of allergic reaction? I didn't see how. I'd been wearing one of these since I was admitted, and I got a new one every day. Why would it act up now?
1111111111.title: A Parental Lecture

11111111111.content:
A few hours had passed since Kat’s family visited; Dad had just left to bring Glenn home so he could shower. I was just finishing up my lunch when Mom walked into the room holding a pair of crutches. “The nurses thought these might help you get around while your legs get stronger.”

“Thanks.”

“Now that you’re done with lunch, do you feel like going for a little stroll?”

“I guess so.” Chuckling, I said, “I’ve been stuck in this bed pretty much for the last 24 hours.”

It didn’t take long, even with help from mom, to get me out of bed and walking around. A few minutes later we were walking past the nurses’ station. Looking at me, Mom said, “It must be weird to see over the tops of counter’s again.”

“Yeah, I but I’m sure I’ll get used to it.”

As we continued walking down the hall, Mom said, “I wanted to say how proud I am of you, Marcus. You’ve been very brave the last few months, even though I’m sure you were a nervous wreck a lot of the time.”

“I was nervous a little, but thankfully I had you guys and Kat for support.”

“We’ll continue to support you through anything that happens.”

Just as we were passing the bathroom, I felt the urge to go. Looking at Mom, I said, “I’ll be right back, I have to use the bathroom.”

“Okay sweetie, I’ll be out here if you need me.”

It took some effort, but I managed to maneuver myself onto the toilet with the crutches. Once I was finished, I got back on my feet and went over to the mirror. It was then that I felt the same sandpaper-like feeling on my chest.

Balancing myself on the crutches, I undid the gown to get a closer look. I was shocked to find that my nipples had gotten even puffier then they’d been earlier. A quick examination revealed they were somewhat firm as well. What kind of allergic reaction is this?

Growing a little concerned, I called out, “Mom, can you come in here?”

Opening the door, Mom poked her head inside. “What’s wrong, sweetie?”

“My chest is really puffy and inflamed.”

Walking into the bathroom, closing the door behind her, Mom walked over. Placing a hand around each nipple, which felt really weird, she said, “That’s strange; it’s almost as if you’re developing breasts.”

“What?” shocked, I said, “That’s impossible, I-I mean I’m a guy.”

“We should probably talk to Dr. Wilcox about this.” Covering me with the gown, Mom said, “How long has this been going on?”

“I-I don’t know; probably a few hours at most.” Getting nervous, I said, “I-I noticed it after my talk with Mr. Maddox.”

“It’s probably just an adverse reaction to the procedure.” Looking at me, Mom said, “It’s nothing to get nervous about.”
11111111111.title: A Few Hours Later

111111111111.content:
I was back in my hospital room, with my parents, nervously awaiting the results of the tests Dr. Wilcox had run. I was trying not to think about the tests, but all I could hear were Mom and Dad fighting. “This is exactly what I was talking about, Gloria.” Pausing, Dad said, “We subjected our son to an experimental procedure and now it’s very likely he’s developing breasts.”

“What do you want me to say, Kent? That you were right?”

“I just wish you would think things through.” Sighing, Dad said, “Was helping Marcus regain his ability to walk really worth the possible side effects?”

At that point, I’d had enough. Looking at them, I said, “Will you guys stop fighting!” sighing, I said, “I’m nervous enough as it is, I don’t need you guys making it worse.”

“We’re sorry, sweetie.”

Dr. Wilcox walked into the room at that moment. Closing the door behind him, he said, “The results of the blood test are in.”
Seeing the look on his face, I knew Dr. Wilcox had some discouraging news. Looking at him, I said, “What do the results say?”

“Your body is producing an abnormally high amount of estrogen for a boy your age.”

I knew from health class that a boy’s body produced a small amount of estrogen. Looking at Dr. Wilcox, I said, “How high are we talking?”

“The amount of estrogen being produced is normally only seen in young girls about to enter puberty.”

I was shocked, to say the least. Looking from me to Dr. Wilcox, Mom said, “What does that mean, Doctor?”

“Physically Marcus has the body of a 13-year-old boy.” Looking at the charts in his hand, Dr. Wilcox said, “However, hormonally, he’s got the body of a 10-year-old girl.”
111111111111.title: Test Results

1111111111111.content:
Dad was the first to speak. For a moment, I was afraid he was going to start in again, but all he said was, "How is this happening? What's causing it?"

"I don't know," Dr. Wilcox replied. "As you know, Marcus is the first human being it's been tried on, but this effect wasn't observed in any of the animal trials." He turned to me. "How do you feel, Marc? Physically, that is."

I shrugged. "Okay, I guess." I grabbed my throat. "Does my voice sound weird to anyone else?"

"Doctor," Mom asked, "what can we do?"

"About all we can do is let this run its course."

Dad sighed. "We've got to try to explain this to Glenn." He handed me my crutches. "Let's get you back to bed."

I put the crutches under my armpits, but, as I hopped off the exam table, I found I had to stand on tiptoe to reach the floor. I had shrunk.

Dr. Wilcox adjusted the crutches, but, by the time we got back to my room, they were getting too big for me again. "If you don't mind," I told Mom and Dad, "I'd like to be alone for a while."

Alone in my room, I hopped onto the bed and lifted my gown. My privates were smaller than they'd been when I relieved myself just an hour before. What was happening to me? How was I going to live like this?

My thoughts turned to Kat. What could I tell her about this? How would she react to her brand-new boyfriend turning into a girl?
1111111111111.title: Becoming a girl

11111111111111.content:
I had the room to myself for 20 minutes before there was a knock on the door. “It’s Glenn, can I come in?”

“Sure.”

I sat up in bed as Glenn walked into the room. Closing the door, he looked at me and said, “Is it true? Are you really turning into a girl?”

“Uh-huh.” Sighing, I said, “My higher voice should be proof of that.”

Pulling a chair up to my bed, Glenn said, “I didn’t think anything like this was possible.”

“I didn’t think it was possible either, but here we are.”

Looking at me, Glenn said, “How are you feeling about this?”

“I’m turning into a girl, Glenn; how do you think I feel?”

The stress finally got to me as I started crying. Without saying a word, Glenn got up and hugged me. I didn’t know what was going to happen next, but being hugged by my older brother made me feel safe. As I cried into Glenn’s shoulder, he said, “I’ll always be here for you, Marcus.”

I cried like that for a few minutes before stopping. Grabbing a tissue, I wiped my eyes and said, “These damn hormones have me so emotional.”

“I can imagine.” Sitting next to me on the bed, Glenn said, “Have you thought about how you’re going tell Kat?”

As we walked back to my room, Mom looked at me and said, “Your father and I had a hunch you’d be coming home soon.” Pausing, Mom said, “So while your father and brother are at home working on your room, I went out and bought you an outfit for the ride home.”

“Nothing too drastic, honey; just making more like a room for a young woman.” As we entered my room, Mom said, “I think they purchased a vanity for your makeup, and your father mentioned something about painting the walls.”

1111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Good News/Bad News

11111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Getting Dressed

"This one would look good on you," Kat suggested.

This was where I put my foot down. "Swimsuits are for swimming," I said, "and bikinis are for getting gawked at. I'm only interested in the one, thank you very much."

After all that shopping, we were all ready for something to eat. "I suppose you'll want your usual stomach-pounder, Cassidy?"

"Not really," I replied. "My stomach doesn't seem as big as it used to. Must be the week of hospital food."

"How about a salad?"

"That sounds good."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Shopping

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The three of us left the mall after having lunch - mostly because Kat had a doctor's appointment to go to. After dropping her off, Mom and I went home. It took some doing but we both managed to bring every bag into the house in one trip. As we placed the bags on the floor, Glenn walked out from the kitchen.

"Geez, I know you've only been a girl for a few days." Seeing the bags, he said, "But don't tell me you've already become obsessed with shopping."

"Believe me, this was more than I'd expected." Looking at Glenn, I said, "I never knew I'd need so many outfits to choose from; although I could have done without the dresses and the high heels."

"If you need any help with this stuff, let me know."

"Thanks for the offer, but I think I'll pass." grabbing a couple of bags, I said, "I don't think I want my brother going through my bras and panties."

"On second thought, you're probably right."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Back Home

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Once I got all my new clothes into my room, I spent a few minutes trying to think of where to put everything. Eventually, I came up with a system: the nicer clothes (dresses, school clothes, and the like) went on hangers and were hung in the closet, while my everyday things (T-shirts, shorts, jeans, exercise wear) were folded and put in my dresser. My bras, panties, and nighties went in the top drawer. I found something with shelves on my closet floor, and decided that was as good a place as any for all my shoes.

I had just started putting my makeup and hair brushes on my vanity when I heard a knock on my door. "How you doing in there?" Mom asked.

"Doing alright, I think," I replied. "You can come in."

Mom came in. Once I showed her where I'd put everything, she said, "Very nice. You didn't know this, but I had the same system in my room when I was your age. I'm glad to see you figured out what the shoe rack was for. I came to tell you a couple of things. One is, your father's got your bike street legal, so you can ride it anytime."

"That didn't take long."

"He's an old hand at this by now, it took him longer to get the lights out of the packaging than it did to put them on. The other thing is, Mrs. Maddox is here, and would like to talk with you. Is that alright?"

"Sure. Let her in."

Mom went out, and Mrs. Maddox came in. "How are you doing, Mar - I mean, Cassidy? I imagine all this can't be too easy for you."

"It's getting better," I replied. "But I'm not a big fan of dresses and high heels."

"That's understandable." She took out her phone. "Remember I told you I have that picture of you and Kat taking a nap together? Here it is."

The picture was of a 9-year-old me, fast asleep, with a 5-year-old Kat, having climbed on top of me, conked out on my chest. "I remember this. It was maybe the first time I babysat her. She had worn me out, and I needed some shuteye. I guess she figured she should get some, too."

"She always thought of you as the big brother she never had." She put her hand on my shoulder. "I'm glad you're here for Kat, Cassidy. After what the Williams boy did, I know she needs a friend who will look out for her."

"You can count on me, Mrs. M."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Visit

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After Mrs. Maddox left, I took a look around my room. The bed was the only thing left over from my life before the procedure. Everything else had changed, with the biggest changes being the vanity and the closet full of skirts and dresses. If anybody saw this room, I thought, they'd never guess that I used to be a boy.

A moving figure caught my eye, and I looked out the window. An older girl went jogging past the house, and I thought of how I used to envy the people who could do that. Then, it hit me: There was absolutely nothing stopping me from doing that anymore. After all, wasn't that the whole point of what I'd gone through? With that in mind, I changed into a sports bra and my new jogging clothes.

With my hair in a ponytail and a sweatband on my head, I walked out of my room. I’d barely made it 10 feet before Mom walked out of her room and spotted me. Looking at me, she said, “Where do you think you’re going, young lady?”

“I’m going to go for a run to the park.” Looking at her, I said, “Don’t worry, I’ll be fine.”

“I’m not worried about that.” Gesturing to my outfit, Mom said, “I’m not sure your outfit is appropriate.”

“What’s wrong with my outfit?” spinning around, looking at my outfit, I said, “I’ve seen lots of girls go jogging like this.”

“I’m just worried you’re not prepared for the attention you’re going to draw to yourself.” Pausing, Mom said, “With a body like yours, you’re going to get a lot of looks.”

“With the way I look, Mom, I'd get looks in a nun's habit."

*******************


It was a 15-minute jog to the park; and by the time I got there, I was exhausted. That was to be expected, since I’d been stuck in a wheelchair for the last four years. As I walked into the park, I made my way to the water fountain to get a drink. On my way there I noticed I was getting looks from some boys, and even a few girls.

The looks from the girls I was okay with; however, I was kind of freaked out by the looks from the boys. It was weird to think they considered me attractive; although that would probably change in an instant if they knew the truth.

After getting a drink from the fountain, I walked over to a nearby bench and sat down. Leaning back, I started to look around at the other people in the park. As I did so, I found myself comparing myself to other girls; how big their breasts were compared to mine, who had a better figure, those sorts of things.

As I looked around, a couple of kids about my age came into view. They were both athletic, and they were arguing. I guess they must have spotted me, because the girl came stomping up to me and said, “Hey bitch, stop looking at my boyfriend.”

Before I could say anything, she knocked me to the ground with a punch to the face.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Going Jogging

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
For just a moment, I was afraid that my fall had paralyzed my legs again. However, they responded when I wanted to move, and I was able to get on my feet. This girl didn't like that much, if her ranting was any indication, so I turned around and put as much distance between us as I could.

I got about halfway home when I felt my left eye starting to throb. Checking out my face in the mirror of a parked car, I saw my eye beginning to swell. Great, I thought, I'm going to have a black eye on my birthday. Mentally , I crossed that park off the list of Places Where I Can Go Without A Bodyguard.

I ran inside and slammed the door behind me as soon as I got home, leaning against the door just in case I had been followed. "Goodness gracious," Mom said, "what's this all about?"

"Some crazy girl knocked me down and accused me of looking at her boyfriend."

By now, Mom was close enough to get a good look at my eye. "Oh, dear. You go sit down, I'll get something for that eye."

I sat down and asked, "I'm going to have a black eye on my birthday, aren't I?"

"Not to worry, I'll teach you how to cover it with makeup." While she was talking, she went into the kitchen, and returned with a bag of frozen peas. "Here," she said, putting the bag on my face, "this should help with the swelling."

Mom had just settled down when the doorbell rang. I was certain it was the crazy girl, following home for Round 2. However, when Mom answered it, a boy's voice said, "Good afternoon, ma'am. Is your daughter in?"

"Yes, she is," Mom replied, "but she's in no condition for visitors. Apparently, some girl - "

"I know all about that, ma'am. That's why I wanted to talk to your daughter. May I come in?"

When he came in, all I could think was, Whoa. The sight of him sent my heart racing like when I'd run back home.

He sat down in a nearby chair. "I'd like to apologize for what happened in the park. My... my ex-girlfriend is kind of clingy and jealous."

"You're telling me," I said, pointing to the bag of peas. "She's got some punch."

"I take it, " Mom asked, "that my daughter was the last straw?"

"No," he replied, "the last straw was my sister, last week. Like I said, clingy. Also, there's this." He handed me my phone.

"Thanks, I didn't even realize I lost it."

"Again, I'm sorry for what happened."

"You don't need to apologize," I said. "It wasn't your fault."

"Maybe I don't," he said, "but I needed to say something." With that, he left.

********************************************************************


When Mom decided I'd spent enough time with peas on my face to minimize swelling, I went to take a shower. After all, I was still sweaty from my run. When I was finished, I blow-dried my hair, wrapped a towel around my waist, and headed for my room.

Mom came down the hall just then. "Cassidy, how about we - Oh, good God!"

"What?"

Mom rushed over, pulled the towel off of me, and tied it on me again, this time, over my chest. "It's a good thing your brother's not home right now. You've got to learn to think about what parts you don't want him to be looking at."

"I'm sorry," I said, "I was thinking about other stuff."

"Well, no harm done this time. And I knew that what happened this morning might have shaken you up. That's why I came to see you. Your birthday's in two days, and we've got the get-together in less than a week. How about some mother-daughter time?"

"What did you have in mind?"

"What say the two of us get our hair done and get mani-pedis? That should help both our moods."

"Okay, I'll give it a shot."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Continue

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Our first stop was the hair salon. My stylist sat me down and asked, "What are we looking for today?"

"I'm not sure," I replied. "I just need something that I can put up if I want, or put a bike helmet on, or keep under a swim cap."

"Would we like highlights?"

"That sounds nice."

Mom and I both came out looking good, with me getting my hair curled at the ends along with lighter brown highlights. Mom gave my stylist a generous tip for helping me out.

Next, we went to the nail salon. This was much easier for me, since I didn't have to pick out a style. Plus, they also gave us foot massages, which felt indescribably wonderful.

As we drove home, I thanked Mom for taking me, then asked, "Can I ask you something?"

"Of course you can, honey. I want you to feel you can come to me with anything."

"Well, when that boy came to return my phone, I felt funny."

"Funny how?"

"My heart was racing like I'd been running for an hour."

"Ah. Well, your heart can race for reasons other than running."

"But I wasn't afraid of him."

"Reasons other than fear, too."

"Like what?"

"Well, he was a good-looking young man."

I caught on to what she was getting at. "Mom, I can't be attracted to him!"

"Why not?"

"He's a boy!"

"And you, Cassidy, are a girl."

My jaw dropped. Could Mom be right? Had I become attracted to boys, the way I used to be attracted to girls?

We finished the drive in silence. When we got home, I asked, "You thought he was good-looking, too, huh?"

"Very good-looking."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Beauty Treatment

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Good morning," I said as I walked into the breakfast nook.

"Well," Mom said, "somebody's in a good mood this morning."

"It's not every day you turn 14," Dad observed.

"And Cassidy gets to do it twice," Glenn added.

"True, true," I said. "But, also, I am officially off my period."

"That is good news," Mom said as she set a plate of pancakes in front of me.I

"Yeah," Glenn said, "it means we're done talking about that gross stuff for almost a month."

I calmly spread margarine over my pancakes, then topped them with maple syrup. "You're going to have to get accustomed to the subject of periods sooner or later, Glenn."

"Give me one good reason."

"Well, if you plan on getting a girlfriend, take a wild guess what she's going to go through once a month?"

****************************************************


After my morning run, I touched up the makeup over my left eye. I won't have to do this too much longer, I thought, my black eye is fading.

I was nearly finished when the phone rang. Mom answered it. "Cassidy," she called, "telephone."

"Be right there," I called back. A couple strokes of the brush, and I was presentable again.

With that done, I went into the living room and took the phone. "Hello?"

"Happy birthday, cousin," Mackenzie said. "How you doing?"

"Doing okay. Had a dust-up the other day. You can hardly tell."

"Glad to hear it. So, what else is going on with you? Aunt Flo come to visit yet?"

"Funny you should mention that, it just ended. I get to put away the pads for a few weeks."

"Not to mention Dracula's tea bags."

"I haven't tried those yet, I'm not sure I'll be comfortable."

"No sweat, Cass, once they're in, you won't feel them at all. I'll show you this weekend. So, what's the least different thing about being a girl?"

"Well, I still have that dream where I'm naked in class, but, now, when I look down, I see different stuff."

"I can believe it. Hang on, someone else wants to talk to you."

After a moment, I heard Chris's voice. "Hey, Cassidy, happy birthday."

"Thanks."

"So, now that you're a girl, what kind of dresses do you like?"

"I don't know, I'm still not used to dresses. I prefer T-shirts and jeans."

"How about hair? What are your favorite hair styles?"

"I don't know, something low-maintenance, something I can put up in a ponytail if I don't feel like brushing it. Why all the questions, Chris?"

"Tell you when we're at the hotel. Looking forward to seeing you then."

Chris hung up, leaving me with no clue as to why he was asking such weird questions.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: My 14th Birthday

choices: The Party, and an Unexpected Guest
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
It was time to start setting things up for the party, and I was helping Mom and Dad, since Glenn was out with a busted hand. "This should be fun for everybody," I said.

"Just so you know," Dad said, "you probably won't get a lot of presents."

"Because of the shopping we did when I got home?"

"That, and plenty of gifts had to be returned. They were bought for Marcus, not for Cassidy."

"I guess I caught everyone off guard."

"Well, there's not really any guard for an 18-year-old boy turning into a 14-year-old girl."

Kat and her family came over just as we were taking care of the last of the big stuff. "Looking good, Cass," she said.

"Thanks. We're just finishing up with the decorating."

"Mr. S, can Cassidy and I talk privately, in her room?"

"Go ahead," Mom said. "We can take care of what's left."

Kat took my hand and pulled me inside, and I kept seeing her as a 5-year-old kid, anxious to show me her brand-new doll.

Once we were in my room, Kat closed the door and began taking off her top. "Let's do this."

It felt like it took me an hour to get the words out. "Kat, I can't do this."

She was out of her top, and had started on her jeans, when she stopped and turned to me. "Why not?"

"Two reasons," I said as I sat down on the bed. "First, part of me can't stop seeing you as the kid I used to babysit."

"Okay," she said. "And the other reason?"

"I think... I feel like... I'm attracted to boys."

Kat stood silently for a minute, then nodded. "Yep, not much I can do about that, is there?"

"You're taking this better than I was afraid you would."

"Hey, I'm straight, too, remember?" she asked, getting dressed again. "We were just experimenting. The results of this experiment were negative, that's all."

"I guess this means we can't be girlfriends anymore, huh?"

Kat sat down next to me. "We're still girlfriends, Cass. Nothing can change that. We just won't be girlfriends, that's all."

A slight smile touched my lips. "Girlfriends as close as sisters."

She wrapped one arm around me and pulled me close. "I'll take that."

We hugged it out. And, for the first time, it didn't feel awkward.

I broke the hug and said, "C'mon, let's get to the party."

"Just a minute," Kat replied, and pulled a gift-wrapped package out of her purse. "Happy birthday."

I opened it, and found... the bikini she had seen at the sporting goods store, the one she said I'd look amazing in.

"Couldn't resist," she said with a laugh. "And I destroyed the receipt, so you're stuck with it."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Getting Ready for the Party

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
With the matter of my involvement with Kat put to rest, she and I were free to enjoy the party. As Dad had said, there weren't a lot of presents, but the number of people around me who were willing to help me get started in my new life made up for it.

I did get some presents: Mom and Dad got me curtains for my window, the Maddoxes got me some pictures of horses to hang on my walls, and Kat got me some books about puberty and periods. "I've seen the pamphlets the hospital hands out," she said. "These books are way better. They aren't written like the author is some guy who's never even seen what a tampon looks like."

"Thanks, Kat," I said , hugging her. "These books are lifesavers." Then, I whispered in her ear, "They almost make up for that trick with the bikini."

About that time, I heard a familiar voice. "Hello? Anybody home?"

Mom opened the gate to the backyard, and he walked in.

To my surprise, Glenn walked up to him. "What's up, Brian?" he asked.

"Glenn," Mom asked, "you know this young man?"

"We don't hang out a lot," Glenn replied, "but I've seen him around school. Do you know him?"

"He came to check on your sister after his ex hurt her."

"Yeah," he added. "I came back just to see how she's doing, any other problems."

I walked up to him. "Just celebrating my birthday."

"Oh. Happy birthday, uh,... "

"Cassidy."

"Brian. Brian Jeffries."

"Cassidy Scott."

He opened his mouth to say something else, but some impulse compelled me to wrap my arms around him and kiss him.

When I stopped kissing him, all he could say was "Wow."

I blushed. "I'm sorry, I don't know what got into me."

"No, no, it's okay," Brian said. "I was just caught off guard, is all."

"Sorry about that. Hang on, I'll get you some cake and punch."

My path took me past Glenn, who was standing there with his jaw wide open. "Close your mouth," I told him, "before the flies get in."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Party, and an Unexpected Guest

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I walked into the kitchen to get some cake and punch for Brian. With those things in hand, I was about to walk back to the family room when Glenn walked into the kitchen. Looking at me, he said, “You mind telling me what that was all about?”

“I don’t know what you’re talking about.” Playing coy, I walked past Glenn. “If you don’t mind, I have to bring this to Brian.”

Taking the cup and plate from me, Glenn stood in front of me so I couldn’t go past him. “What could possibly drive you kiss Brian that way?” looking at me, he said, “I thought you were still in a relationship with Kat?”

“People change, Glenn; I’m living proof of that.” Sighing, I said, “I realized a few days ago, after I met Brian at the park, that I might’ve developed an interest in boys.”

“How come you didn’t tell me?”

“Because I wasn’t sure if I was really interested in boys or if it was just a fluke.”

“What made you finally realize it wasn’t a fluke?”

Leaning against the counter, I said, “Yesterday, when you and I were out riding our bikes, I saw one of the football players with his girlfriend.” Blushing, I said, “I started to feel a little jealous and wished that I was his girlfriend.”

“Does Kat know?”

“Yeah, I just told her.” Sighing, I said, “She was a little shocked, but supportive.”

“What do you plan on doing now?”

“Well, I really hope I didn’t scare Brian off with my impulsive kiss.” Blushing again, I said, “He’s really cute; I hope there’s something there.”

“That’s one thing I never expected to hear you, of all people, say.” Hugging me, Glenn said, “For what it’s worth, he really is a good guy.”

“Thanks, big brother. I’m still coming to terms with this, but it helps that you’re okay with it.”

“I wouldn’t say I’m okay with it, but I’m getting there.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Talking with Glenn

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Excuse me."

We turned. Brian was standing in the doorway.

"Could I have a minute to talk with Cassidy?" he asked. "Alone?"

"Sure," Glenn replied. "Hey, wanna come to my room and check out my video games after?"

Brian nodded. "Yeah, sure, later."

Once Glenn was out of the kitchen, I asked Brian, "So, what did you want to talk about?"

He sighed. "Me and Angela, we moved pretty fast. When I saw what she was like, I was slow to react. Too slow. The point is, I don't want to be in that position again."

"I scared you off, didn't I? I was hoping for something, and I ruined it."

"I wouldn't say you ruined anything," he replied. "I'm just not sure I want to jump into a relationship right now."

"You, you mean there's a chance?"

He smiled. "A pretty good chance, one day."

"I guess I can hold on for that one day."

"Good. Now, if you'll excuse me, I think your brother wants to impress me."

With that, Glenn and Brian were off to Glenn's room.

No sooner had the bedroom door closed behind them, then the front door opened. "Yo, Marcus! Where's the birthday boy at?"

I swallowed hard. Eric Williams had come to see me, and I dreaded what that would lead to.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Continue

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I walked down the hall to the family room, hesitating outside the doorway. Eric was the last person I wanted to see right now. As I stood in the hallway, I heard my Mom talking to Eric. “Eric, I wish you would have called first.” Pausing, Mom said, “This is a small get-together, and Cassidy is not in a condition to see you right now.”

My heart practically skipped a beat when I heard that. Really, Mom!?

“Cassidy?” confused, Eric said, “Who's Cassidy?”

Realizing I had no choice, I turned the corner and walked into the room. The first thing I noticed was Kat standing behind her dad, who was glaring at Eric. Everyone else had similar expressions on their faces. “I’m Cassidy.” Looking at Eric, I said, “My mom’s right, I don’t want to see you right now.”

Eric looked at me for a moment as he processed everything. After a moment he started to realize who was standing in front of him. “Marc?”

"My name's Cassidy."

Eric walked towards me; looking me over as he did. I couldn’t help but notice he lingered on my chest. What a pervert. “What happened to you, man?” pausing, Eric said, “Last I heard, you were going in for the procedure.”

“There were some unforeseen side effects.” Covering my chest, I said, “I got back the use of my legs; but, in the process, it turned me into a girl.”

“Are you, like, a complete girl?” glancing at me, Eric said, “I mean, you definitely have the figure; but do you...”

That was enough to get my dad’s attention. Grabbing Eric by the arm, he said, “That’s it; I think you should leave, Eric.”

Before Eric and my dad got too far, Glenn came back downstairs with Brian. As soon as Glenn saw Eric, his face turned red.
“What the hell is he doing here?”

“Hey Glenn, long time, no see.” Pulling away from my dad, Eric said, “I just came by to see my friend Marcus on his birthday, but, apparently, I’m not welcome here.”

I went pale as soon as I’d heard that. Brian turned to look at me; confusion in his eyes. "Wait, Cassidy, I thought this was your birthday." Pausing, he said, "Who's Marcus?"
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Eric Comes to Visit

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I sighed. I knew I'd have to explain things to Brian, but I'd hoped to be able to do it with a little more time behind us. "It's kind of a long story, Brian."

"And who is this guy supposed to be?" Eric asked. "Don't tell me you picked up a boyfriend already, my dude!"

"Maybe she has," Brian shot back.

That was all I needed to hear to get my heart racing again.

"Enough talk," Dad said. "I've heard about how you act with young girls, mister, and I won't see my daughter treated like that." As he spoke, he pulled Eric closer to the door.

"I'm going, I'm going," Eric said, his gaze still fastened to my boobs.

Once Eric was out the door, Brian turned his attention back to me. "Now, who's Marcus, and why isn't he celebrating his birthday?"

"Let's sit down on the couch," I said, "and I'll explain everything."

When we sat down, I pointed to the family portrait hanging over the sofa. "Notice anything?"

Brian looked. "I guess the guy in the wheelchair is Marcus. But where is he now? And why aren't you in the portrait?"

"I am in the portrait, Brian. Marcus... Marcus is who I used to be."

"Huh?"

I explained about the procedure, and the side effects. "I can walk again, but I'm a girl now. I'm still getting used to all this."

Before Brian could respond, the front door flew open. "There you are! What are you doing in this sow's house?"

Oh, great, I thought, Angela's here for Round 2.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Revelation

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
There were two things Mom didn't like: uninvited guests, and people who just walked in and insulted the people who were there. "Do I know you, young lady?" she asked.

"I'm Angela Baker," the girl replied, "and that skank is trying to steal my boyfriend."

"Watch how you refer to my daughter, in my home, Angela," Mom shot back. "And, as I understand it, Brian has already told you it's over between the two of you. Isn't that right, Brian?"

"We've been over this, Angela," Brian told her. "Let. It. Go."

If looks could kill, the glare Angela shot me would have ended all my troubles. "You little bitch!"

"That's enough!" Dad stepped in front of Angela. "I will not tolerate this behavior, young lady. Now, get out of my house."

Angela was shaking, but she still tried to bluff. "You wouldn't hurt me."

"To protect my little girl? Don't bet on it."

She still would have liked to carry herself off as having won the day, but she couldn't meet Dad's eyes. Without another word, she turned and left.

I rushed into Dad's arms, with nothing on my lips but a half-whispered "Daddy." I hadn't called him that since kindergarten, but it felt right to do it now.

Dad held me and kissed my forehead. I felt such love from him in that moment, more than I had since I agreed to the procedure. Mom held my shoulders.

When I finally broke away, Brian spoke. "Mr. and Mrs. Scott, could I talk to Cassidy for a minute?"
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Angela

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I led Brian upstairs to my room to talk in private. While Brian sat down on my bed, I briefly considered closing the door but figured Mom would think we were doing something. I walked over and sat next to Brian.

Looking at me, he said, “I’m sorry about Angela.” Sighing, he said, “I didn’t think she’d do something like that.”

“After everything, I went through in the last week; I have to say that was probably the strangest thing to happen.” Chuckling, I said,
“When I went in for the procedure, I never imagined another girl would accuse me of stealing her boyfriend.”

“Imagine how she’d feel if she knew the truth about you.” Seeing my face turn pale, Brian said, “Not that I would ever tell her; your secret is safe with me.”

“You have no idea how good that makes me feel.” Standing up, I said, “Glenn is freaking out about me adjusting so quickly; while my dad still thinks the procedure wasn’t a good idea.”

“I can’t say that I’m 100% okay with all of this.” Looking at me, Brian said, “I mean it’s not every day that a 14-year-old girl tells you she used to be a 17-year-old boy.”

“How do you think I feel?” chuckling, I said, “Thankfully everyone’s been helping me in their own way; especially my mom and Kat.”

“I have to ask one question.” Standing up, Brian looked at me and said, “Were you into boys before all of this?”

“Nope, not at all.” Blushing, I said, “I liked girls just as much as the next guy.”

Looking around the room, Brian spotted the clothes in my closet and the makeup on the vanity. “I must say that you’ve got the whole teenage girl thing down pretty well.” Turning back to me, Brian said, “Had you not told me what happened, I would’ve just thought you were this attractive girl I met at the park.”

I started to blush again when Brian said I was attractive. Looking at him, I said, “For a guy who said he wanted to take things slowly, you’re kind of sending me mixed signals here.”

“I do want to take things slowly.” Looking at me, Brian said, “To start off, how about you and I go to the movies tomorrow night?”

“Sounds like a plan to me, so long as neither of us calls it a date.” Smiling, I said, “You want to take things slowly; while I’m still coming to terms with the fact that I’m interested in boys.”

“That works for me.” Smiling, Brian said, “I should probably get going; I promised my dad I’d mow the lawn before it started to rain.”

“Thanks for stopping by to check up on me.” Blushing, I said, “I-I really appreciated it.”

“You’re welcome.” Blushing a little, Brian said, “I’ll call you tonight to set up a time for the movies tomorrow.”

I walked Brian downstairs; he left soon after saying goodbye to everyone. After watching him ride off on his bike, I walked into the family room. Everything was back to normal, but I couldn’t help but notice Glenn and Kat talking in the corner.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Talking to Brian

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"Do you want me to drive you two to the theater?" Mom asked.

"No, thanks," I said. "We'll be riding our bikes." Besides, I thought, we don't want the evening ruined by hearing about all the things that can go wrong in childbirth. Since I'd kissed Brian, Mom had developed a particular interest in the downsides of human sexuality. I had already heard about the various STIs out there, and gotten a detailed report of my birth and Glenn's birth.

The doorbell rang, and Mom answered it. Brian was there. "All set?" he asked.

"All set." I put on my helmet. "See you guys when we get back."

******************************************************************** ****


We stopped about halfway to the theater to rest. "Can I ask you some questions about... about you?" Brian asked.

"Go ahead."

"How much about you is different?"

"Not a lot. I always liked bike riding and swimming. I missed running so much. And I still have the usual nightmares about active shooters in the school. The difference is that, now, it's my legs that won't move fast enough, not my wheels."

Brian nodded. "I know that one. What's the worst thing about being in a wheelchair?"

"Gotta be the C-words. You can guess the first one. The second is courage. People haven't figured out that courage is going into a burning building to save somebody, not being in a wheelchair. Can I ask you something?"

"It's only fair."

"What was it between you and Angela?"

"When you have a question, you don't mess around, do you? Well, Angela was before I learned about taking things slowly. We had had sex before I found out how crazy she was. Because of that, I was slower to break up with her than I should have been. If I had done something sooner, maybe my kid sister's nose wouldn't be broken."

"Well, enough of this. Let's go to the movie."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Movie Night

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Two weeks had passed since I’d turned into a girl; and four days since my 14th birthday. My family and I were driving to Baltimore for a family get-together – my grandmother was turning 75 years old tomorrow.

I was a little nervous about seeing everyone; I wasn’t sure how they’d react to my changes. I knew that Mackenzie and Chris would be supportive, although I had to wonder why Chris was asking me such weird questions; like bra sizes or dealing with boys.

I was looking out the window, listening to some music that Kat gave me when I turned to see Glenn looking at his phone. Taking an earbud out, I said, “What are you doing?”

“I’m texting Kat.” Looking at me, I said, “I hope that’s alright.”

Getting curious, I said, “Why are you texting my best friend?”

“It’s nothing to worry about, Cass.” Sighing, Glenn said, “We’re just talking about how we’re both dealing with your situation.”

“As long as that’s all it is.”

********************


Once we got to the hotel, we got the luggage out of the car so the valet could park it. As we walked into the lobby, I was surprised to see how nice the hotel was – I’d been expecting something cheap, but this wasn’t close to that.

After checking in, Dad and Glenn brought the luggage up to the room while I went with Mom to see the family. As we waited outside the door, Mom turned to me and said, “You’ll be okay, sweetie.”

“Thanks, mom.”

Suddenly the door opened to reveal my Aunt Marcie, my dad’s younger sister. After saying hello to everyone, she turned her attention to me. “Marcus? Is that really you?”

“It’s me, Aunt Marcie,” hugging her, I said, “But I go by Cassidy now.”

“That’s a lovely name, sweetie.” Hugging me back, she said, “I have to say, I didn’t expect you to look...so feminine.”

“You can thank my mom and Kat, my best friend, for that.” Walking into the room, I said, “Where’s Chris and Mackenzie?”

“They’re in the room at the end of the hall, getting changed to go to the pool.”

I sensed some discomfort when Aunt Marcie spoke, but I didn’t dwell on it. Going down the hall, I walked into the room to find my cousin Mackenzie adjusting the top portion of her bikini. Clearing my throat, I said, “Hey cuz.”

Turning around, Mackenzie looked at me and said, “Marc...Cassidy?”

“Yup, it’s me.” Smiling, I said, “What do you think?”

“You look great!” hugging me, Mackenzie said, “I’m a little jealous that your boobs are bigger than mine, but that’s no big deal.”

“Kat said the same thing when she saw me for the first time.” Chuckling, I said, “Only we were still dating at the time, so she was jealous her boyfriend’s breasts were bigger.”

“How are things with Kat?” pausing, Mackenzie said, “Last time I heard from you; you said you were going to tell her about liking boys?”

“We’re not a couple anymore if that’s what you mean.” Looking at her, I said, “We both agreed that we’re better off as girlfriends – just not in the romantic sense.”

“You can never have too many girlfriends.”

Looking around the room, I realized Chris wasn’t in the room. “Where’s Chris?”

Gesturing towards the bathroom, Mackenzie said, “Trying on a new bathing suit.”

The bathroom door opened, as if on cue, and Chris walked out of the bathroom. However, what I saw next was not what I’d expected. Instead of an athletic-looking 14-year-old boy, I saw a girl with a figure not unlike mine about 36 hours into the transformation. On top of that, she was wearing a bikini.

“Chris!?”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Family Reunion

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"The name's Rachel, now," she said, sitting down between me and Mackenzie. "How do I look?"

"You... you look good,... Rachel," I replied. "When did this happen? Last I heard, there was nothing going on with you but an appendectomy."

"That was a bit of subterfuge," Rachel explained. "I went in for surgery, but what they took out wasn't my appendix. To put a stop to the wrong puberty, I was castrated. When I'm older, I can go in for the full enchilada."

"I was wondering why you asked me such weird questions on my birthday. I'm surprised you didn't ask about the big thing."

"You mean the procedure you went through? I thought about it, but I decided against it. That was supposed to fix broken spinal cords, after all. Who knows what effect it would have on a healthy spine?"

"Well, looking at the two of you, I feel overdressed. If you'll excuse me?" I got up and went to the changing room.

When I returned, I was wearing...
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Hello, Rachel

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I walked out of the bathroom wearing the two-piece suit that Kat had gotten me for my birthday. I had to admit that I looked really good in it. Walking over to Mackenzie and Rachel, I said, “What do you guys think?”

“You look great!” smiling, Mackenzie said, “Although I’m surprised you’re wearing a bikini.”

“Hey, if Rachel can wear one then so can I.” pausing, I said, “I get the feeling the three of us are going to turn a lot of heads at the pool.”

“I like the sound of that.” Standing in front of the mirror, Rachel looked at her reflection and said, “It’ll be nice to flirt with guys who don’t know my little secret.”

“We’ve talked about this, sis.” Walking over to Rachel, Mackenzie placed an arm on her shoulder. “Once you start to fill out more, boys will start treating you like a regular girl.”

Walking over to join them, I said, “Who would have imagined, before all this happened, that the three of us would be talking about boys.”

“I can’t say that the thought ever crossed my mind.” Looking at me, Rachel said, “Last time you saw me, you were still a guy and I hadn’t come out to my folks yet.”

“That reminds me, where’s your dad?” pausing, I said, “I haven’t seen him.”

I watched as Rachel’s smile vanished; replaced with a frown. Looking at me, Mackenzie said, “When Rachel came out, my dad didn’t take it very well.” Sighing, Mackenzie said, “He wasn’t supportive at all.”

“You should be glad he’s not here, Cassidy.” Looking at me, Rachel said, “If he didn’t accept that I was a girl, then I don’t think he’d be very accepting of you.”

I was about to say something when there was a knock at the door. Mackenzie walked over and opened it – revealing Glenn and Mom standing at the door.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: My Bikini

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Mom looked me over from top to bottom. "I thought you didn't want to wear that, young lady," she said. "Where did that come from?"

"Kat gave it to me for my birthday," I explained. "When I got here, I was the only girl in the family not wearing a bikini, and I remembered what you told me about blending in, so I threw it on."

"You damn near missed," Glenn replied.

I was getting tired of Glenn's remarks. "You know, Glenn," I said, "if I talked about your body the way you keep talking about my body, Mom would be checking my browser history every time I walked out the door."

"Wait a minute," Mom said. "You said you were here with the other girls, but Mackenzie is the only other girl in the family who should be here yet. Who is this other girl?"

"Oh, yeah, you haven't been introduced yet," I said. "Mom, Glenn, this is Rachel Slate."

"How do you do, Aunt Gloria? Glenn?"

Rachel spent the next couple minutes explaining what was going on with her. Glenn was completely baffled, but Rachel was patient, and she soon had Glenn nodding in understanding. When she was through, Mom gave her a hug.

"Okay, Mac, Rach," I said, "selfie time."

The girls got up next to me, and I took a picture. Adding the subject line "hanging with my girls," I sent it to everyone on my contact list. I wanted Kat and Brian to see how I looked.

If only I had thought about who else was on my list,...
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Surprises for Mom and Glenn

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I spent two hours at the hotel pool with Mackenzie and Rachel; alternating between working on our tans and checking out the boys. After watching a few older boys roughhousing in the pool, I turned to Rachel and said, “Were we ever that immature?”

Lowering her sunglasses, Rachel turned to me and said, “No, I don’t think we were ever that bad.”

Just then Mackenzie walked out onto the pool deck, having gone up to the room to get her phone charger. Looking at us, she said, “Nana’s here.”

I’d been worried about how Nana would react to seeing me as a girl. She knew everything that happened, but we hadn’t sent her any photos yet. “I guess we should go say hi to her.” Standing up, I said, “Although part of me wishes I wasn’t wearing a bikini the first time she saw the new me.”

After wrapping towels around our waists, the three of us walked into the lobby. Once we arrived on our floor, we walked down the hall and knocked on Nana’s door. As we waited for the door to open, I exchanged a sympathetic look with Rachel. We were clearly worried about what was about to happen.

Our worries evaporated immediately once the door opened. Standing in the doorway, with a big smile on her face, Nana said, “There are my three beautiful granddaughters!” looking at us, she said, “Why don’t you all give Nana a big hug?”

We didn't need to be asked twice. The poor dear was nearly crushed.

When we finally let her go, I said, "We were scared you might be more uncomfortable about us."

Nana chuckled. "Let me share a secret with you girls: Before you were born, your parents were asked a hundred times, 'Are you having a boy or a girl?' And, a hundred times, they replied, 'We don't care, as long as it's happy and healthy.' So, are you?"

"Yes," I replied. "If I had it to do over again, I'd do it in a heartbeat. I'd rather have a month of periods than still be in a wheelchair."

"This is me," Rachel added. "I'm finally the person I've always felt like."

"I'm glad for both of you," Nana said. "Rachel, I suggest you make sure you have tampons in your purse."

"Me? Why?"

"You may be some girl's first experience with a girl like you. Sooner or later, every girl gets caught off guard when Aunt Flo pays a visit. If word gets out before you're ready, those girls will remember you having tampons in their hour of need, and they'll know you were being nice for its own sake."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Grandma Meets the New Me

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
An hour or so after seeing Nana, I found myself in the bathroom with Mackenzie; the two of us fighting for space in front of the mirror while we tried to get ready for the party.

While I was busy doing my makeup, Mackenzie was working on her hair. Looking at me, she said, “You know, if someone told me that I’d be sharing a bathroom with you while you did your makeup, I’d think they were crazy.”

“I know the feeling.” Putting a light amount of eyeliner on, I said, “I can’t say that I ever thought I’d be doing this, either.”

Looking at me, Mackenzie said, “You haven’t even been a girl for 3 weeks; how did you get so good at doing your makeup?”

“Kat spent hours teaching me how to do it properly.” Chuckling, I said, “If you ask me, I think she got some perverse enjoyment out of teaching her former boyfriend how to do makeup.”

“I remember, initially, being amused by the thought of teaching Rachel how to do her makeup.” Putting her brush down, Mackenzie said, “Now I’m kind of jealous; since she does a better job than I do.”

As if on cue, Rachel walked into the bathroom, wearing her dress and heels. Even though she didn’t have much of a figure yet, the dress still showed off what she had. It was when I looked up at her chest that I noticed something off – one breast was larger than the other. Before I could say anything, Rachel said, “Hey sis, have you seen my other breast form?”

“I think it fell between your bed and the nightstand.”

“I didn’t know you used breast forms.” Looking at Rachel, I said, “Why didn’t you wear them at the pool?”

“They’re not exactly waterproof.” Wincing, Rachel said, “Besides I also had an incident at a friend’s pool where one of them slipped out of my top.”

After Rachel returned with the missing breast form, she started on her makeup as well. I glanced at the three of us in the mirror; amused by what I saw. We were all wearing dresses that showed off our figures. “Hard to believe two of us used to be guys.”

“Speak for yourself.” Looking at me, mildly annoyed, Rachel said, “I may have been a guy physically, but not mentally.”

Sensing her annoyance, I said, “Sorry, I-I didn’t mean anything by that.”

“It’s okay.” Sighing, Rachel said, “I guess I get a little defensive about that; especially with my dad refusing to accept me as a girl.”

To lighten the mood a little, I grabbed my phone and said, “How about we take a selfie before we go outside?”

The three of us bunched together in front of the mirror; making kissy faces as I took the photo. Opening up my contacts, I sent it out to everyone with the caption: My girls and I about to hit the town.

A few seconds later, I got a response back. Looking at the phone, I saw it was from Kat.

“Damn girl, you look great!”

“Thanks !!”


After a few seconds, I got a text from Brian.

“I’m finding it hard to believe you used to be a guy.”
“You look amazing BTW.”

“Thanks!!”


I must’ve been blushing for real, because Mackenzie came over and looked at my phone. Seeing the message, she said, “Ooh, is that from your boyfriend?”

“He’s not my boyfriend!” blushing even more, I said, “We’ve only been out once, to the movies, and it wasn’t even a date.”
“I have to see this guy.” Joining us, Rachel said, “Do you have a photo?”

Searching through my gallery, I found a photo of myself and Brian waiting in line from the movies. Showing it to Rachel and Mackenzie, I said, “What do you think?”

“I think you might have some competition.” Grinning, Rachel said, “He’s really cute.”

My good mood was shattered when I got another text – this time from Eric.

“You look really good in that dress.”
“If only I was a 14-year-old boy; I’d love to take you out.”

I hadn’t even been aware that I’d texted him. I must’ve sent him the photo by accident; looking back through my messages with him, I went pale when I saw I’d sent him the bikini selfie from earlier as well.

“Thanks...I guess.”


“I forgot to mention, I’m sending you a birthday present.”

“I think it’s something you’ll get some enjoyment out of.”

“Okay…”

By that point, Rachel and Mackenzie had walked out of the room. Composing myself, I put my phone in my clutch and left to join them. I walked into the main room to find my folks and Glenn waiting with Rachel, Mackenzie, and their mom.

After getting compliments from most everyone, I turned to find Glenn staring at me. Looking at him, I said, “Glenn, now’s not the time for one of your inappropriate comments.” Sighing, I said, “Remember, I’m your little sister.”

“I know.” Walking towards me, he said, “I, uh...you look beautiful, Cassidy.”

Tearing up a little, I gave Glenn a hug and a kiss on the cheek. Looking at him, I said, “Thanks.”

Extending an arm, Glenn said, “May I escort you to the party?”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Getting ready

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
It’d been about an hour since the party started; everyone was either talking or dancing. I was sitting at my table, having just finished talking with my Aunt Cathy, watching as Glenn was dancing with Rachel.

The song had just ended and Glenn escorted Rachel off the dance floor. After giving her a quick peck on the cheek, Glenn walked over to me. As he sat down, I said, “I have to say, you’re being really mature about this whole thing with Rachel.”

“I’ll admit to being a little freaked out by the whole thing; much like I was with you.” Looking at me, he said, “I’m still not entirely okay with you being my little sister instead of my little brother, but I’m getting there.”

“I suppose that makes sense.” Smiling, I said, “I’d probably be the same way if I was in your position.”

Standing up, Glenn reached out a hand. “If it’s not too weird, would you like to dance with me?”

Taking Glenn’s hand, I followed him out to the dance floor. With my arms on his shoulders and his on my waist, we started dancing. I could see some people looking at us, especially mom and dad. “I missed this.” Looking at Glenn, I said, “I miss being able to do stuff like this with you.”
