I felt like I was being led to the principal’s office as Ms. Wilson led me into his room. As I went to sit in a nearby chair, I noticed a worried look on Troy’s face. Once I was seated, Ms. Wilson closed the door and turned her attention to me. “You mind telling me why you were eavesdropping?”

“I didn’t mean to, ma’am, I swear.” Getting scared, I said, “I-I was just coming to see if Troy wanted to watch the James Bond marathon.”

“How much did you hear?”

“All of it.” Sighing, I said, “I-I heard all of it.”

I watched as Troy moved around on the bed; bringing his knees up to his chin. He looked upset. The more I looked at him, the harder it was for me to believe he used to be a girl. His appearance was that of a regular boy – brown hair in a crew cut and a boyish face. There was absolutely nothing to show that he was once a girl. I turned my attention back to Ms. Wilson as she said, “I suppose you have some questions for us.”

I wanted to politely say that I didn’t, but I did have questions. Taking a breath, I said, “How did Troy go from being a girl to a boy?”

Ms. Wilson went on to explain how Troy had become a boy. I’d thought my situation was unique; so you can imagine my surprise when I learned Troy was also a recipient of the serum. I wanted to reveal my story, but I decided to wait until Ms. Wilson was finished. “You see, Cassidy, Troy is transgender; he was born a girl, but knew he was supposed to be a boy.” Sighing, she said, “After he came out, his grandparents and I decided to move to another town, where no one would know. He was 11 years old at the time; he had just started puberty but hadn’t begun to develop yet.”

I listened as Ms. Wilson continued speaking; how they’d gotten Troy on hormones to turn his female puberty into male puberty. That much I did know; since my cousin, Rachel, was transitioning from male to female. “Everything was going well until about 4 months ago; none of Troy’s friends knew that he was biologically female.”

I tried to contain my curiosity, but it still managed to seep through. “So I’m guessing this next part has something to with that Amy girl?”

Before Ms. Wilson could continue, Troy started talking. “Amy was my best friend Max’s twin sister; I had feelings for her.” with some hesitation, Troy continued, “So one day, during lunch, I decided to come clean with her; about everything – my feelings and my being trans.”

“I guess she didn’t take it very well?”

“She was shocked, but she seemed okay with it.” Pausing, started to get emotional, Troy said, “It was getting close to the end of lunch, so Amy promised to meet behind the school later to talk about it.”

At that point it became too much for Troy; he started crying, so Ms. Wilson took over. “Troy was all excited after that; thinking he was meeting with Amy to discuss plans for their first date. When the final bell came around, Troy made his way behind the school; where he was suddenly confronted by Max and Amy.” Sighing, Ms. Wilson said, “Max started yelling about how Troy was a freak and how he wouldn’t let him go out with Amy. I’d like to think Amy didn’t know what was coming, but suddenly Max starts beating and kicking Troy.”

I was shocked into silence; I’d heard of instances where people attacked others for being trans. I just never figured I’d meet a
victim of such an assault. “So what happened next?”

“Some 8th-grade boy heard the screams and came to investigate; finding Troy all bloody on the ground and Max kicking him.” Pausing, Ms. Wilson said, “He tackled Max to the ground while Amy came to her senses and ran for help.”

I was on the verge of tears myself when I heard all that; how could anyone do something like that. Wiping my eyes, feigning ignorance, I said, “What does this serum have to do with all this?”

“Max damaged Troy’s spine so severely that he was paralyzed from the waist down; because of the nature of the injuries it’s a miracle that he survived.” Pausing, Ms. Wilson said, “The serum was an experimental procedure that was designed to help paralyzed people walk again. The fact that it made Troy 100% biologically male was an added bonus.”

I was trying to fake being dumbfounded, hoping they wouldn't see through it. “Why would a serum designed for paralyzed people change Troy’s gender?”

“We don’t know for sure; it wasn’t something that we were told about.”

“Forgive me for saying, but you don’t seem all that surprised.” Looking at me, Troy said, “If I’d just found out you used to be a boy, I’d probably be shocked.”

I figured now was a good time to come clean. “Funny you should say that.” Looking at them, I said, “Because I was a boy until last week.”
11112111111111111111.title: Troy's Story

111121111111111111111.content:
Now it was Troy and Ms. Wilson’s turn to be surprised. Troy kept looking at me; as if trying to find proof for what I was saying. Ms. Wilson, however, looked at me and said, “That’s not possible, Dr. Webber said Troy was the first human test subject.”

I had to wonder if each of us had a separate doctor in order to keep us from finding out. “I don’t know who Dr. Webber is; but my doctor, Dr. Wilcox, said the same thing to me and my family.”

“I hate to ask this, but do you have proof to show for this?”

“I have photos on my phone, I’ll be right back.” Walking out of the room, I returned a moment later with my cell phone. Flipping to a picture of me lying in the hospital bed the night before the procedure, I said, “That’s me right before the procedure; you can check the date stamp if you don’t believe me.”

Taking my phone from me, Ms. Wilson looked at the photo closely; Troy leaned over to get a look as well. After a moment, Ms. Wilson handed my phone back to me. “Why would they lie to both families about something like this?”

“Maybe neither Doctor knew about the other, who knows.” Sighing, I said, “All I care about right now is that I’m walking for the first time in almost 5 years.”

Ms. Wilson excused herself, saying she was going to make a phone call. That left Troy and me alone in the room. As I moved
closer to his bed, he looked at me and said, “So you were paralyzed for almost 5 years?” pausing, he said, “I don’t suppose you want to talk about it.”

“You told me what happened to you; I guess it’s only fair that I do the same.” Pausing, I said, “You mind if I sit on your bed, my arms are getting tired from the crutches.”

“Sure, go ahead.” As I proceeded to climb into bed with him, Troy said, “I suppose, now that we both know the truth, neither of us really needs to the braces and crutches anymore.”

“We know the truth; but what about the rest of the kids in this wing.” Chuckling, I said, “I think I’ll keep using these until I leave.”

“That’s a good point.” Grinning, Troy lay back on his pillow and looked at me, “So why don’t you tell me your story.”

“It’s nowhere near as traumatic as yours.” Lying back on Troy’s pillow, I said, “I was walking across the street when a drunk driver hit me.”

I then proceeded to explain everything that happened since then; from my recovery to learning about the procedure. Once I was finished, Troy looked at me and said, “One thing I don’t understand; how come you got younger while I didn’t?”

I’d been wondering that myself. Turning to look at Troy, I said, “I can’t figure that out either; all I remember is Dr. Wilcox telling me that it was a side effect of the procedure.”
111121111111111111111.title: Their Reaction

1111211111111111111111.content:
Troy and I kept talking for a little while, mostly about our experiences. It was almost 7:00 when Ms. Wilson walked back into the room. “It seems that Dr. Webber wasn’t told about Cassidy and her procedure; something about wanting to compare the results later on.” Looking at us, she said, “He’s going to look into this and get back to me tomorrow.”

“That’s great, Mom.” Pausing, Troy said, “So what now?”

“I’m going to go home for the evening; I figure you must be tired of me spending the night here.” Looking at the two of us, she said, “Now I don’t want you two trying anything while I’m gone.”

Both Troy and I blushed; knowing full well what she was referring to. With a groan, Troy said, “Goodbye, Mom!”

Once she left, Troy and I decided to turn on the TV, flipping the channel to the Bond marathon. After watching the tail-end of Moonraker, I turned to Troy and asked, “If you don’t mind my asking, what were you like as a girl?”

“This may come as a total shock to you, but I was a total girly-girl.” Grinning, Troy said, “I was into gymnastics, and never wore anything but dresses and skirts.”

Troy retrieved his phone and proceeded to show me pictures of him as a girl. The girl in the pictures was a far cry from the boy lying next to me. Most of the pictures were either of her at gymnastics competitions or with her friends. “You look really happy in those photos. So when...”

“When did I realize I was trans?” pausing, Troy said, “It was right before my 11th birthday; when I had my first period.”

I could sense this was a sensitive subject for Troy. “Hey, you don’t have to talk about this if you don’t want to.”

“No, I’m fine; it’s actually nice to have someone to talk with that’s not being all judgmental.”

“I’m a girl who used to be a boy, it’d be hypocritical of me to be judgmental.”

“I guess you’re right.” Chuckling, Troy said, “Anyway, my first period came and I hated it. I heard some of my classmates talking about how excited they were when theirs started, but I couldn’t shake the feeling that I wasn’t supposed to have one.”

Hearing Troy discussing his period reminded me that I was due for my first period at any time. “The gynecologist said I’m due for mine any day now; I’m not looking forward to it.”

“You’ll get through it, just like I did.” Pausing, Troy said, “How about you, what were you like as a boy?”

“Before the accident, I loved being outdoors, so it was quite an adjustment once I was paralyzed.” Sighing, I continued, “There were some tough times after the accident, but I managed to get through with the help of my family and friends.”

“I wish I had that kind of support system after my accident.”

Turning to Troy, I saw him tearing up a little. Taking his hand in mine, I said, “You got through it, Troy; now you’re the person you were meant to be.”

“Thanks, Cassidy.” Wiping his tears, Troy said, “I hope this doesn’t sound mean, but I’m really glad we’re both in the hospital right now.”

Smiling, I said, “Same here, Troy.”

A few minutes passed before a nurse came into the room. Seeing the two of us in bed, she said, “I hope you guys weren’t doing anything inappropriate.”

“No ma’am, we’re just watching TV.”

“Well I hate to put a damper on things, but it’s time for you guys to go to bed.”

After acknowledging the nurse, I climbed out of bed and started towards the door. Before leaving, I turned to Troy and said, “I’ll see you tomorrow, Troy.”

“See you tomorrow, Cassidy.” Almost as an afterthought, Troy looked at me and said, “I’m curious; what was your name...before all this?”

“Marcus.” Looking at him, I said, “How about you?”

“Tracy.”
1111211111111111111111.title: Spending Time With Troy

11112111111111111111111.content:
I woke up the next morning to find Glenn sitting by my bedside. Turning to him, I said, “How long have you been sitting there?”

Looking at me, Glenn said, “Not very long; we just got here a few minutes ago.”

As Glenn and I sat in silence for a moment, I realized there was something I needed to get off my chest. Taking a deep breath, I turned to Glenn and said, “Glenn, there’s something I need to tell you.”

“Okay, so tell me?”

“I will.” Sighing, I said, “It’s just... afterwards, you’re going to look at me differently.”

“More differently than I am now?”

“Yes, differently than you are now.” Looking at him, I said, “Which reminds me; I’d really like it if you stopped staring at my chest. I’m your sister, for god’s sake.”

“I’ll try my best.” Pausing, Glenn said, “So what is it you want to tell me?”

I proceeded to tell him everything that happened yesterday; well, almost everything. I told him how I’d met Troy, and how we got along so well. When I was finished, I said, “There were instances, yesterday, when I got this strange feeling in my stomach, whenever I was near Troy.” Sighing, I said, “I talked with Kat about it, and she quickly realized what was going on. I’m attracted to Troy.”

I’d expected Glenn to be surprised by that revelation; his older brother turned little sister just admitted that she was attracted to a boy. But, to my surprise, he barely reacted at all. Looking at me, he said, “So you finally realized it, huh?”
11112111111111111111111.title: The Next Morning

111121111111111111111111.content:
I stared at Glenn in confusion. “What’s that supposed to mean?”

“I mean you finally figured out that you’re attracted to boys.”

“What are you talking about?” Getting defensive, I said, “I’ve only become attracted to boys since I became a girl.”

“Oh, please.” Rolling his eyes, Glenn said, “I’ve known you were bi since we were in middle school.”

“You’re just saying that to mess with me.”

“No, I’m not, Cassidy.” Walking closer to me, Glenn said, “Do you remember that time, during 7th grade, that Eric and you were wrestling each other in the family room?”

“Yeah, I remember being kneed in the stomach by Eric.”

“That’s not what happened, and you know it.” Looking at me, Glenn said, “You stopped wrestling because you were getting turned on by it. You tried to hide it, but I saw you had an erection as you walked away.”

I thought back to that moment, trying to convince myself that Glenn was mistaken. But I soon realized he was right. I remembered walking past the hall mirror and seeing a bulge in my shorts. “Oh my God!” tearing up, I said, “Why didn’t you tell me this sooner?”

“I was sure you’d figure it out eventually.” Pausing, Glenn said, “I just never expected you’d have to be a girl to figure it out.”

“What am I supposed to do now.” Crying, I said, “I like both Kat and Troy, but I can’t date both of them.”

Hugging me, Glenn said, “I’m sure you’ll figure it out, sis.”
111121111111111111111111.title: A Revelation

1111211111111111111111111.content:
Glenn and I were still talking when Mom came into the room a few minutes later. Looking at us, Mom said, “It’s nice to see you two are still close.”

“Really, Mom?” chuckling, I said, “Like me growing breasts is going to ruin my relationship with my brother.”

“I guess you’re right.” Turning to me, she said, “Dr. Wilcox wants to see you, me and your father in the conference room.”

Here goes nothing. “What for?”

“He didn’t say; just that he wants to see all of us in the conference room.” Looking at Glenn, Mom said, “Kat’s going to be here in a few minutes, can you keep her company until your sister gets back?”

“Sure thing, Mom.”

After getting my leg brace back on, for appearances, I followed Mom down the hall to the conference room. Walking inside, I saw Dad was already sitting there with Dr. Wilcox. Looking at me, he said, “How are you feeling this morning, Cassidy?”

“Well, I slept pretty badly, Doc.” Gesturing to my chest, I said, “I couldn’t find a good position to sleep in, because of the girls.”

“I’m sure you’ll adjust in no time.” Smiling, Dr. Wilcox said, “Have a seat; we’ll begin in a moment.”

As Mom and I took seats next to Dad, she turned to Dr. Wilcox and said, “What’s the purpose of this meeting, doctor?”

“It seems that I was left in the dark about more than just the possibility for a sex change.” Taking a breath, Dr. Wilcox said, “As it turns out, there is another participant in the study; right here in the hospital.”

As if on cue, Troy walked into the room with his Mom and Dr. Webber. He waved to me when he saw me; causing me to blush a little bit.
1111211111111111111111111.title: A Few Minutes Later

1112.content:
Unknown to me until later, mom saw Kat run out of my hospital room and caught her by the arm a little ways down the hall. "Let's have a little talk, sweetie." Firmly but calmly, she said. "Just us girls."

Reluctantly, Kat agreed and mom led her into the visitor's lounge where she made them both a cup of tea from the complimentary beverage station that was there. "I'm guessing you saw me kiss Marcus." Wincing, Kat said.

"I saw it." Calmly, mom replied. "However, I did not pull you in here to lecture you." She handed Kat one of the two small ceramic cups before sitting down next to her. "My sister, Katie and her husband, Greg were ten years apart when they were married, Katie being the older of the two."

"That's a bit of a difference." Surprised, Kat said.

Mom giggled. "Oh you should have heard the lectures my father gave that bold young man who was hopelessly in love." Bemused, mom said. "Nothing he said or tried would scare him away and Katie was just as much head over heels."

"What happened?" Curious, Kat asked. "Did they run off an elope or something?"

Mom laughed. "Heavens, no!" Amused, she said. "They waited until Greg was old enough to ask for father's blessings to marry her." She sighed, a dreamy look on her face. "It was like a fairy tale. Our father told Greg that any man willing to wait so long to marry the girl of his dreams is worthy of his daughter."

"So what are you telling me?" Wincing, Kat asked.

Mom smiled. "Marcus is likely going to regress back to age of thirteen." Calmly, she said. "If it happens, he is going to need someone around his age to watch his back." She then winked at Kat. "If he does not regress then, well... good things are worth waiting for."

With that said, mom quietly sipped on her tea while Kat did the same, her mind filled with thoughts of me...
1112.title: Mom knows from experience.

choices: Dr. Wilcox talks to mom and dad.
Dr. Hal starts the procedure early.
11121.content:
The next morning, I was awakened to an early breakfast which, much to my disliking, was a hungry man's breakfast. It was three buttermilk pancakes, three sunny-side up eggs, two strips of crisp bacon, two sausage links, a thick slice of hickory smoked ham, a baked potato and a tall glass of milk to wash it all down.

"You expect me to eat all of this?!" Stunned, I asked. "I'm not that hungry."

"The doctor gave strict instructions that you get a big meal this morning." Calmly, the nurse said. "Eat as much as you can."

While I was reluctantly eating the impossibly huge meal, a doctor I have not met before came in with my family who were understandably nervous.

"I'm Doctor Shawn Hal." Politely, he said. "I will be administering the injections that will hopefully restore feeling and movement to your legs."

"What do you mean by hopefully?" Concerned, dad demanded.

"The procedure is still in its experimental phase, Mr. Scott." Patiently, Shawn replied. "You were informed of this before your son was even considered for clearance to receive this treatment."

"How exactly does the procedure work, doctor?" Wincing, Glenn asked. "Are there any side effects other than him regressing in age?"

"The procedure is simply a number of injections that trick your son's body and brain into thinking it is still developing." Serious, Shawn explained. "All damaged areas of the body will essentially be rebuilt by his own internal systems."

"What does it have to do with me having to eat all of this?" Curious, I asked.

Mom, dad, and Glenn all looked at the huge breakfast I had been given then turned to Sandra, their eyes demanding an answer.

"When a human being is developing in the womb, they take raw material from the mother in the form of nutrients which is why their appetite increases." Calmly, Shawn said. "Your son's body will be rebuilding itself from nutrients already within him, hence the unusual side effect of age regression."

"So, without the extra nutrients, he would regress further?" Stunned, dad asked.

Shawn nodded. "Exactly."

"It's a small wonder why they had been gorging you the moment you came in here." Bemused, mom said. "You already look two months pregnant."

"Ha Ha..." With a half grin, I said.

"The procedure will be given to you shortly before lunch is served." Calmly, Shawn said. "By then, your breakfast should be for the most part digested." He then
left the room to talk to Dr. Wilcox. I did not learn of their conversation until later...

"Did you tell them of the newly discovered side effect of the procedure?" Worried Dr. Wilcox asked. "I understand that it only happened once in clinical trials on mice but..."

"It is listed as one of the many possible side effects but it is marked as rare." Lightly, Shawn said. "The chances of it happening are so remote why worry or even frighten them with it?"

Dr. Wilcox was not impressed. "Would you not like to know if your son faces the possibility of losing all of his Y chromosomes and reverting to the female state?"

He turned to my room to find my parents and Glenn leaving, presumably to get some breakfast for themselves. Later...
11121.title: The next morning.

111213.content:
I had just finished the massive breakfast and was about to buzz the nurse when four of them walked in with Dr. Hal following them in. All of them seemed nervous, which made me concerned. "What's going on?" Wincing, I demanded.

"There has been a slight change in plans." In a forced calm, Dr. Hal said. "The time for your procedure had been moved up." He looked towards the door as the nurses began to disconnect me from the monitoring stations then muttered, "Quickly now..."

"Can't it wait until my family gets back?" Worried, I asked. "They'll want to see me off."

"The procedure takes a little under an hour." Serious, Dr. Hal said. "You will be back in your room before they even get back from running their errands."

I heard the click of my bed being released from the wall before I found myself being wheeled out of the room. "Wait!" Startled, I demanded. "I just finished eating! Isn't the meal supposed to digest first?!"

"You have nothing to worry about, dear boy." Calmly, Dr. Hal said. "Just rest and leave the rest to us."

I was about to protest further, but I felt a slight sting in my arm that sent my mind spinning, before I plummeted into darkness...

It seemed like only a moment that I was out cold but regaining consciousness was a bit of a struggle. Everything, inside and out was in torturous pain. It felt as if my body had been thrown into a giant blender and reduced to a pasty mess. I heard myself moan, which hurt my throat.

"He's coming to..." I heard a familiar voice say.

"Already...?" Surprised, another voice asked. "I guess you were right when you said he was a tough kid."

I felt something cold touch my chest, causing me to moan again as even the slightest touch seemed to hurt me. "Sorry." said the low voice. "You are going to be very sensitive for a while." he paused then the cold object was lifted. "His vitals have all returned to normal, the worst is over."

I heard a few sighs of relief around me and then a 'beep beep beep' somewhere nearby. By this time, I was conscious enough to realize that it was a vitals monitoring machine. Only was I back in my hospital room? Or was I still with that crazy Dr. Hal. I tried to shift positions as I was very uncomfortable but it hurt too much to move and I moaned again. "He's starting to stir." I heard Glenn say. "Hay, bro, can you hear me? Open your eyes, man."

I did my best to do so but the light of the room stabbed my eyes, causing another moan to escape my lips as I snapped them shut again. A moment later, I felt the lights dim and I made a second attempt. This time I was able to keep them open and my eyes soon focused to see my family looking over me, smiling with tear stained faces. "Welcome back to the world of the living, bro." Smiling, Glenn said. "You gave us all quite the scare." He paused. "How are you feeling?"

I wanted to answer but it hurt to even moan. Still, I managed to quietly say two words. "All hurts."

Glenn did not hear me and asked me to repeat it but mom cut him off. "He said everything hurts, Glenn." Serious, she told him.

"You heard that from the other side of the bed?" asked Glenn, surprised.

Mom smiled. "When you work with children, sent to the ER for ten years like I have, you too will develop a good ear." Calmly, she said. "I'm not surprised that everything hurts... He went from a tall, well built seventeen year old to a short, thin thirteen year old in less than four hours." she managed a small grin. "Talk about a crash diet."

I weakly laughed at that but it came out sounding like a raspy cough, though I had a grin on my face. Seeing it, dad smiled. "I'm glad that you can still laugh, kiddo." Softly, he said. "I know everything hurts so, for now, just listen." He turned to a person out of my line of sight. "Doctor Wilcox..."
111213.title: Dr. Hal starts the procedure early.

1112131.content:
Dr. Wilcox appeared within my field of vision. "We were all very much concerned when we discovered that Dr. Hal had decided to go ahead with the procedure earlier than originally planned." Serious, he said. "I can assure you that he will be hearing from the head physician and the review board."

"You told us that there were other side effects we were not told of." Frowning, dad said. "Care to explain that?"

Dr. Wilcox sighed. "There was one case, just one, in a clinical trial on mice, where a male was literally rebuilt as a younger female." Softly, he explained. "I wanted to bring this to light, but Dr. Hal's stunt made your son's well-being our first priority."

"Are you telling us that Marcus might turn into a girl?!" Disturbed, mom demanded.

"The chances were remote... if done properly." Frowning as well Dr. Wilcox replied. "Only now that the procedure was rushed, the chances are... more prominent."

Mom sighed as dad fumed. "I'm calling my attorney." Darkly, he said. "This is a clear case of malpractice." As he retrieved his cellphone, walking out, he muttered, "You get a new medical breakthrough and the doctor is more worried about winning some award than the patient who is suffering... unbelievable!"

"I have made your son my top priority, Mrs. Scott." Serious, Dr. Wilcox said. "I will do all I can to ensure he make a full recovery." pausing, he added, "I'll order another run of morphine for his pain."

"Thank you, doctor." Patiently, mom said. "Just keep that Dr. Hal away from us."

"He has been removed from the case due to his stunt." Serious, Dr. Wilcox said. "He will be lucky to walk away from this with his medical license."

"I'll take first watch, mom." Serious, Glenn said. "You are a wreck, and dad is going to be on the phone for a while with his attorney."

I could not believe what I was hearing from their conversation. A mouse went from male to female in one of the test runs? I did not remember this ever being mentioned before, it was a bit alarming. With the added fact that the procedure being rushed might make the risk greater, I was feeling more than a bit nervous.

"We'll be back first thing tomorrow, sweetie." Interrupting my thoughts, mom said. "Glenn will be staying here with you tonight."

She blew me a kiss then I heard her walking out of the room before Glenn's face came into view. "Don't worry... little bro." Smiling, he said. "You and I had enough rounds of fisticuffs to know who's still the top dog."

I gave another raspy laugh, knowing my brother's sense of humor. Dad would always stop any fight we had by offering us to take him on instead. We were smart enough not to take on a retired heavyweight champion. "We... will... see..." Grunting, I replied.

Glenn smiled back. "Get well soon, bro."
1112131.title: Dr. Wilcox talks to me.

choices: Dr. Hal sneaked in to talk.
Mom and dad came for a visit.
11121311.content:
I woke up several hours later with a low moan, still hurting but not as badly as before. Glenn, who was watching television at the moment, heard my moan and hurried over to me as I opened my eyes and saw him.

"Good evening, bro." With a smile, he said. "Feeling any better?"

"A little bit." Wincing, I replied. "Everything still hurts, though just not as bad."

"At least you can talk better." Calmly, Glenn said. "You've been unconscious for nearly ten hours, it's seven at night."

My eyes widened in surprise. "I slept the entire day!?"

Glenn sighed. "I'm afraid so." Softly, he said. "I was scared that you had slipped into a coma or something for a while there." He paused, thinking. "Do you feel up to having something to eat, you haven't had anything since that huge breakfast this morning and I think the procedure took all of that out of you." He gave a chuckle after that.

"I'm not sure." Worried, I said. "I don't know if anything will stay down."

"I could run across the street and get you one of those nutrient shakes Kat got you hooked on." Kindly, Glenn offered. "You have to eat something, Marcus, you need to rebuild your strength."

I did not like the idea of Glenn leaving me alone for any amount of time knowing that quack doctor Hal could still running about, not that I'd tell him that. "Maybe... Maybe I can try a hot bowl of chicken noodle soup." Trying to sit up, I said. "The cafeteria should still be open."

"Only one way to find out." Grabbing the phone, Glenn said.

He dialed the proper number and got the kitchen on the second ring. "This is Glenn Scott in room 442." Calmly, he said. "My brother, Marcus finally woke up and he would like to order a bowl of chicken noodle soup, please." There was a pause before he turned to me. "Would you like some crackers with it?"

I winced. "Some white bread would be nice." My voice suddenly slightly higher, I said. "Maybe some milk to wash it down."

Glenn nodded, though he gave me a strange look and turned to the phone. "He would like a few slices of white bread and a carton of white milk, please." Calmly, he said. There was another pause. "Me? Oh, I'll have the same, thank you."

After ending the call, he turned back to me and smiled as he found that I had managed to reach the bed controls to sit myself up. "It's good to see you sitting up after lying motionless all day." Firmly, he said. "You better try to get to the bathroom before your dinner gets here."

I looked at my brother, uncertain. I knew that he he had helped me to the bathroom many times in the past but it was still embarrassing. Then again, it was that or have the nurses use some method for me to pee in bed, which did not appeal to me at all. "I... I might need more help than normal." Blushing, I said.

"I'm right here, bro." Firmly but kindly, Glenn said. "I'll get you to the toilet."

Slowly, painfully, I managed to slide off the bed. I was aiming to move right to the wheelchair only Glenn forgot to lock the wheels and it moved out from under me! Startled, I grabbed the railing of the bed and... stood up! I was standing! Standing upon my own two feet! Only before I could celebrate, the pain throughout my body caused my legs to cramp and I cried out, nearly collapsing onto the floor. Fortunately, Glenn was there to catch me and hold me up onto my feet. "Easy now, little bro." With a chuckle, he said. "One step at a time."

He stayed right beside me, helping me to steady myself as I took my first step. I felt my knees shake as I had not had the use of my legs in four years. Still, I was walking, actually walking! "I feel like a baby taking my first steps." With a half grin, I muttered. "It's exciting but yet so embarrassing."

"You're walking bro, that alone is a miracle." Comforting me, Glenn said. "Just look at yourself, you've lost five years and over fifty pounds within two hours after that quack not only went ahead with the procedure early but rushed it. Such a shock to the body would have killed anyone else!" He then gave me a grin. "Now here you are, ten short hours later, already walking to the bathroom."

I blushed at that. "I didn't think about it that way... I guess I am very lucky."

Upon reaching the bathroom, Glenn blushed as she pulled my drawers down and guided me down onto the toilet. "I'll give you some privacy." After washing his hands, he said. "Just call me when you are ready to go back to bed."

I nodded as Glenn then left the bathroom and closed the door. Unknown to me, he suppressed a shudder and whispered, "I just hope he doesn't get that weird side effect Dr. Wilcox told us about."

Minutes later, I was back in bed and noticed that Glenn suddenly seemed pale. I asked him about it to which he replied, "I'm just tired, bro. It's been a long day for all of us."

I nodded then turned to the door as someone had knocked.
11121311.title: An early miracle.

111213111.content:
"Room service." said a young woman entering the room with a food cart. "Hi, I'm Tonya. I heard that someone had finally woken up and is a little hungry."

"That's me." Shyly, I said. "I'm not sure if anything will stay down, though."

Glenn chuckled turning to me. "Well I haven't seen you drool like that since mom last cooked her homemade lasagna." Smiling, he said.

I blushed at that as Tonya laughed with Glenn. "I'm sure he's starving." Bemused, Tonya said. "I'll get him set up so he can start on his meal."

With that, Tonya pushed my bed tray into place and set up my meal in front of me before quietly leaving. "I want you to eat every last bite, Marcus." Imitating dad's voice, Glenn said. "You need your nutrients if you are going to get better."

I smiled at that. "Sure... dad."

"No back talk, bro." Smirking, Glenn warned. "Mom and dad left me with strict instruction to make sure you eat."

I sighed, though still smiling, and lifted the cover off the main dish. The aroma that kissed my nostrils forced me to moan with a certain delight. Before I knew what was happening, I was hungrily but politely devouring the soup. As Glenn worked on his own dinner, he occasionally glanced over to me and chuckled, seeing how hungry I really was.

"I think your going to need seconds." Amused, he said. "I think there's a twenty four hour take out place nearby. I'll call dad and see if he can pick something up, he and mom should be on their way to relieve me."

I nodded then we both quietly finished our meal before Glenn made a quick call to dad. "I can't believe I'm still hungry." Hearing my stomach grumble, I said. "That was a good sized bowl."

"I'm not, that procedure left you skinny as a twig which meant it must have burned an insane amount of calories." Looking at me, Glenn said. "Don't worry, dad is on his way up with some sandwiches from the take out place next door."

I smiled but it flattened as a thought came to me. "Um... Glenn, do you think that quack Hal is trying this procedure on anyone else?" Worried, I asked. "I mean, I know he was thrown off my case for what he did but..."

Glenn shook his head. "I wouldn't worry about that." Serious, he said. "We're not letting that mad doctor anywhere near you after that stunt he pulled." He sighed. "Look, I'm sure you were not the only person who was considered for that procedure. Still, I highly doubt the staff would allow him to experiment on unsuspecting people."

I shuddered at the thought of Dr. Hal experimenting on anyone as it seems he had done to me. "He seems too excited by this breakthrough, even though its not really his."

"I'll tell mom and dad of your concerns." Softly, Glenn promised. "Still, I'm fairly sure that is the last you've seen of Dr. Hal."

Later on...
111213111.title: Dinner had arrived.

1112131112.content:
"Knock knock." Peering into the room, mom said. "How are my boys doing this evening?"

With the biggest smile in the world, I replied, "I took my first few steps."

Mom looked at me, stunned. "You took..." She walked over to me and gave me a hug. "Honey, congratulations!" Happily, she said. "After the accident, we didn't think you would ever be able to walk again. I can imagine how much this means to you."

"I had to support him but he did walk." Smiling, Glenn said. "You should have seen him."

Mom smiled, tears forming but paused as she noticed Glenn. "Are you okay, dear?" suddenly worried, she asked. "You look terribly pale."

"I'm probably just coming down with something." shrugging, Glenn said.

"It's more like he's jealous of all the attention Marcus is getting from the cute nurses." Stepping in, dad said. He chuckled then turned to me. "I got you a few sandwiches to tide you over until breakfast."

"Thanks, dad." Smiling, I said. "I guess that procedure took a lot out of me."

"You'll bounce back, I'm sure." Smiling back, dad said. "I have a meeting with my attorney in the morning so I can't stay long."

"I can relieve you, if you like, Glenn." Kindly, mom said.

"No, you should be with dad when you talk to the attorney." Serious, Glenn said. "Marcus and I can handle ourselves for another day. Besides, Marcus is worried that Dr. hall may still be lurking about."

Mom sighed. "Our meeting with our attorney will be all about Dr. Hal." Firmly but kindly, mom assured me. "You have nothing to worry about. Take care of yourself, both of you."

She gave me a light kiss on the cheek before giving Glenn one and walked out with dad following soon after. Once they were gone, I turned to Glenn, concerned. "Are you sure you are okay, bro?" Wincing, I asked. "You do look very pale."

"I've looked worse." Smiling, Glenn chuckled. "Besides, if I am sick, I'm in the right place."

"I guess so." sighing, I said.

Thank night, I slept uneasily as disturbing images flashed through my mind...

I saw Glenn and myself at the gym, working out on the treadmills. Glenn was listening to his favorite tunes, running in beat to the music. I had stopped and was watching him when suddenly, I saw his chest beginning to slowly expand slightly with each controlled breath as he ran at a steady pace. His hair began to grow slightly with each landing of his foot. He began to hum to the music, apparently feeling nothing. His body became more slender before my eyes as a certain bulge in his sweat pants fell completely flat. Within seconds, there was no doubt in my mind, Glenn had transformed into a real girl. I turned to call his attention but screamed as I caught myself in a mirror on the wall. The same had happened to me! Then, I saw Dr. Hal looking into the window of the gym, a sinister smile on his face...

I woke with a start, raising a hand to my chest and froze... There was a noticeable lump there. Panicked, I ripped open my hospital gown to find that my chest was red and puffy! I began to hyperventilate in fear but managed to hit the call button. A tall redheaded woman I had come to know as nurse Fawn soon entered and saw my bare chest. A gasp escaped her lips before she called for more nurses. "Get Dr. Wilcox, now!" Firmly, the nurse barked. "It's happening!"

As one of the other nurses ran off to call the doctor, Fawn hurried over to me. "You need to calm yourself, Marcus." Firmly, she said. "The doctor is on his way."

"Glenn!" Still panicked, you gasped. "Glenn doesn't look too good! Please check on him!"

Fawn motioned for another nurse to look over Glenn. After a moment, she turned to fawn with a frown on her face. "Nurse Fawn, we are going to need another bed..."

Fawn hurried over to Glenn and sighed. "Oh dear..."

"What?!" Worried, I demanded. "What's wrong with Glenn?!"

Fawn walked back to me just as Dr. Wilcox entered, looking frustrated. "That maniac!" Angry, he fumed. "I warned him that rushing the procedure would increase the chances of the patients experiencing side effects!"

"Doctor..." Whispering, nurse Fawn said.

She whispered something to Dr. Wilcox and he walked over to Glenn before sighing. "How did he manage to get back into this room?" Furious, he demanded.

"He had to have done it between shifts." Frustrated, Fawn said. "That or he bribed the last nurse on duty."

"What- What is wrong with my brother?!" Worried, I demanded.

Dr. Wilcox sighed. "Get another bed and bunk Mr Scott with his brother." Serious, he ordered. "We have a huge mess on our hands." He then walked over to me and began to look me over.

"Please, doctor." Wincing, I demanded. "What is wrong with my brother?"

"We discovered that Dr. Hal had been experimenting on random visitors." To my horror, Dr. Wilcox replied. "Slipping them sleeping pills then performing the procedure on them while they and the relative they were visiting were out cold." He gave an angry sigh. "Fortunately, we caught him before too long but..."

"What?!" Panicked, I asked. "What did he do to my brother?!"

"It has been proven in clinical trials on mice that the procedure on healthy individuals bring about random results." Darkly, Dr. Wilcox said. "In a majority of cases, they..."
1112131112.title: I have a feverish dream.

choices: Later the test results on Glenn.
11121311121.content:
..."get a case of pneumonia."

I was stunned that a doctor, any doctor would stoop to such lows over any medical breakthrough. I could only watch helplessly as a bed was wheeled in and anchored to the wall near the door while a team of nurses then helped Glenn limp over to it. i could hear him moan as a nurse closed the curtain between them and I. "Will- Will he be okay?" Worried, I asked.

"We deal with cases of pneumonia quite often." Calmly, Dr. Wilcox replied. "I'm more worried about you right now."

Dr. Wilcox ran a number of tests including seeing if I still had feeling in my legs and a blood draw which he sent to the lab before asking me an array of questions from my pain levels to how I was feeling emotionally. As I answered his questions, I could not help feel worried about my brother. "He's not going to change too, is he?" Wincing, I asked. "I'm sure that mad man Dr. Hal rushed the procedures on those he was experimenting on..."

"Don't jinx him." Serious, Dr. Wilcox warned. "So far, all of the other five patients he had attacked merely came down with a mysterious case pneumonia or a temporary loss of use of their limbs."

"Doctor, my parents are going to want to know for certain..." Serious, I argued.

Dr. Wilcox sighed. "We'll run some tests." Whispering, he said. "Unless we find that your brother has experienced a significant loss in weight or height, I would not worry."

"Am I going to be okay...?" Sighing, I asked.

"I won't sugar coat this." Serious, Dr. Wilcox said. "You are going to have a rough few days. I'll order more pain medication and some Midol."

"Midol?!" Startled, I asked.

Dr. Wilcox nodded. "You are about to go through a second puberty only this one will pass in two to five days rather than years." To my shock, he explained. "If you think waking up from the procedure was a tornado, this will be a full on hurricane."

I gulped at that then turned to Glenn as the curtain was pushed back. He was softly moaning and coughing heavily, looking completely miserable. "Keep us posted, doc." Softly, I said.

"I'll order the tests as soon as we get your bother stabilized." Softly, Dr. Wilcox said. "I'll have the nurses bring you another gown." He then managed a smile. "Just ask for a nurse the next time you decide to walk to the bathroom."

I blushed at that as the doctor then left the room.
11121311121.title: get a case of pneumonia.

choices: will be fighting pneumonia for a while.
will make a quick full recovery.
111213111211.content:
I woke up the following morning to hearing Mom and Dad whispering angrily to the security and nursing staff in the hall. I could not hear what was being said and turned to Glenn to find him fast asleep in his bed. He looked even more pale than the day before, but at least his breathing was not as raspy sounding as it was earlier. I tried to shift positions, only to wince as I felt a bad cramp in my pelvic region. It felt as if I had done too many sit ups in one session but it was not the cramps I was concerned about. I also felt a warm dampness between my legs and blushed, thinking I had wet myself in my sleep. I paged the nurse before moving my sheets aside only to be surprised by the sight of blood in my underwear. It was not a lot but enough to force a shriek to escape my lips.

Nurse Fawn ran in immediately with Mom and Dad right on her heels. Fawn took one look at me and sighed. "Calm down... Miss Scott." Softly, she said. "You are having your first period."

Mom raised a hand to her mouth, stunned. "Miss Scott...?"

Dad was far from impressed. "Is this some kind of a joke?!"

"Far from it, Mr. Scott." Serious, Fawn replied. "We noticed the change when your son, or rather, daughter's vitals spiked around midnight last night." She then turned to me. "You are now more female than male." Softly, she explained. "Consider yourself fortunate it occurred while you were asleep, and could not feel anything."

She then began the process of getting me cleaned up while dad checked up on Glenn, still asleep in his bed. Once I was cleaned up, Fawn showed me a pair of panties along with a sanitary pad. "I think I should handle it from here." Politely, Mom said.

Fawn nodded then handed the articles to mom before walking over to Glenn's bed to check on him while Mom called for my attention. "The pad goes onto the bridge of the panty much like a sticker." Firmly but kindly, she explained. "There are several brands, some with or without wings which help hold the pad in place." She then placed the sanitary pad in place with me watching, then handed the panty to me. "The nurses will help you change the pad as needed."

Blushing, I put the panties on, wincing as I felt the soft cotton pressing against my now fully feminine groin. "Is it always going to be this sensitive?" Worried, I asked.

"It's basically new skin." hearing me, Fawn said. "It will be sensitive for a while but it should get better in a few days to a week."

"That lunatic Dr. Hal is in the hands of the police." Firmly but kindly, Dad said. "You can rest assured that this family will pursue him the fullest extent of the law for what he did to us."

I nodded then winced as I felt another cramp. "How long do these periods last?"

"Five days to a week." Calmly, Mom replied. "They'll get a little easier to deal with once you get used to them." A bemused smile formed upon her face. "You'll be getting them every month until you hit menopause."

I moaned, which brought a slight giggle from Mom and Fawn. "Welcome to womanhood, Marcus." Calmly, Fawn said.

"Marcus doesn't seem to fit anymore." To my surprise, Mom mused. "Maybe you might want to think of another name."

"Another name...?" Gulping, I asked.

"New name, new wardrobe, new life." sighing, Dad said. He pointed to Glenn. "Your brother may end up going through it right along with you."

I felt a tinge of guilt, remembering my brother's condition. Where I wanted the procedure done, he did not . Glenn was more a victim than I was. With a sigh, I turned to mom and dad. "What would you have named me if I were born a girl?" Curious, I demanded. "You had to have had discussed it at some point."

"We had our ideas, but we believe you are old enough to decide for yourself." Serious, Dad said. "It's a name you will be stuck with for the rest of your life."

I sighed, Dad had a point. After a few tense moments of thought, I said... "Cassidy."

Mom smiled. "I like that name." Politely, she said. "Why did you pick it?"

I blushed slightly. "Kat and I was sort of planning on naming our first daughter that if and when we ever started a family."

Dad sighed at that, seeing the sad irony in it all. "So you loved her too..." Softly, he said.

I slowly nodded. "Yeah..."

Our attention was turned to the door when Dr. Wilcox politely cleared his throat. "Mr. and Mrs. Scott, I'd like to speak with you in the hall, please."

"Anything to have to say, you can say it in front of our children." Firmly, dad said. "They have been through enough, we will not keep anything secret from them."

Mom gave a firm nod in approval, bringing a sigh from Dr. Wilcox. "Very well..." he walked up to mom and dad and showed them a small stack of papers. "The test results on your son Glenn are finally finished." Softly, he said. "I am truly sorry what had happened to him but he..."
111213111211.title: Mom and dad arrive.

1112131112112.content:
"... has begun to change into a girl."

Mom put a hand to her mouth. "You... You're sure?"

Dr. Wilcox nodded. "His body's producing high levels of estrogen, and his chromosomes are changing."

Dad sighed. "When I'm through, if that Dr. Hal ever gets out of prison, he'll be standing on street corners with a cardboard sign."

"First Marcus, now Glenn," Mom said. "What are we going to do?"

"Leave that to me," Dad said. "They... They're my daughters, I'll take care of them."

Glenn groaned, letting us know he was waking up. He looked around as we fell silent. "Hey, Marc," he said. "What's going on?"

"My name's Cassidy now," I replied , "and I've got my first period."

"Ouch. Glad I don't have to go through that."

Mom, Dad, and I all looked at each other.

"Glenn, sweetie," Mom said, "we have to talk."
1112131112112.title: will become female as well.

11121311121121.content:
"What's wrong?" Worried, Glenn asked. He then noticed he was lying in a hospital bed, wearing a hospital gown and his worry turned to fear. "What- What happened?!"

He scratched his chest, causing Mom to wince. "Honey, Dr. Hal performed the experimental procedure on six healthy people while they slept." Sadly, she said. "You were one of them."

Glenn's eyes widened as he again scratched his chest. "I'm guessing that my chest itching like mad is not a good sign, then." Gulping, he said.

Before Mom could stop him, he quickly pulled up his gown to reveal that his chest was puffy and swollen, with his nipples slowly forming into two small orbs. He began to breathe more rapidly as he turned to me. I could only sadly nod and lift my own gown to show him my own more defined breasts. "It seems we both got that one percent chance,... sis."

Panic flashed in Glenn's eyes as he threw the covers off of himself to find that his, or rather, her crotch was now flat. She turned back to me, tears falling. "But... that big meal you had..."

"That was to enable Cassidy's body to repair itself." Serious, Dr. Wilcox explained. "You, on the other hand, had nothing to repair, so, in tricking your body that you were still developing, it reset your body. This included some of its built up immunity, causing a case of pneumonia."

"Of course, it also brought the same risks." Wincing, I added. "Right, doctor?'

Dr. Wilcox nodded then turned to Glenn. "The test results showed that you had lost one year of age and about ten pounds in weight." Serious, he said. "Fortunately, you were impressively muscular for your age otherwise..." His voice trailed off, his expression dark.

Glenn and I both gulped, realizing just how lucky Glenn was. She was very slender, not to the point of being unhealthy but still noticeably so. My new sister noticed this as well and was clearly panicked by it. "What- What are we going to do?" Now crying, Glenn asked. "Is- Is that mad doctor still out there?!"

"He is in the hands of the police." Firmly but kindly, Dad said. "If he's smart, he'll stay there."

"Don't worry... girls." Gently, Mom said. "We are not letting either of you out of our sight until this is over and done with."

"But... your jobs." Wincing, I said.

Mom gave Glenn a warm hug. "Our job is to care for you two." Serious, she said. "Right now, you both need us more than ever."

Dad gave me a warm hug then turned to Dr Wilcox. "Unlike some other people, we take our job seriously." Angrily, he said. "I am certain the hospital has an explanation as to how this happened to not only our children but to five other innocent people."

"I am asking you not to allow this to leak." Wincing, Dr. Wilcox said. "Those Dr. Hal had attacked are not the only victims here."

"What else did that maniac do?!" Startled, I demanded.

"There are a lot of good doctors and nurses here who would suffer if this got out." Softly, Dr. Wilcox explained. "Would you really allow one evil man to ruin the careers and reputations of dozens of medical personnel?"

"But... how could anyone allow this to happen?" Worried, Mom demanded. "The patients here have the right to feel safe."

"I assure you that a strict internal investigation is being run." Serious, Dr. Wilcox said. "I truly understand your anger, but, right now, we have to focus on damage control." He sighed. "A legal representative of the hospital will be visiting you within the hour."

"I'll call my attorney." Serious, Dad said. "There is no way I'm letting this get swept under the rug without a fight."

"We still trust you, Dr. Wilcox." In a guarded tone, I said. "Just try to understand, that trust is on shaky ground right now."

"I... understand." Softly, Dr. Wilcox said.

I turned to Glenn as I heard her starting to hyperventilate, and had a good idea what was happening to her. "Mom, Glenn is having her first!" Frowning, I cried out.

Mom sighed. "Oh dear..."

She rushed over to the bathroom and returned shortly with a sanitary pad, while I paged for the nurse, who came quickly. "I'm bleeding!" Panicked, Glenn screamed. "Why am I bleeding?!"

"Calm down, dear." Firmly, Mom said. "You are having your first period. It's really nothing to be panicked about."

"Easy for you to say." Crying, Glenn grumbled. "I feel like I've been kicked in the nuts..."

Dad sighed, understanding the analogy. "Just ride it out, sweetie." Softly, he said. "Mom and the nurse will show you how to use a pad."

I winced as the curtain between Glenn and me was closed, and turned to Dad. "It looks like 'aunt flow,' as Mom calls it, is hitting Glenn harder than me." Worried, I said.

"Like many things, it's different for everyone." Shrugging, Dad said. He then managed a smile. "I just hope all three of you don't end up in that 'same mood' at the same time."

I could not help giggle at that then winced as a cramp hit me. "How do girls deal with this every month until menopause?" Irritable, I demanded.

"A little dark chocolate helps." Approaching me, Nurse Fawn said. "Not only does it satisfy your sweet tooth during a period, but it's high in potassium which helps your muscles to function, ideal for when those cramps hit." She handed me a bar of dark chocolate then added, "I gave a bar to your sister as well."

"Thank you." Blushing, I said. I turned to Mom as the curtain was pulled back. "What- What are we going to call Glenn now?"

Glenn gulped. "Isn't Glenn a unisex name?" Wincing, she asked.

"Well... yes it is." Softly, Mom said. "You can keep it, if you want."

Glenn sighed. "Let- Let me think about it."
11121311121121.title: Examining Ourselves

111213111211211.content:
Mom and Dad silently decided to leave Glenn and me alone for a while. As soon as they were out the door, I heard Glenn sigh. "My thing is gone," she said. "I had it when I went to bed, and now I don't. I didn't even get to say goodbye."

"According to Nurse Fawn," I said, "you really didn't want to be awake when it happened."

"Your voice is getting higher."

"I'm trying not to think about it."

She sighed again. "Part of me was looking forward to being the big brother. Now look at us. We're practically twins."

"I'm sorry, Glenn."

She shook her head. "No. Not Glenn." She stared out the window. "Dawn." She turned to me. "My life is starting over. I should have a name to match."

"I like it."

"Have you had a chance to look at the new you?"

"No."

Dawn came over and lifted me to my feet.

"My legs feel a little stronger," I said. Still, I was glad for the help getting across the room to the bathroom.

When I saw myself in the mirror, I couldn't believe my eyes. My hair was almost down to my shoulders. My face was definitely feminine. Nobody who looked at me would ever think I had been a boy just a few days ago.

"Think I'll look anything like this?" Dawn asked.

I said it again. "I'm sorry, Dawn."

"For what? You didn't do this."

"Yes, I did. If I hadn't been so desperate to walk again, you wouldn't have been in this situation now."

"Hey, I wanted you to walk just as much as you did. If it wasn't you, someone else would have been Dr. Hal's guinea pig."

"She's right."

We turned. Nurse Fawn was behind us.

"You're not responsible, Cassidy. I am."
111213111211211.title: Glenn gets a new name.

choices: Dr. Wilcox and his team rushes in.
Later, we are told of Fawn's condition.
1112131112112111.content:
Dawn and I turned to each other, startled and confused. "What do you mean it was your fault?" Cautiously, I demanded. "Did you help Dr. Hal do this to us, the others?"

Fawn gave a tearful sigh. "Six months ago, I was diagnosed with metastatic, stage four cancer." Sadly, she explained. "It is a cancer that spreads throughout the entire body."

"I'm guessing you went to Dr. Hal for a cure." Softly, Dawn said.

"Please understand, I was desperate." Crying, Fawn said. "The cancer was highly aggressive and moving into my skin, bones, organs..." She sighed. "It is very rare for such cancer to move so quickly and I was nearly out of time."

"Suppose I believe you." Suspicious, I said. "How was your cancer treated? From what you told me, you should not even be standing right now."

"Dr. Hal performed the procedure on me last month." Sobbing, Fawn said. "He gave me the injections slowly over a number of days. She struggled to compose herself before adding, "Which I now suspect was the way it was supposed to be done in the first place."

"How are you not our age then?" Unconvinced, I demanded.

Fawn sighed and produced a picture of a slightly overweight, elderly woman. "This was me before the procedure." To Dawn's and my shock. "I did lose mass and age, just as you did. As a retired nurse, it was easy for Dr. Hal to sneak me into the hospital as his assistant."

"You helped him do this to me, to us?!" Angry, Dawn demanded. "Just how do you plan to justify experimenting on innocent people?!"

Fawn opened her mouth to answer only paused as her cellphone gave a ding. She had a text message. "Excuse me..." Crying, she said.

I was furious. How dare this nurse who had gained my trust, only to betray it, brush us off so lightly! I was about to grab her arm and pull her to face me but I caught a look of panic on her face as she was staring at the text message, her body trembling.

Fawn, by now I am well on my way to Venezuela. This country has no extradition treaty with the US. Sorry I cannot take you with me but I left a little insurance policy to ensure you do not develop a conscience. It should be kicking in right... about... now.

Just as I read the text, Fawn began to convulse! Her body was shrinking and becoming thinner and thinner right before our eyes! Dawn ran out of the bathroom and hit the 'code blue' button while I stayed with Fawn.

"Help is on the way." Firmly, I said. "Stay with me... stay with me..."
1112131112112111.title: Nurse Fawn's Story

11121311121121112.content:
The nurses came quickly, pausing just long enough for Dawn and me to tell them who this diminishing figure was before taking her off for emergency treatment. After that came various investigators, taking Dawn's and my statements. Once that was over, Mom and Dad were allowed back in with us.

For a long time, there was nothing for us to do but watch as Dawn and I continued to change. Dawn's face became more feminine, and I began to develop an hourglass figure.

Finally, Dr. Wilcox came in, accompanied by our lawyer. "Mr. and Mrs. Scott," Dr. Wilcox said, "we've finally been able to reconstruct the chain of events that have brought us all here."

"Start talking," Dad said.

Dr. Wilcox then began to recount much of what Nurse Fawn had told us about herself, and what had happened to her. "Dr. Hal failed to anticipate two things," he concluded. "He got arrested before he could make good his escape plans, and Nurse Fawn seems to have developed a soft spot in her heart for your family. I say this because she came to confess to your daughters personally, rather than let them hear the details from us. Because of this, Dr. Hal's incriminating text message is now evidence against him."

"How is Nurse Fawn?" I asked. No matter what she had done, she didn't deserve what we saw happen to her.

"Fawn is sleeping," Dr. Wilcox replied. "Naturally, she is no longer employed at this hospital, both for her actions and her condition."

"Can we see her, talk to her?" Dawn asked.

"You can't speak with her until after we've spoken with her," said Dr. Wilcox. "But you can see her. Or, rather, what's left of her." Dr. Wilcox led us to her room and let us look inside.

I gasped. The figure on the bed, once the fully grown Nurse Fawn, was now...
11121311121121112.title: Later, we are told of Fawn's condition.

choices: Dr. Wilcox tells us of Fawn's fate.
111213111211211122.content:
I could not believe my eyes. Lying in the bed was a flat chested child, struggling to breathe, even though he or she was being given oxygen. Seeing my sad and shocked expression, Dr. Wilcox gave a sad nod of the head. "Nurse Fawn is now a boy around twelve years of age." Softly, he explained. "The only reason I am telling you this right now is because he is going to need a lot of help."

"What do you mean?" Worried, Mom asked.

"Fawn had no living relatives at her original age." Serious, Dr. Wilcox said. "That said, he is now an orphan, a ward of the hospital, and will likely end up in foster care."

"So he walks free for..." Annoyed, Dad started.

"Kent..." Sharply, Mom whispered. "Not... now!"

Dad, although understandably upset, fell silent as Mom turned to Dr. Wilcox. "You told us that the procedure tricks the body into thinking it is still developing in the womb." Concerned, she said. "How was she hit with this second run of injections? How could she have possibly been turned into a little boy?"

"The injections can be time delayed for up to several weeks." To our horror, Dr. Wilcox replied. "It was made that way for patients who first need to bulk up a lot more before the procedure." He then sobbed slightly as he turned to the window. "As for how she became a boy,... she was two months pregnant with one."

Everyone's jaws dropped as Mom raised a shaking hand to her mouth. She looked as if she wanted to scream but nothing came out. Dad seemed more furious than ever, only his anger had clearly shifted back onto Dr. Hal. "That... bastard....!"

"She and the unborn child were fused into one being, making her a boy and half her age." A hint of anger in his voice Dr. Wilcox said. "As a result, I fear his mind may be a blank slate at this point."

"A blank slate?" Wincing, I asked. "That does not sound good."

"If my suspicions are right, the boy in there will have the mind of a new born baby when he wakes up." Softly, Dr. Wilcox said. "Every trace of Nurse Fawn Winters will be forever lost."

"How will you know for certain?" Wincing, Mom asked.

Dr. Wilcox shook his head. "We have not yet had the opportunity to talk with him yet as we are still working on stabilizing his condition." Serious, he said. "We will know the instant he tries to talk." he sighed. "What is clear is that Dr. Hal had every intention to take her out of the equation completely."

I was crying at this point... hell, we were all crying. I looked into the window again at the little boy struggling for every breath. I could not help but feel for him. "Please keep us informed, doctor." Softly, I said. "Although he helped that madman, he is a victim, too."

Reluctantly, Dad nodded. "Your mother and I have a lot to discuss, girls." Softly, he said.

"We all have a lot to discuss." Taking Dad's hand, Mom said. "We need to do this as a family."

Dad sighed. "You're right..."

Later that night...
111213111211211122.title: A 12-year-old boy

1112131112112111221.content:
We were all thinking about Fawn as we returned to Dawn's and my hospital room. In fact, we were almost there when Dawn said, "Hey!"

We all turned. "What? What is it?"

"Look at Cassidy!"

I looked down, wondering if my transformation had reached some ghastly new stage. Then it hit me: I was walking without assistance.

Everybody rushed to my side to hug me and congratulate me. It went on for so long that my legs started to get tired. So we broke it off and continued to the room, where I could sit down.

After I'd sat for a while, Dad said, "The reason we came back here, before Cassidy's good news had us overjoyed, was that your mother and I wanted to ask what you two think about Fawn."

I turned to Dawn. "You first." After all, she was the one who was materially affected by Fawn's actions.

Dawn was quiet for quite a while. Then, she said, "If it wasn't for her, I'd still be a 15-year-old boy. But... I keep thinking about how she got into this, and why she did it. And I ask myself, Would you have done anything differently, if it were you? And I'll be honest, if Dr. Hal had come to me, and promised to give Marcus his legs back, but I had to do something for him in return, I don't think I'd hesitate a moment. As far as I'm concerned, what's done is done, and I'm willing to help him, in any way he needs."

I nodded. "Same here."

Dad turned to Mom. "I guess we're all in agreement."

"I guess so." To Dawn and me, she said, "We're going to adopt him."

Dr. Wilcox knocked, then poked his head in the door. "He's asking for you."

As we walked back to Fawn's room, Mom said, "Cassidy, your hips are starting to sway."
1112131112112111221.title: A family discussion.

choices: Mom gives Dawn and I The Talk.
A break from the drama, its someone's birthday.
11121311121121112211.content:
I blushed at that, then whispered back, "Can we go over this a bit later?"

Mom grinned before nodding as we entered Fawn's hospital room. He was a trembling, sobbing mess on his bed. His face was flushed with misery, self hate, and grief. His hands were held on either side of his head, shaking uncontrollably. The very sight of him moved me to immediately pull him into my arms, where he fell into hysterical tears. Dawn was right behind me, joining the hug and the two of us cooed and comforted him until he again became calm.

"You- You all hate me." Timidly, Fawn said. "Who could forgive the horrors I had done..."

"Understand that I cannot forget what you had done to my family." Serious, Dad said. "However, I understand why..." His face became stern, causing Fawn to hold onto Dawn and I in utter fear. "You were coerced, played and set up to take the fall, and the proof is in how Dr. Hal attempted to be rid of you."

"As such, we can and do forgive you." Firmly, Mom said.

Dad nodded then forceful added, "No one does that to our son!"

Fawn's eyes grew wide in a mixture of shock, surprise and disbelief. He turned to Dr. Wilcox who politely cleared his throat. "May I presume you intend to adopt Fawn Winters?"

"Fawn doesn't fit anymore." Thoughtful, Mom said. "How about... Finn?"

"I like it." Softly, I said.

"So do I." Nodding, Dawn added.

"What do you say... Finn?" With a warm smile, Mom asked. "Would you like us to adopt you? Want to become Finn Scott?"

Fawn, or rather, Finn responded with another river of hysterical tears. Dr. Wilcox smiled before nodding at Dad. "I'm certain our attorneys can handle the paperwork." politely, he said.

It was a touching scene in Finn's hospital room, until I felt a warm dampness and pulled away from Finn in surprise. "Ew!" The word came out before I could stop it.

Dawn realized what I was reacting to and jumped back as well. "I think Finn needs to use the bathroom, he's leaking a little."

Finn blushed profusely. "I- I might need help." Softly, he said.

"I'll help you... little bro." patiently, I said. "I won't let you fall."

I helped Finn out of the bed and noticed how badly his legs were shaking. It reminded me of my own first time walking after so long. "I'm still dribbling." Wincing, Finn muttered.

"Don't think about it." Serious, I said. "We're almost there."

Within a minute, I had Finn sitting on the toilet with his underwear down where I instructed him how to pee. His reaction was predictable... "That feels so weird!"

"You'll get used to it." Calmly, I said. "Just wait until you gain other boy issues."

"I'm trying not to think about it." Pouting, Finn said.

He moved to stand up but i pushed him down. "You need to shake it." Calmly, I said.

Finn face flushed. "I have to touch it...?" Disgusted, he asked.

"No, you have shake it." Serious, I replied. "Just as girls have to wipe, boys have to shake. Otherwise, you are going to dribble all over the seat." I giggled and added, "Dawn and I had our share of chewing outs from Mom over it."

Finn chuckled slightly at that.
11121311121121112211.title: A New Life

111213111211211122112.content:
It was the second time I turned 14, and my first birthday as a girl. The hospital wasn't the ideal setting for a celebration, but it's what we had.

The first present I got was from the nurses. "Every girl needs one," they said as they handed it to me.

I opened it, and found... a purse. "Thank you. I'll get plenty of use out of it."

As the nurses left, Mom, Dad, and Finn came in. "How are you doing, Cassidy?"

"I'm doing good," I said, showing Mom my new purse.

"Sounds like a good time to spring our surprise, then," Dad said.

"What surprise?"

"It was Dawn's idea," said Mom.

I turned to Dawn. "So what's the surprise?"

"Well," she said, "I'm 14, and you're 14. So, I figured, can we make it official?"

"Make what official?"

She spread her arms wide. "I got you a twin sister!"

Like I needed another reason to give Dawn a hug.

Naturally, this meant that Dawn got birthday gifts as well. We got a few outfits. "Enough for a few days, at least," Mom said. "You can pick out something to wear when everyone can come home, and then we'll go shopping." She handed a bag to Finn. "Don't worry, Finn, we didn't forget you."

"Thanks, Mom." Dr. Wilcox had told us that a stable and loving home might help with Finn's memory and stress problems, so we set our sights on giving him that home.

"Excuse me."

We turned. Kat was here.

"Mr. and Mrs. Scott, where are Marcus and Glenn? And who are these people?"
111213111211211122112.title: My Birthday

1112131112112111221121.content:
Mom walked up to Kat and gently urged her to take a seat, before gently combing her light brown hair with her hands, as a way to soothe her. This only served to worry Kat more as Mom looked into her gentle green eyes. "Kat... honey, we need to have a long talk." Softly, she said.

"About Marcus and Glenn?" Eyeing you and Dawn, Kat asked. "What happened to them?"

"Put simply, they were attacked." Firmly, Dad said. "Them and six others by a madman named Dr. Hal."

Kat's eyes went wide, tears flowing. "Are they..." She could not get herself to finish.

"No, we are not dead." Stepping up, I replied. "We're just changed. My new name is Cassidy, the name we had talked about giving our first daughter... remember?"

"I'm now Dawn, Cassidy's twin sister." Standing at my side Dawn said. "I was hit with the procedure injections while I slept."

"Only Cassidy, Dawn, and one other were transformed." Firmly, Dad explained. "That other person will require some more explaining..."

Dad went on to explain the events has they had happened, with Dawn and I filling in a few of the details, with Mom helping. By the time we were done, Kat seemed to be in a bit of shock and was silent for a long moment. "Did- Did they catch this mad doctor?" Finally, she asked.

"They caught him." With a strong nod, Dad said. "If he's smart, he'll stay in jail for the rest of his natural life."

Kat seemed torn as how to react. I knew I would have been if the situation were reversed. Only she surprised me by walking up and giving me a warm hug. "At least you're walking again." Tearfully, she said. "I'm happy for you."

She then turned to Dawn while still hugging me. "I'll do all I can to help you both bounce back from this." Serious, she said. She then winced and asked, "Have either of you...."

"I'm on my first." Wincing back, I said.

"Same here," Dawn added. "Same day, in fact."

"With twins, I'd expect nothing else," Kat replied. "Fair warning, The Talk is different for girls than for boys."

Before Dawn or I could utter a word of protest, Mom ushered us into the bathroom. "She's right." Firmly, she said. "Let's get started..."
1112131112112111221121.title: Explanations

11121311121121112211212.content:
Mom closed the door behind her and said, "Now, I know your father gave you The Talk when you were boys. So, I assume you know where babies come from?"

"Yes, Mom," Dawn and I said.

"And you know about some of the diseases that are out there, and how to avoid them?"

"Yes, Mom."

"Well, we're going to add on to all that. Get ready."

As if it were possible to prepare oneself for what came next.

First came a list of things that can go wrong in pregnancy and childbirth, followed by what felt like a blow-by-blow account of our own births. Before, Mom would occasionally remind me of how long she'd been in labor to bring me into the world, but now she was holding nothing back. And I knew why: one day, I would be doing that, to give birth to a baby of my own. She wanted me to know beforehand what to expect, and maybe do whatever it takes to avoid that before I was damn good and ready.

Then we moved on to diseases. While Dad had told us about the big ones, Mom told us about diseases that either only women get, or they affect women differently. And there were a lot of them.

Finally, The Talk centered around how some men treat women, and how some men will look the other way when it happens. The message was clear: She didn't want us to walk into such a relationship, and she wanted us to run straight out of it if we got into one.

When she was finished, Mom gave us both a reassuring hug, and we went back out into what didn't feel much like a party anymore.

Just as we came out, a group of boys came in. "Excuse me," one of them said. "We're friends of Glenn's, and we heard he was laid up in here. Can we see him?"
11121311121121112211212.title: The Talk

choices: A setlement is reached with the hospital.
We are released from the hospital.
111213111211211122112121.content:
Dad stepped up and urged the small group of boys out into the hall. He then pulled the door to the point it was almost closed. We could not see what was going on, but we could hear, and we all strained to listen. "Gentlemen, I assure you that my child appreciates your concern." Firmly but kindly, dad said. "However... he was attacked and is facing a rough recovery."

The boys in the hall gasped before giving a growl only a true friend would give when they hear another had been hurt. "Who did it..." Anger in his voice, one boy demanded.

"The one responsible is in the hands of the police." Sternly, dad replied. "Right now, we are all just trying to give the kid some space. She is hurt, and dealing with issues we hope none of you will ever have to understand."

"That's putting it mildly..." Wincing, Dawn whispered.

"Wait a minute... she...?" Surprised, a second boy demanded.

Dad sighed before turning to Dawn through the cracked doorway. "Are you ready to see either of these guys yet?" Softly, he asked.

Dawn sighed before saying, "I'll see one of them, but not all of them."

Dad nodded and looked at the three boys. The first to speak up was Dawn's height, with red hair and green eyes. The second to speak up was slightly taller and muscular, with black hair and blue eyes. The quiet one was a bit shorter than Dawn, with brown hair and brown eyes. All of them were wearing the school uniform. Dad guessed it was the only reason they were able to make it this far, with security having been tightened. "One of you can come in and see her." Serious, he said. "She is not ready for a crowd just yet, and her sister already has company."

The boys were again taken aback, but their curiosity moved them to quickly agree to Dad's condition, and the redheaded boy was allowed to walk in. Dawn knew him as Jack Strong. The other two were his brothers, Tex and Max. They were known to sort of look out for other kids against bullies and pranksters. Only it sometimes made them more of a nuisance for the school faculty, which was why Dawn was hesitant to join their little group as Glenn when they had offered. Jack's jaw dropped upon seeing his friend, now a girl in a hospital gown, and began to blush.

"How can you be Glenn?!" Shocked, he asked. "I mean, you're a number one hottie!"

Dawn blushed profusely, shifting uncomfortable on her feet moving me to pull her behind me with Kat taking a stance beside me. "Excuse me..." Annoyed, I demanded.

"Watch it, young man!" Sternly, Dad warned. "My daughters are going through enough as it is!"

"It's just so unbelievable!" Blushing, Jack said. "I mean, what could even do this to you?!"

"It's a long story." Serious, I said. "There may be more people involved in the attacks that left Glenn and me like this."

"That said, we need to keep a tight lid on all of this, until a full investigation is run." Serious, Mom said. "That includes you and your curious friends saying nothing about what you saw and heard in here."

I looked beyond Jack to find Tex and Max peering in with their jaws dropped. "I-I have to admit, I'm scared out of my mind." Shuddering, Dawn said. "I was lucky. The last person who was attacked almost didn't make it..."

Jack's eyebrows furrowed and his jaw locked before turning to his brothers. "Not a word of this to anyone until they are ready to come out with it, understood?!" Sternly, he demanded. "Give them your word! You know Dad's rule of breaking it!"

Reluctantly, Tex and Max gave their word to keep Dawn's and my condition quiet before Jack gave his word as well and handed Dad a piece of paper. "Our dad is a lieutenant in the police department, Mr. Scott." Serious, he said. "If you need help, call him."

Dad placed the paper with the number on it in his pocket. "Thank you, young man." Calmly, he said. "I think its time for you and your brothers to move on now."

Jack nodded but turned to Dawn. "I didn't mean to weird you out,... Dawn." Wincing, he said. "I'm just saying it as I see it."

Dawn, still blushing, managed to squeak, "Th-Thank you."

After they had left, Dawn collapsed into a chair, making everyone worry. "Are you okay?" Wincing, I asked. "Are you hurting?"

"I don't know how I feel." Honestly, Dawn said. "It's weird. My legs went weak, but I... didn't seem to mind it so much."

Both Mom and Kat smiled while Dad sighed. Though I don't know why, it took me a moment to catch on, and I sighed myself. "Does it really work that fast?" Worried, I asked.

"No, this is just an initial reaction." Bemused, Mom replied. "No girl knows how to react to their first swooning over a boy."

"I was swooning over him...?" Surprised, Dawn asked. She moaned. "Why me...?"

Mom giggled. "It's natural." Softly, she said. "He is cute, but it takes more than just one swoon to win over a girl."

Later...
111213111211211122112121.title: A father's protective role.

1112131112112111221121213.content:
Mom and Dawn accompanied me to my first appointment with the physical therapist. I was getting around better, so I didn't need them to help me along, but I appreciated the moral support.

When I arrived, the woman there said, "Hi. My name is Alex. I'll be your physical therapist. You must be... " She consulted her pad. "Cassidy?"

"That's me. This is my mom, and my twin sister."

"Delighted to meet you. Well, let's get started by seeing how strong your legs are."

This apparently involved pushing with my legs against her resistance. When that was done, she said, "Well, your legs are quite strong for someone who's spent four years in a wheelchair. But you're going to want them up within normal limits. Let's try some exercises."
