The exercises were difficult, but still things that I could do. After I did a few of them, Alex printed them out and said, "I want you to do these 2-3 times a day. Your mother and sister can help, in the ways I've demonstrated. Now, for your next appointment, it looks like you'll still be here at the hospital. Next week, though, you're due to be discharged. Would you rather come to the clinic, or should I pay visits to your home?"

"I think we'd rather you came to the house," Mom said. "With the current situation, we're worried about security."

"Alright." Alex made a note on her pad. "I'll see you here at the same time in a couple of days. Have a good day. Take care."

When we got back to the room, Dad and Finn were waiting. "I've made arrangements to take care of things at the house," Dad said. "Marcus's room will be the girls' room, and Glenn's will be Finn's."

"Who's taking care of that," Mom asked, "while we're here?"

"Kat's folks will supervise," Dad explained, "and those young men who were here earlier have volunteered to handle the heavy lifting and the painting."

I turned to Dawn. "Is that a good idea?"

"I know the Strong kids," she answered. "They want to be good, even if they sometimes have their own ideas on how to do that. More to the point, their word is their bond. If they say they're going to help us out, that's what they'll do."
1112131112112111221121213.title: physical therapy begins.

choices: a strange man comes to my room.
11121311121121112211212131.content:
Mom smiled. "It's a good thing your bedroom has a walk in closet and an en suite with double sinks." Calmly, she said. "You two will need extra time to get ready in the morning now."

"What do you mean?" Curious, I asked.

"Trust me, it takes a girl much longer to get ready in the morning than a boy." Bemused, Mom said. "We will go over it all when we get home."

"Speaking of which... when are we going home?" Wincing, Dawn asked. "I mean, I do still feel a little off but I think that's just because of the change."

"None of you have been cleared yet, due to the unprecedented circumstances behind your condition and gender changes." Serious, Dad said. "Right now, it's still a huge medical and legal mess the hospital is trying to keep a tight lid on for now."

"So until they figure this out, we're stuck here." Pouting, I said. "Terrific..."

"We don't like it either, honey." Hugging me, Mom said. "Your father has a meeting with the hospital legal team tomorrow morning. Hopefully, we will get more answers then."

"They are likely going to offer some form of settlement." Frowning, Dawn said.

"It's more than just the hospital." Frowning, Dad said. "The pharmaceutical company who funded this experimental procedure is involved as well." He folded his arms. "If word of this breaks out, it could ruin all of their years of research, not to mention their government funding. Their legal team will be at the meeting as well."

"Should we be there?" Worried, I asked.

Dad shook his head. "No, they will use your inexperience in legal matters to their advantage." Calmly, he said. "You just let me handle it." He cracked a grin. "This is not the first time I butted heads with big companies. They know not to play games with me."

Mom smiled at that. "You father was a boxer, remember?" Softly, she said. "There were many gambling giants who wanted him to throw the fight. He stood up to them and won."

"What should we do if someone from one of the legal teams approaches us?" Wincing, you asked. "Um... Just in case."

"Do not answer any of their questions or give any comments." Serious, Dad said. "Just tell them to talk to your family's attorney and walk away, then call me or your mother."

Dawn and I nodded just as the phone in the hospital room rang. It was room service, wanting our lunch orders...
11121311121121112211212131.title: Preparations.

111213111211211122112121313.content:
We all had an enjoyable lunch. It was the first quiet time we had enjoyed in a while. Dad even got Dawn and me to giggle a little, talking about his boxing career. "I had an opponent who danced around so much, I honestly thought he had too much to drink before the match." Smiling, he said. "I was in for a surprise when he suddenly stopped and tried to deliver a right hook."

"He was trying to throw you off." Smiling, I said.

Dad nodded. "Fortunately, I was paying attention and managed to dodge it before delivering an uppercut to his jaw."

"What happened?" Curious, Dawn asked.

Dad chuckled. "He went down in the first round where I met his sister," eyeing Mom, he said. "She jumped into the ring and clipped my jaw. It was the first time we met."

Dawn and I fell into fits of laughter. "Mom, you were a boxer too?!" Giggling, I asked.

Mom blushed slightly. "Amateur kick boxer, actually." softly, she said. "My little fit of anger disqualified me from my first ring fight, but I think it was worth it."

Dad smiled as he kissed Mom. "She knows how to hold her own." Calmly, he said. "We are a family of fighters, survivors, which is why I know we will pull through this."

Later on, Mom and Dad had left for a meeting with Dr. Wilcox, leaving Dawn and me to watch television to occupy ourselves. Dawn was dozing off when a soft knock came to my room. Looking towards the door, I gulped seeing a man with a reporter visitation badge. "I was uh... hoping to find a Marcus Scott." Nervously, he said. "I was told he was in this room."

I had an idea what the reporter was looking for, a story on the new and remarkable breakthrough that had been televised for months before I was accepted for the procedure. "I'm sorry." Shaking my head, I said. "Who are you, exactly?"

"I'm Karl West from Internet Viral News." Still nervous, the reporter said. "I am not exactly allowed on this floor, so I have to be quick..."

I had heard of Internet Viral News, they were a 'B' rated news source, known for inappropriate to borderline illegal means to get their stories. They had been sued many times for deformation, and, with the hospital trying to keep a lid on what had happened, a nosy reporter was the last thing they or my family needed.

"Do you have any idea why this entire wing's been cut off to all visitors except for family?" Looking at me, Karl demanded. "Do you know anything about the new medical procedure promising miracles to its patients?"

"I am sorry, but I have no idea what you are talking about." Trying to sound sincere, I said. "If you will excuse me, I need the nurse."

With that, I hit the nurse call button. Karl frowned hearing the dig out in the hall then angrily turned to me. I let out a gasp as the man then grabbed the front of my hospital gown, startling me into silence. "I know when someone is hiding something, kid." His voice dark, he said. "I'll be back, we'll talk more then..."

With that, he released me and hurried off, leaving me shaken. When the nurse arrived, I was in tears, which she noticed and hurried over to me. My new nurse was a towering, muscular woman with long black hair tied into a neat bun on the top of her head. She focused her gentle blue eyes into my own, drawing my attention. "What is it, deary?" In a heavy British accent, she demanded. "What has my little warrior shaking like a wee fawn?"

"There was a reporter in here." Tears falling, I replied. "He- He grabbed me..."

The nurse's face turned dark. "Not on my shift." Angrily, she said. She then hit a button on her call necklace. "This is Nurse Helga Holmes. We have an unauthorized reporter in the ICU!"

Helga then began to look me over, inspecting every part of me to which I said, "He didn't hurt me... he just scared me."

"Scared you enough into wetting yourself, lass." Softly, Helga said. She then showed me a small microphone. "He also left a bug." she nodded at my startled expression. "You let Helga deal with this, lass. I will help you to the bathroom and then change your sheets."

Blushing, I allowed Helga help me to the bathroom. there, I took out my cellphone and called Dad, who answered on the second ring. "Daddy... I need you!" Crying, I wailed.
111213111211211122112121313.title: A new complication.

1112131112112111221121213131.content:
"Alright, Cassidy," Dad said, "before we go any further, I need you to do something for me, alright? I want you to breathe in, through your nose, for thirty seconds, hold your breath for five seconds, then breathe out, through your mouth, for thirty seconds. Okay?"

I did as he asked, remembering the ritual. When we were kids, and we were too upset to speak clearly, Dad had us concentrate on our breathing. It calmed us down in a few minutes then, and it worked the same way now.

"Alright, Cassidy, are you ready?"

"Daddy, a reporter got in somehow. He wanted to talk to Marcus. When I wouldn't help him, he grabbed me by my gown." When I said that, I could hear Dad concentrating on his breathing.

The room phone rang. Helga answered it. "Hello? Yes, Mr. Collins, I placed that alert. No, I don't recognize the name." She turned to me. "Do you know a Karl West?"

"That's the man who attacked me."

Helga returned to the phone. "Good on you, Collins, that's our man. Hold him until the police can take over. Cheerio." She hung up. "Mr. West got in with forged identification. We've got him now, dear."

Dad came back on the line. "Are you alright, honey?"

"Scared a year's growth, and the contents of my bladder, out of me, but I wasn't hurt. I think Dawn was lucky enough to sleep through it."

"What's going on?" I heard her ask. "Where's Cassidy?"

"That's her now. She just woke up."

"Alright. I'll be right there. Your mother will finish up with Dr. Wilcox. Love you."

"Love you, too, Daddy." We hung up.
1112131112112111221121213131.title: The reporter is caught.

11121311121121112211212131311.content:
The following morning, I was back at physical therapy, where I pushing light weights with my legs to help strengthen them further. Dawn was placed under the same program, because of how frail and thin she was after being given the procedure without her consent. "You are both getting stronger by the day," Dr. Wilcox complimented. "With a little luck, you will be ready for the outside world by the end of the month."

"That sounds good to me," Dawn said. "I don't think I can take much more of those protein shakes with every meal."

I giggled at that, knowing that Dawn had been given high protein shakes three times a day as a way to bulk her up faster, due to her weakened condition. "They're not all that bad." Trying to be light, I said. "I've had a few myself."

"You'll be getting more of them as you near the finish line." Serious, Dr. Wilcox said. "We want you both to be in perfect health when you are discharged."

Summoning a little courage, I asked, "Doctor, do you know what happened to that reporter?"

"The one who grabbed you while I was asleep?" Gulping, Dawn asked.

"You need not worry about that man." Calmly, Dr. Wilcox replied. "He is in the hands of the police department, and extra measures have been made to ensure that does not happen again." He sighed. "This hospital is in enough trouble as it is, thanks to that quack, Dr. Hal."

"Is Finn doing any better?" Curious, Dawn asked.

"Finn still has a way to go before he will be ready to be discharged." Softly, Dr. Wilcox said. "Understand, he has gone through far more than just a physical shock."

"He's still in a lot of trouble, isn't he?" Wincing, I asked.

Dr. Wilcox sighed. "That is for the courts to decide." Serious, he replied. "In my opinion, he has suffered far more than any punishment the law can offer."

Both Dawn and I nodded in agreement, and our physical therapy soon continued with running on treadmills, while machines monitored our vitals. Nurse Helga was there with us, running on a treadmill of her own, encouraging us on. "Come now, lasses, it's just a light jog." Smiling, she said. "If you want to get back into any sport, you need to build your endurance."

I was grateful for nurse Helga's help, as was Dawn. She went through every exercise with us like a professional trainer, then walked us back to our hospital room when physical therapy was done for the day. "There is nothing like a good workout to build a healthy appetite." Walking into my room, I said. "I am starving."

"You are both first getting a shower." serious, Helga said. "If you rest now without soothing those muscles, you'll feel it in the morning."

I knew Helga was right and motioned Dawn to go first. As she got ready, I turned to nurse Helga. "Thank you... you've been a great help to us."

"Oh, pish-posh." Blushing, Helga said. "It's all just a part of the job." She then smiled and quietly added, "You just worry about getting better, lass. That goes for you, your sister, and your new little brother."

I nodded at that, and Helga left to end her shift. "She's quite a woman." smiling, I muttered.

"That she is." Entering the room, Dad said. "She and your mother worked together when she was an ER nurse. When I saw her, I immediately requested she be your nurse during the day."

"Who is our nurse tonight?" curious, I asked.

"I am." surprising me, Mom said. "It's strictly volunteer work, but, with the hospital being short staffed, they were happy to accept my help."

"Don't expect her to go easy on you just because she's your mother." Grinning, Dad said. "We both want you, Dawn, and Finn back on your feet as soon as possible."

"How did the meeting with Dr. Wilcox go?" Worried, Dawn asked. "He didn't mention anything about it to Cassidy or I."

"As well as can be expected." Calmly, Dad replied. "It was just to prepare us for our meeting with the panel of attorneys from the hospital and pharmaceutical company tomorrow morning." He cracked a slight grin. "This not mine or your mother's first legal rodeo, and Dr. Wilcox made certain those attorneys knew that."

"Enough chatter." Firmly but kindly, Mom said. "Get ready for your shower, Dawn. I will be checking to make certain you cleaned everywhere."

Dawn blushed profusely as she entered the bathroom, before Mom turned to me. "You are next, and you will learn why it takes girls longer to get ready in the morning and night."
11121311121121112211212131311.title: Nearing the finish line.

111213111211211122112121313111.content:
I thought I knew why it took girls longer to get ready: because showering felt so wonderful. Seriously, the only thing that could possibly be more exquisite would be a bath.

However, Mom soon set me straight. "Your first lesson: shaving."

"How long could that take?"

"You don't need to shave your face, but girls are expected to shave their pits and their legs. Since that's more acreage, shaving will take longer."

She wasn't kidding. One leg took twice as long as it took to shave my face. Also, there was the matter of occasionally cutting myself. Mom was there with small circular bandages.

"Okay," I said, "I'm getting the hang of shaving. Is that all?"

"Hardly. Now you need to dry all that hair."

Ho. Ly. Crap. Even with a hair dryer, drying my hair took forever. "How am I supposed to do this every day?"

"Most days, one shower and shave will be enough. But we're not done yet." She produced a makeup kit. "And there will be a few different looks we'll be trying out."

We began with a basic look, which Mom said would be good enough for school. Then came a more embellished look, which Mom said would be for hanging out with my friends. Finally came the most embellished look, which was for special occasions.

Then it was time to remove the makeup, which was done with cold cream and tissues.
111213111211211122112121313111.title: Taking a shower.

choices: your mom has to help another patient.
1112131112112111221121213131111.content:
A little over an hour after entering the shower, I stepped out feeling a bit overwhelmed. I had no idea the amount of trouble girls had to go through. Now that I was one, I had a stronger respect for their morning and nightly routine. I turned to Dawn who seemed just as stunned. "Here I thought we had a lot to do in the morning as guys." Sighing, she said.

"Welcome to my world, girls." Smiling, Mom said. "I won't seem like such a chore, once you get into a routine." She then handed Dawn and me a number of fashion magazines. "I got these from the hospital gift shop downstairs, they show the latest in teen girls' fashions and trends."

"You want us to pick out a new wardrobe." Sighing, I said.

"There's all kinds of different hairstyles in here too." Blushing, Dawn said.

"Just mark the pages that show the outfits and hairstyles you think you would like." Bemused, Mom said. "I want to get an idea of your fashion sense and taste in clothes."

Dawn and I turned to each other, uncertain. "I'm not sure what would look good on me." Honestly, I said. "I'm still getting used to how I look in a hospital gown."

Mom giggled. "We all have to start somewhere, girls." Calmly, she said. "Look through them, you might be surprised by what you find."

With a sigh, Dawn and I began to look through the magazines. It was not too long before she and I began to mark a few pages in the magazines. One that I found interesting was a pair of blue jeans with a baby blue shirt. Another was a simple skort and tank top combo that I had seen Kat wearing a few times. I marked a few skirts more to appease mom but tried to avoid the dresses. Still, there was one dress that caught my eye. It was a knee length short sleeve dress with a dark blue sash. There were teal inlays around the collar, which dipped low enough to show a modest amount of cleavage. Looking at it made me blush, but it somehow called to me, so I marked it as a possibility.

"Have you found anything interesting yet?" Wincing, Dawn asked.

"A few things." Honestly, I replied. "How about you?"

Dawn sighed. "I found a couple of things that might work." Uncertain, she said. "Tell me what you think, okay?"

I nodded and looked at Dawn's selections, while she looked at mine. Surprisingly, her picks were very similar to my own, only she completely avoided anything remotely feminine, except for one dress. It was a simple but gorgeous ivory ankle length short sleeve dress, with a lavender sash and beautiful pearl embroidery along the slightly dipped collar, showing a hint of cleavage. "It looks like you and I have similar tastes." Smiling, I said. "This ivory dress you picked out is very beautiful."

"It just spoke to me." Blushing, Dawn said. "You seem to be a bit more bold than I am."

"Or you're just a bigger tomboy." Smiling, I countered.

Dawn smiled slightly at that, then looked at the hairstyles. "What hairstyle do you think you would like?" Curious, she asked.

"I'm not sure." Shrugging, I replied. "You and I sort of always went with short and messy."

Mom, who had been listening, smiled. "I think a simple but elegant look would suit you both." Calmly, she said. "Avoid anything too extravagant for now."

With that in mind, I looked at the hairstyles again, and found a few simple styles that looked rather good for my long hair. Dawn smiled and marked a few of her own. Shortly after, mom took the magazines from us and looked them over. "Well, it seems as if you two are not the complete tomboys I thought you were." Bemused, she said. "You both made some rather feminine selections." She giggled. "Though Dawn seems to be a bit more cautious."

Dawn winced but Mom dismissed it with a wave of her hand. "I'm not judging you, honey." Calmly, she said. "I'm just getting an idea as to where to start with your new wardrobes."

We paused as a nurse came into the room and quickly whispered something to Mom and Dad. Mom hurried out of the room while Dad stood by the door. "What's going on, Daddy?" Wincing, I asked. "Is something wrong?"

Dad sighed and replied,...
1112131112112111221121213131111.title: Continue

11121311121121112211212131311111.content:
"Finn had a nightmare," Dad said. "It's shaken him up pretty badly. Your mother's going to help calm him down, then find out why it upset him so."

"Do you think it's anything major?" I asked.

"Hard to say," Dad replied. "If only he had more of his memories from before he was changed."

"Should we go talk to him, too?"

"No, I think the last thing he needs right now is a crowd of people, even if we are his family. Let's let your mother handle this. If she needs help, she'll ask for it."

"Okay, Daddy."

Dawn fixed me with a look. "Since when did you call Dad 'Daddy'?"

I shrugged. "I started right after that reporter attacked me. It just feels right to me, I don't know why."

"I do," Dad said. "Your mother called her father 'Daddy' until she graduated college."

"Okay,... Daddy," Dawn said.

*********************************************


After nearly an hour, Mom returned. "How is he?" Dad asked.

"He went back to sleep," Mom replied. "That nightmare really shook him up. There was a man in it who was coming after him, and was willing to go through anything and anyone to do it. He gave me a description." She showed Dad a drawing.

Dad looked at it and shivered. "That guy would certainly give me nightmares. Any idea who that's supposed to be?"

"He's a real person," Mom replied, "of that much, I'm certain. I'm betting he's part of this whole business."

"I guess we'll find out, if we ever meet him."

"I hope we don't," Mom said. "From what Finn said, this guy makes Dr. Hal look like Mister Rogers."
11121311121121112211212131311111.title: Finn had a nightmare.

choices: I later receive a strange letter.
111213111211211122112121313111111.content:
The following day, Mom and Dad left to speak to the panel of attorneys, from both the hospital and New Moon Pharmaceuticals, who had come up with the breakthrough procedure that had changed all of our lives. Mom made certain to keep us busy with more fashion and hair style magazines, along with catalogues for purses, makeup, and accessories. As she explained it, she wanted a clear picture of our personal tastes and styles as teenage girls.

"I wonder how everything is going." Curious, I said. "They've been in that meeting for hours."

"Beats me." Shrugging, Dawn replied. "They did say it would take a while."

I jumped when the phone in my room rang. Suspecting nothing, I answered. "Hello...?"

"Cassidy, it's Dad." Serious, dad said. "The meeting is over, and we are coming back up to you."

"You sound upset, Daddy." Wincing, i said. "Did the meeting go sour?"

"That... man Finn had a nightmare about was at the meeting." Darkly, Dad replied. "He didn't say much, but he was there, listening to everything."

"He didn't threaten you or Mom, did he?" Wincing, I asked.

Dad chuckled. "Your mother and I had taken down people twice his size, in both the ring and the courts." Calmly, he said. "My concern is what he intends to do while in the hospital, which is why your mom and I are coming to you now."

"Do you see him as a threat?" Worried, I asked.

"Let's just say I'm not willing to take any chances at this point." Serious, Dad said. "He seems insistent to speak to you and Dawn, but we won't allow it without us and our lawyer present."

Just then, I heard Helga talking loudly to someone in the hall. "You have no authorization to enter that room, lad!" Forcefully, she said. "You don't even have authorization to be on this floor without security clearance."

"I can wait." Calmly, a deep, dark voice replied. "I was merely hoping to introduce myself before their parents arrived..."

"You can introduce yourself to the elevator going down." Bluntly, Helga countered. "Security is already on its way to escort you if you do not comply."

I could hear the man give a frustrated sigh before saying, "As you wish..."

Moments later, Helga entered our room with a patient smile. "That was some fancy attorney for that pharmaceutical company behind the procedure that changed you both." Calmly, she said. "You need not fret, though. I know how to deal with unwanted visitors."

"Did you hear that, Daddy?" Wincing, I asked. "That man was already here but Helga sent him off with security."

Dad again began to work on his breathing. "I know." Furious, he said. "We just passed each other here by the elevators." I then heard dad say to the man, "Pull a stunt like that again and I'll bring more than an attorney, I'll call in the feds."

"You are overreacting, Mr. Scott." Calmly, the man replied. "I am only looking out for the best interests of my employers. My only crime was forgetting to clear through security."

I then heard the ding of the elevator doors before Dad again spoke to me. "That man is bad news, Cassidy." Serious, he said. "Your mother is on the phone with our attorney, to complain about this incident as we speak."

I turned to Dawn, who looked at me, uncertain and fearful. "Mom and Dad are on their way back to us." Forcing a smile, I said. "They have this under control."

"I hope so." Wincing, Dawn said.

Soon after ending the call with Dad, he and Mom entered the hospital room, looking angry and frustrated. "The meeting was productive." Serious, mom said. "A generous settlement was offered, which we are considering, but that man has us concerned."

Dad nodded. "He talks and acts much like the 'fix it' men from the unscrupulous big gambling racketeers I had dealt with during my career as a boxer." Serious, he added. "We will need to stay on our toes until this is over."

"Do you think we're in danger?" Wincing, Dawn asked.

Dad shook his head. "No, I think his game is to intimidate you both, and likely Finn as well." Thoughtful, he said. "It's a classic tactic to make those most directly affected drop the lawsuit, or at least agree to a smaller settlement."

Mom smiled. "Fortunately, Helga is not so easily intimidated." Calmly, she said. "She and I have dealt with bigger bullies in our time."

"Try not to worry about it." Calmly, Dad said. "We have another meeting with the hospital and pharmaceutical attorneys tomorrow, but it should be our last meeting. Hopefully, we can avoid a lengthy lawsuit, and simply move on with our lives."

I nodded at that, but I was still worried...
111213111211211122112121313111111.title: The next day

1112131112112111221121213131111112.content:
After lunch, we had another visitor, but this one was welcome, in sharp contrast to the last two. "Hi, guys," Kat said, "how are you doing?"

"We've had a scare or two," Mom said, "so it's good to see your smiling face. How are you, Kat?"

"Scares? How bad? Anybody hurt?"

"Nobody who didn't deserve it," I replied.

"The Strong boys are hard at work on your rooms," Kat said. "When I said I was coming to see you, they asked me to find out what colors you want."

"I think maybe lavender accents," I said.

"With a pink feature wall," Dawn agreed.

"Wow," Kat said, "when you two go girly, you don't mess around. Finn, do you have any preferences?"

Finn seemed almost surprised to be asked. "Uh, I don't know."

"Come on, Finn," I said, "you've got some ideas."

Finn was quiet for a while, then said, "I always liked the night sky."

"Okay," Kat said, "I've got plenty of notes. Mom and Dad can figure out what to buy, and you know who's doing the heavy lifting. Now, let's just hang out and talk."

We talked for another hour. I noticed that Kat sat down next to Finn. Probably just making him feel like he's part of the group, I thought. He's only 12, and nowhere near ready to look for a girlfriend.
1112131112112111221121213131111112.title: Kat comes for a visit.

choices: They will not talk without the other attorney present.
11121311121121112211212131311111121.content:
"Um... can I ask a question?" Wincing, Finn asked.

"Of course." Smiling, I said. "What's on your mind?"

Finn blushed slightly. "How do you keep this... thing from falling one way or the other?" Uncomfortable, he asked. "I'm constantly feeling as if I have to... adjust it."

I smiled at that, remembering my own discomfort at times as Marcus. "There's no real way to keep it in one spot, if that's what you are asking." Calmly, I replied. "You just get used to it."

"Getting them hit is close to having menstrual cramps, to give you an idea." Serious, Dawn added. "I know from experience that it will hurt all the way into your chest."

Finn turned slightly pale, but blushed again as Dad said, "Just wait until you get your first erection. Sometimes, there is no stopping them from forming."

"Enough." Firmly, Mom said. "You're scaring him." She then turned to Finn. "Like Cassidy and Dawn, you will be discovering a whole new world. We will help each other through it all."

Finn nodded then squeaked, "I got to go to the bathroom."

"I'll take him." Sighing, Dad said. "It's time he learns how to do it standing up."

Finn gulped. "Standing up...?"

"There are certain places where you will not always have access to a toilet." Calmly, Dad said. "You will need to know how to use a urinal."

Finn sighed, then reluctantly allowed Dad to walk him into the bathroom before closing the door. I could hear him instructing Finn to lift the lid and seat. "Here is where you need to touch it." Serious, he said. "You need to aim for the center of the toilet bowl."

I heard Finn moan in disgust before hearing him urinate into the toilet. "This is uncomfortable." Groaning, Finn complained.

"Don't think too much about it." Calmly, Dad said. "You're just going to the bathroom."

Once the sound of urinating stopped, I heard Dad say, "Don't forget to shake it. You don't want to dribble in your underwear."

Finn again moaned in disgust before I heard the water running. He was washing his hands. Soon after, he walked out, blushing profusely, with dad right behind him. "It's really nothing to be embarrassed about, Finn." Serious, Dad said. "Just one of the many things we boys have to put up with on a daily basis."

"Any other surprises I should be aware of?" Wincing, Finn asked.

"Well, soon your hormones will be running rampant within you, as puberty hits." Serious, Mom said. "It's a completely different experience for boys."

"What do you mean?" Curious, Finn asked.

"Boys who go through puberty early or late tend to become more aggressive and antisocial than their peers." Serious, Dad explained. "Painful growth spurts and heightened testosterone levels are at the root of it all."

"Trust me, I had raised two boys who were grizzly bears while going through puberty." Ruefully, Mom said. "You will feel irritable and agitated, but not know why."

"Don't worry, though." smiling, Dad said. "I have ways to burn off that aggression when it hits."

"For girls, their emotions become more intense, and tend to swing from one extreme to the other during puberty." Serious, Mom explained. "This can include aggression, but not as strongly as in boys."

"We- We're passed that,... right?" Nervous, I asked.

Mom shook her head. "You are all going through a second puberty right now." Patiently, she said. "Finn's should start any day now. Your phone call with dad after that encounter with the reporter is one example of the mood swings I mentioned."

"He should feel lucky you did not fall into a fit of anger." Serious, Dad said. "He would have been hard pressed to get away."

I gulped at that. "Dr. Wilcox told me that I was going to go through it in a matter of days, rather than years." Nervous, I said. "Why am I still going through it?"

"The worst is likely over for you." Calmly, Mom said. "Your changes seem to have stopped, but Dawn changed after you, and Finn after her. They still have a few days to go."

"Lovely..." Sarcastically, Dawn said.

We all fell silent as the family attorney, David Connor, knocked before entering. He was tall and well built, with short brown hair and brown eyes. "I am sorry to trouble you, Mr and Mrs Scott." politely, he said. "Mr. Victor Daemon, a spokesman for New Moon Pharmaceuticals, has requested an audience with you and your children, with me present."

I looked passed David to see a towering man with crew cut black hair and green eyes wearing a black suit. He was muscular, but nowhere near as such as Dad, but his stone-carved face and neutral, almost blank expression, sent a certain chill down my spine. I was not certain I wanted to talk to this man.

"This is a legal matter." Firmly, Dad said. "Hearing from some spokesman or point man is not going to change anything. In fact, it will only make things more complicated."

"I can assure you that I will do nothing to damage the legal standing of my company, in this or any of the other five cases at this hospital." Serious, Victor said. "I'm certain you all want a quick ending to this mess. I am in a position to offer just that."

Mom and dad looked at each other, both apparently thinking the same thing, as they firmly nodded to each other.
11121311121121112211212131311111121.title: Continue

111213111211211122112121313111111211.content:
"He can come in and talk to us." Serious, Dad said. "Just understand that everything we hear here will be used in the next meeting with his company's legal team."

"I would not have it any other way." Entering, Victor said. "Please accept my apologies for the misunderstanding earlier. I did get an earful from my employers for my lack of foresight."

Mom nodded but said nothing, and Victor took a seat near the door, while David took a seat near Mom and Dad, while Dawn and I remained in our beds. "Start talking." Calmly, Dad demanded.

"First and foremost, congratulations on your renewed ability to walk,... Miss Scott." Calmly, Victor said. "As you have seen for yourself, the procedure did exactly as my company has promised."

"Except for certain side effects." Motioning to herself, Dawn said.

"The hospital was informed of all the possible side effects in writing before agreeing to use the procedure on human patients." Serious, Victor said. "I will be happy to give you a copy of the agreement between this institution and my company, as proof of my statement."

"What of Dr. Hal experimenting on patients and their visitors?" Unconvinced, Dad demanded. "From what we understand, Dr. Hal was under your company's employment."

"He was subcontracted from this hospital to perform the procedure, due to his excellent track record in experimental medicine." Frowning, Victor said. "Dr. Wilcox was to supervise, as he was among the brilliant doctors who made the breakthrough." He sighed. "However, I can promise you, my company gave no such orders to experiment on innocent people without their consent. He did this on his own accord."

This surprised me. I did not know Dr. Wilcox was among those who came up with the procedure that allowed me to walk. Only, before i could react, Mom asked, "Does Dr. Wilcox work for your company as well?"

Victor shook his head. "No, he does not." Serious, he said. "My company merely duplicated and tested the medicated injections he and his team had developed." Frowning, he added, "Dr. Wilcox knew of the side effects. We are surprised he did not inform you of all of them."

"We did some digging, and found that Dr. Hal has been banned from three separate hospitals for performing unauthorized experimental procedures on patients, Mr Daemon." Serious, David said. "Why did your company see him as the right man to perform this procedure on anyone?"

"Although he was banned from hospitals for his unorthodox methods, he had never lost a single patient in his long career, and came highly recommended by this hospital." Calmly, Victor countered. "However, we were appalled to discover that Dr. Hal was more interested in further research by any means necessary."

"This still makes your company liable." Calmly, Dad said.

"The hospital could have easily denied Dr. Hal the right to perform the procedure." Serious, Victor said. "My company merely provided the medicated injections for use by this hospital, and approved the doctors this hospital had recommended."

After several further tense minutes of talking, Victor quietly left with security. Once he was gone, Mom turned to David. "What do you make of that, Connor?" Frowning, she asked.

"He's using a classic deflection tactic." Serious, David said. "Trying to get us to question the hospital and forget the pharmaceutical company."

Mom nodded. "That's what I got out of that too." Annoyed, she said. "Only why the game?"

"He's fishing." Darkly, Dad said. "He doesn't know what knowledge our kids have, or how much Finn remembers from being Nurse Fawn." He turned to Finn, who seemed rather shaken. "I'm guessing he got the sense you know something."

"I- I remember a few things." timidly, Finn admitted. "Only its all fuzzy, like a dream."

"We are going to need to piece together as much of what you can remember as we can." Serious, David said. "The more we know, the stronger our hand will be."

"What do you think that Victor guy will do?" Shuddering, I asked.

"Hopefully, nothing." Frowning, Dad said. "For now, I think his job is to defect as much blame away from his employers and onto the hospital."
111213111211211122112121313111111211.title: A reluctant meeting.

1112131112112111221121213131111112111.content:
"Okay, Finn," Dad said, "it's time to tell us everything you can remember about this whole operation."

"I'll try, Dad," he replied.

"Let's start with the man from your dream last night. You know who he is, don't you?"

"I... I think so."

"Tell us his name."

Finn was silent for a minute and a half, then said, "Death."

"Death?" Mom asked. "A man named Death?"

Finn shook his head. "No, not Death, but something related to death."

"And who is he in this mess?"

"He was our boss. Dr. Hal took orders from him."

"Can you tell us anything else?"

"Dr. Hal didn't like him. At all. And neither did I."

"Why is that?"

"I'm not sure. I'm sorry, Dad. I wanted to help."

"You did alright, son. You've told us more than you've been able to since you were changed. I'm proud of you."
1112131112112111221121213131111112111.title: Pieceing together Finn's memories.

11121311121121112211212131311111121111.content:
That night, Dawn and I were awakened by a blood-curdling scream.

"Are you okay?" Dawn asked.

"It wasn't me," I replied.

"Then who - ?"

"Finn."

We both hopped out of bed and ran to Finn's room. Mom was already there, guiding Finn's breathing.

When Finn seemed sufficiently calm, Mom asked, "Alright, Finn, what was it?"

"That man," he replied. "He was... he was on top of me. He... he was inside me."

I wrapped one arm around him. "It's okay, Finn. It was just a dream."

"No," he said. "I... I remember. It happened."

It was a while before he spoke again. "It happened when I was Nurse Fawn." Mom offered him a drink of water, and he accepted. "His name was Graves. Elias Graves"

Mom nodded. "He's not here now, baby. He can't hurt you."

Finn nodded and continued. "He's on the board at New Moon. When I told Dr. Hal what he'd done, he... hecomforted me. He... he told me that he had a plan. One that would take care of Graves once and for all."

"Did he tell you what the plan was?"

Finn shook his head. "Conscience, remember? I might have interfered. No, all he said about his plan was one word."

"That word?"

"Seafoam."
11121311121121112211212131311111121111.title: A Nightmare, and a Memory

111213111211211122112121313111111211112.content:
"I'll ask Dr. Wilcox about it." Serious, Mom said. "Maybe it has something to do with the procedure his team had developed."

With that said, she got up from the bed and walked into the hall, leaving Dawn and me to comfort Finn, who was still shaking. He was nearly calm again when Mom entered, looking pale. She motioned me to step out with her, where she carefully whispered, "I talked to Dr. Wilcox."

"What did he say?" Worried, I asked in a whisper.

Mom sighed. "Seafoam is what they called an overdose of the injections for the procedure." To my horror, she replied. "It causes the body to reduce to literally nothing but a pasty mess."

"Do you think Dr. Hal did that to this Elias Graves?" Shaken, I asked.

"I'm not sure." Worried, Mom said. "Still, we now have a better idea of the type of monsters we are up against." She gave me a warm hug. "Remain on your guard, Cassidy."

I gulped, worried for not only myself but my entire family. "We need to go to the police." Whispering, I said. "What we have so far..."

"Is the account of a frightened and traumatized 'twelve-year-old' boy." Firmly, Mom said as she released me. "As sad as it may seem, that does not hold a lot of water without strong evidence to support it."

I sighed at that, looking into Finn's room, where Dawn was still comforting my new little brother. "What should we do?" Whispering, I asked.

"Dr. Wilcox has called in his team." Serious, Mom said. "If what Finn said is accurate, Dr Hal may have tried to turn their miracle cure into a biological weapon."
111213111211211122112121313111111211112.title: A dark realization.

choices: I am visited by another patient.
1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.content:
I could not sleep that night, after hearing of what had happened to Finn, and the man who had attacked him when he was Nurse Fawn. I wondered if Dr. Hal had tried to overdose Fawn, as he might have done to this Elias Graves who had attacked her. I became fearful that the mad Dr. Hal or one of his lackeys might try to do that to me or, worse, Dawn or Mom and Dad. With all of the fears running through my mind, I could not help cry, curled up in a tiny ball on my bed. I was terrified of what might happen...

"Are you okay, honey?" Sitting beside me, Mom asked. "Are you having nightmares?"

"I'm scared out of my mind, Mom." Softly, I admitted. "What if Dr. Hal has more people working for him here in the hospital..."

"Dr. Hal is dead, Cassidy." Surprising me, Mom said. "He was found murdered in his cell."

I turned pale. "Murdered...?"

Mom nodded. "A single bullet to the head, execution style." Serious, she said. "Someone did not want him to go to trial."

I gulped at that, my fears growing. "Where does that put us?" Worried, I asked.

Mom placed a gentle hand onto my cheek. "Hopefully, it will put us all on a clear path to picking up the pieces of our lives." Softly, she said. "Dr. Wilcox and his team will be joining us at the final meeting with the hospital and New Moon legal teams."

I sighed, still shaken. "I'm still scared..."

Mom gave me a gentle kiss on the forehead. "Try not to worry. Your father and I have arranged for you, Dawn, and Finn to be closely watched while we are at the meeting."

"Who?" Curious, I asked.

Mom smiled. "They insisted." Motioning to the door, she said.

I gave a rueful smile seeing Jack and Tex standing just outside my room with Max standing outside of Finn's room. With them was their father, Lieutenant Samuel Strong of the local police department, in full uniform. He politely knocked before entering. He was just as tall and muscular as Dad, with short brown hair and brown eyes.

"Your father has asked me to watch over you two and your brother, until you are discharged from the hospital." Firmly but kindly, he said. "My boys are part of the junior ROTC, I am only letting them help tonight. They will be relieved by other police officers in the morning."

"No one is going to pester you with us on the job, girls." Smiling, Jack said.

Dad smiled. "Back to your post, private." Firmly, he ordered.

Jack sighed before saluting and returning to his place just outside the door. I could not help smile at him. "They're kind of sweet in their own way." Softly, I said.

Samuel smiled. "Well, they try."
1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.title: Dad orders his own security.

1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.content:
I'm not sure when I went back to sleep, but I was awakened by someone lifting the sheet of my bed. Turning to look, I saw a boy. "WHAT?"

Dawn was up like a shot, and Jack and Tex came running in, turning on the light. "Explain yourself," Jack said, "fast."

"I'm sorry," the boy said, in a hoarse voice. "I couldn't sleep, so I was walking around. I must have gotten turned around. My name's Cameron."

"Charmed," I said. "My name's Cassidy. This is my sister, Dawn. The gentlemen who were about to kick your ass and take your name are Jack and Tex. We haven't had a great night for sleeping, either."

"What's with all the security around you?"

"Long story," Dawn said. "Suffice it to say, we need it." Turning to the boys, she said, "I think you guys can relax."

As Jack and Tex left the room, I asked Cameron, "How'd you get stuck in the hospital?"

"Weirdest thing," he replied. "I was visiting my grandma, and, suddenly, I came down with pneumonia. Just out of the blue. There's a rumor that somebody did it to me on purpose. Don't ask me why."

"It's not a rumor," I said. "They'll be settling the matter soon. Why don't you try to find your room, so we can all go back to sleep?"
1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.title: I am visited by another patient.

choices: Dawn, Finn, and I are at the next meeting.
1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.content:
The following morning, I woke up to a number of angry and panicked shouts in the hall. I could hear the nursing staff pleading with the people to go back to their rooms. I got up from my bed and walked to the door to find Mom quickly entering, with Dad right behind her. "What's going on?" Worried, I asked. "What's with all the shouting out there?"

"Well, the cat's out of the bag, so to speak." sighing, Mom said.

"Someone let it slip that the mysterious cases of pneumonia were not just a coincidence, but a deliberate attack on visitors to the hospital." Serious, Dad said. "It's caused a panic among the patients and those visiting them."

I gulped at that. "A young boy, one of the pneumonia suffering patients, walked in on us last night, thinking it was his room." Softly, I explained. "He told me that there was a rumor flying around that his pneumonia was given to him on purpose. I said it wasn't a rumor and that they'll be settling it soon."

Mom rolled her eyes. "I'm afraid you just opened a can of worms, honey." Scolding, she said.

"Actually, I'm glad it happened." Serious, Dad said. "The hospital was going to try to sweep this under the rug." He frowned. "What if one or more of those people were given the time delayed injections, like Finn?"

I shuddered at that. "Are we in trouble?"

Dad shook his head. "You did nothing wrong, pumpkin." Serious, he said. "The truth would have come out eventually, one way or another."

The shouting in the halls died down about an hour later, with Dr. Wilcox speaking to the patients before entering my room. "I do not know how this got out, but the timing could not have been worse, as we have new information regarding Dr. Hal through a journal he had been writing."

"What did you learn?" Wincing, Mom asked.

"Dr. Hal was actually working for a rival pharmaceutical company called Elite Visions." To my surprise, he explained. "They were also bidding to purchase my team's breakthrough, but New Moon won out in the end."

"So they sneaked him in through the hospital system, and marked him as highly recommended to perform the procedure." Frowning, Dad said. "Finn, formally Nurse Fawn, was his first victim."

"What was with the experimenting then?" Darkly curious, I demanded.

"To undermine the research and buy the breakthrough from New Moon dirt cheap." Frowning, Mom said. "I'm guessing they're counting on New Moon and this hospital to be sued for all the mayhem, costing them both millions."

Dr. Wilcox nodded. "The only issue is proving it." Serious, he said. "Dr Hal is dead, so he cannot collaborate what he had written, and Finn's memory is questionable, at best."

"What did you tell them out there?" Worried, Dawn asked.

"I told them that we are cooperating with the police, who are investigating the attacks." Serious, Dr. Wilcox explained. "However, until we hear from them, all we can do is focus on treating the victims as best we can, while avoiding a panic."

"What does this new information do to our case?" Serious, Dad demanded.

"It strengthens it." Starting us, Victor said. We turned to see him standing at the door with our attorney, David at his side. "I did go through security this time."

"What do you mean it strengthens our case?" Curious, Mom asked.

"You now have the power of my company's legal team on your side." Serious, Victor said. "If Dr. Hal's journal is accurate, our rival company has placed innocent lives in jeopardy just to make us look bad." He turned to Dr. Wilcox. "Likewise to this hospital. I say we combine our efforts to settle this matter for all of the victims in question."

David nodded. "I agree."

Mom and Dad nodded as well. "Agreed."

I sighed, seeing everyone shaking hands, forming a pact. Indeed, I had opened a can of worms. Only my fear was who had killed Dr Hal, and if any of us were next...
1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.title: Opening a can of worms.

choices: Cameron has physical therapy with us.
1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.content:
The following morning, Cameron came to my room again and talked to the police officer on duty before entering. Both Dawn and I had both just finished breakfast and were watching television. "Excuse me for interrupting." timidly, he said. "I was hoping we could talk some more." He gave Dawn a shy wave. "Hi..."

Dawn smiled back politely. "Good morning."

"What did you want to talk about?" Curious, I asked.

Cameron sighed, blushing slightly. "I'm sorry if I got any of you in trouble yesterday." Frowning, he said. "When you told me it wasn't a rumor, I got scared and ran to Grandma and told her. She then got on the phone with her attorney and the police."

"It's okay, Cameron." Honestly, I said. "Daddy told us that the truth would have come out eventually one way or another, so it's good that it happened."

"Do you know who did it?" Wincing, Cameron asked.

"That person is dead, young man." Softly, Mom said. "The police are investigating it, but it was kept quiet to avoid a panic through the entire hospital."

"Sorry..." wincing, Cameron said.

"There's nothing to be sorry about, young man." Kindly, Mom said. "You just worry about getting better."

Cameron nodded then turned to Dawn, blushing more. "Are any of those boys who confronted me last night, well, you know... seeing you?"

Dawn blushed at that before shyly replying... "I'm a bit young to be dating just yet, I think."

Mom smiled, a look of bemusement on her face. "You are a bit too young yourself, I believe." Calmly, she said. "Why don't you two start as friends, and see where it goes from there?"

Although they were both blushing badly, Dawn and Cameron nodded in agreement. I had to bite my tongue to keep myself from laughing at the scene. It could have very easily been me on the receiving end of that shy pick up line. We talked to Cameron for a few minutes longer before a young nurse entered and sighed seeing him.

"Mr. West, you know you are not supposed to be wandering the halls." Lightly scolding, she said. "Please return to your room."

"He didn't mean any harm." Calmly, Mom said.

The nurse smiled. "The poor boy can't sit still to save his life." Bemused, she said. "He's stir-crazy with boredom."

"Maybe he can go to physical therapy with us today." Smiling, Dawn said. "It will give him something to do and use up some of that built up energy."

"That might help." Smiling back, the nurse said. "I'll check with his grandmother and see if she will allow it."

With that said, the nurse escorted Cameron out of my room and down the hall. Dawn walked to the door and watched him leave to find that he was only three doors down the hall. "I see you like him too." Bemused, Mom said.

Dawn turned around, blushing. "I was just worried for him, that's all." Softly, she said. "He was polite, and he seems like a nice kid."

Mom nodded then turned to me. "You too will face multiple suitors before you know it."

I blushed at that.

Just before lunch, we were escorted to physical therapy...
1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.title: I meet Cameron again.

1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.content:
I smiled upon seeing Cameron waiting for us when we were escorted to physical therapy. Both he and Dawn shyly waved at each other before Nurse Helga spoke up. "Okay, kids, let's get started with the leg presses."

Helga positioned us so that Finn was between Dawn and Cameron, and we started our physical therapy, with her watching our progress. "This is harder than it looks." Wincing, Cameron said.

"That means you have lost some muscle." Serious, Helga said. "Not to worry, though, we will build that right back up."

I giggled at that. "Prepare yourself for a workout." Bemused, I said. "Nurse Helga takes fitness very seriously."

"For good reason." smiling, Helga said. "I did not get as strong as I am by sitting on the couch watching television."

Dawn and I smiled at each other as physical therapy continued, with Helga pushing Cameron to better himself, not only in exercise, but in diet and sports. "A strong body is equal to good health, young man." Serious, she said. "Diet, and constant exercise through sports, will also build your immunity to illness..."

When physical therapy eventually ended, we were all escorted back to our rooms, tired but feeling good, except for Cameron, who was just starting his therapy. "I am exhausted." Moaning, he complained. "I pulled muscles I did not know I had."

Dawn giggled at that. "We felt the same way after our first run of physical therapy, but it does get easier as your body gets used to it."

"Just make certain you take a hot shower to soothe those muscles, if you don't want to feel worse in the morning." Calmly, I said. "Take it from someone who knows from experience."

Cameron nodded. "I'll do that." Softly, he said.

We parted ways as we entered our room to find Mom, Dad, and David waiting for us. Seeing them, Dawn, Finn, and I sighed. "More trouble...?" Wincing, I asked.

Mom shook her head, a warm smile on her face. "For once, we have some good news." Calmly, she said. "A cash settlement has been agreed upon."

"The hospital and New Moon Pharmaceuticals have agreed to pay us and the other victims a handsome cash settlement." Serious, David said. "They in turn will sue Elite Visions Pharmaceuticals for the damages, as we have been able to corroborate Dr Hal's notes with audio notes he had kept in another safe."

"What does that mean for us?" Curious, Finn asked.

Dad smiled. "The moment your physical therapy is done, you are all being discharged." Softly, he said. "From there, we can place this nightmare behind us and move on with our lives."

Dawn and I hugged each other, crying happy tears, with Finn joining us. It was the best news we had heard in quite a while.
1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.title: Cameron has physical therapy with us.

1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.content:
At long last, the three of us were pronounced fit enough to be discharged. "Feels like I've been in the hospital for years," I said. "Let's get this funk off of us, and get the funk out of here."

I showered first. When I finished drying off, I let Dawn take her shower, and went back into the room. Mom was waiting there, with two bags. Handing me one, she said, "Let's get you dressed, shall we?"

I struggled a bit with the bra, but I eventually got it on. Then came the struggle to get my clothes past my wide hips to my narrow waist. While I was doing that, Dawn came out, and she began doing the same thing.

By the time we were fully dressed, Nurse Helga and another nurse came into the room. My heart sank when I saw what they had with them. "Really? Didn't I go through all this specifically to get out of a wheelchair?"

"Hospital regulations, dear," she replied. "Besides, you wouldn't want to trip and break something, and have to be re-admitted, would you?"

Seeing I had no choice, I plopped my tuchus into the wheelchair. As we were wheeled out, I saw Dad with Finn, dressed in his new clothes and being wheeled out by a nurse of his own.

We had to take different elevators down, since they only come big enough for three people and one wheelchair. Finally, we all got down to the first floor, and were wheeled out the front door. I practically jumped out of the wheelchair, glad to put that behind me. "Where do we go first?" I asked.
1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.title: Skip to being discharged.

1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.content:
Mom smiled and replied, "You three have a lot of pent up energy that needs to be burned, so we are going shopping for clothes, shoes, and accessories."

"Can we even afford that?" Wincing, Dawn asked.

Dad chuckled. "I can assure you that money is one thing we need not worry about anymore." Smiling, he said. "In fact, your mother and I are now happily retired."

Finn, Dawn, and I turned to each other, smiling, before walking towards the clothing racks, only Dad stopped Finn and pointed to the boys' section. "This is a good time for you and I to get to know each other a little better." Kindly, he said. "Let's see what styles suit you."

Mom led Dawn and I to the teen girl's section and pointed at the various racks. "I could have bought you two a new wardrobe based on the styles you had picked out, but then you would not have had any say in the style you got."

Dawn sighed, looking at the many different styles in girl's clothing. "What makes you think I have any idea what style I really want?"

"That's why I'm here." Calmly, Mom replied. "The clothing you buy for yourself says a lot about your personality; more than you might realize." She paused, thinking. "I'd say that you are a 'tough princess' type of girl, who is somewhere between Kat and her little sister, Zoe."

I smiled at that. Zoe was two years younger than Kat, with long black hair and blue eyes. She was about as feminine as any little girl could get, with a love for fairy tales and princesses, with energy to match. Kat, on the other hand, was a strict tomboy, with a love for action movies and brave heroines. Dawn, however, did not agree with Mom's statement.

"What?!" Taken back, she demanded. "I'm nothing like them!"

Mom giggled. "Zoe loves ballet, while you love ballroom dancing, both very graceful, if you really think about it." Calmly, she said. "Kat is all tomboy, but she's a bit shy at times." She then smiled at her. "You are a little tomboy, out of her element, so you are on the shy side, but I know you have that same fire and energy."

"What does this all have to do with fashion?" pouting, Dawn asked.

Mom motioned to a mannequin wearing a dark pink skirt and white blouse. "This alone would not suit you; it requires an accessory." Softly, she explained. "Tell me what you think, and remember, you are not a boy anymore, you're a teenage girl."

Dawn and I watched, curious, as Mom took a denim jacket and put it over the blouse, before placing a pair of women's boots at the base. I did not know why, but I could actually see myself in the outfit without feeling too uncomfortable. Dawn sighed and said, "Okay... I suppose that's one outfit I could see myself wearing." Blushing, she admitted. "How did you know I wouldn't outright reject it?"

Mom giggled. "Two reasons." Bemused, she said. "One, I took notes as you and Cassidy talked about the fashion magazines in the hospital; and two, I know my daughters all too well."

"Do you now?" Unimpressed, I asked.

Mom nodded, amused by our half-hearted defiance. "Neither of you take any major change lying down, unless you have some control over it." Calmly, she said. "I'm not telling you what to wear or buy, I'm just showing you what I know you will like."

I sighed, knowing mom was right, to her further giggles. She then continued taking us shopping, pointing out various accessories to make any given outfit more palatable to our individual likes and tastes. Dawn and I grudgingly admitted that Mom knew what she was talking about when it came to fashion and the styles we would like. Still, we both knew that there were many more challenges ahead of us. Upon gathering a small wardrobe for us to start with, Mom led us to the next part of the shopping trip, which I was not really looking forward to...
1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.title: Shopping

1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.content:
Dawn and I stared at the variety of one and two piece swimsuits, blushing at the thought of us actually wearing them on the beach this summer. "You two loved to see girls in their swimsuits." Bemused, mom said. "It's only natural, but I wonder how you will take being on the receiving end of those stares from other boys?"

Dawn and I blushed further, if that were any possible. "We never stared..." Defensive, I said.

Mom giggled. "I'm just picking on you." Smiling, she said. "Which do you two prefer, the one piece or the two piece?"

"The one piece." Blushing, Dawn said. "The two piece would leave me feeling almost naked."

I nodded, agreeing with that, to mom's further giggles. "One piece swim suits it is." Calmly, she said. "Now, what color and style would you like..."

I will never know, for the life of me, why girls like shopping so much, even as a girl. Walking out of the changing rooms wearing the swimsuit we had chosen for mom to see was embarrassing as it was, but to hear a boy giving us a wolf whistle as he walked by was even worse.

From the swimsuit section, Mom took us to the lingerie department. "Don't we already have bras and panties?" Wincing, Dawn asked.

"Not enough though." Calmly, Mom said. "Fortunately, I already took your measurements at the hospital, so you don't have to be fitted for a bra." She smiled. "Why don't you two look at the sleepwear, and see which pajamas and nightgowns you would like?"

Dawn and I looked at the pajamas and nightgowns. Some of them seemed quite revealing, at least to our perspective. "I think I'd prefer pajama tops and bottoms to a nightgown." Wincing, I said. "I will be sleeping, not trying to impress anyone."

Mom looked at us for a moment then laughed with the saleslady joining her. "I see you have twin tomboys." Amused, the saleslady said.

To me, my demands were simple and common sense, only to Mom and the saleslady, they seemed rather comical. "I'm serious." Pouting, I protested.

"I know, Cassie." Smiling, mom said. "Still, do you really think your father or I will let you try to impress anyone in your room at your age?" She giggled. "My father wouldn't even hear of it if I suggested bringing in company after dark at your age."

We were suddenly interrupted by a boy's voice calling out, "Two hotties over here!" It was a boy motioning one of his friends to follow him.

"My daughters are only thirteen, young man." Protective, Mom warned.

"So? I'm 14." Calmly, the boy replied. "Not many pretty cheerleaders are left up for grabs."

"Don't go there." Frowning, Mom warned again.

Unfazed, the boy walked up to me, smiling. "Hello, miss." Sweetly, he said. "I'm Kevin. Did the mall become more gorgeous today, or is it just you?"

"Really bad pickup line..." Unimpressed, I thought. then i said. "I'm not interested. Go do your 'shopping' somewhere else."

Kevin's friend chuckled before stepping up to dawn only she spoke before he could open his mouth. "I don't care what your name is, creep! Keep walking!"

"Hey, Nate." Said a small voice, approaching behind the two boys. "Looking for another date?"

Nate sighed. "Nice timing, Tommy." Rolling his eyes, he said. "I was about to ask this lovely girl her name."

Curious, I turned to see a small boy, no taller than me, with red hair and green eyes. He smiled at his older brother as Kevin quietly walked away to find another spot where girls were gathering for better luck. "Why not just ask her?" Innocently, Tommy, suggested. He turned to Dawn and I. "What's your name, please."

Dawn giggled, finding it amusing that a small boy was trying to help his older brother pick up a date with a girl. "I'm Cassie." Calmly, I replied. "Sorry, but we're not interested at the moment."

Tommy, forgetting his brother walked blushed. "I have some extra dollars from my allowance." Shuffling his feet, showing some shyness, he said. "Would you two like to have an ice cream with me? We can get to know each other better that way..."

Dawn and I turned to each other before giggling.
1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.title: Boys girl 'shopping'.

1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.content:
Dawn and I turned to Mom, who just shrugged. "A young gentleman offered you two ice cream." Calmly, she said. "It's up to you to accept or not."

I gasped inside as Tommy lightly took my hand and urged me forward. "I promise I'll bring them right back." he said to Mom.

Mom nodded, tearfully from fighting not to laugh hysterically. "Take your time, Tommy." Smiling, she said. "Get to know each other better."

Dawn and I discretely threw Mom a 'thanks a lot' look as she innocently waved at us. "Have fun, you two." she said. "Enjoy your ice cream."

As Tommy led us to the food court, not too far from the lingerie section, he smiled at Nate and whispered, "That's how you get the girl, bro."

Hearing that, I, Dawn and Mom could not help but laugh as Nate blushed brightly, knowing that his little brother had managed to get one up on him. Tommy's bold move impressed me a little. "Not bad, kid." Smiling, I thought.

Trying Tommy's approach, Nate turned to Dawn. "Would you like an ice cream?" he asked.

Dawn laughed. "You're a day late and a dollar short." Smiling, she replied. "Tommy asked us both, but it was a nice try, though."

At the food court, Tommy ordered us each a large ice cream cone and one for himself before we sat down for a while. Truth be told, I was not ready for this yet, and I don't think Dawn was either, but here we were, sitting with a young man who seemed to have a crush on us both. "Um... thank you for the ice cream, Tommy." Softly, I said. "It was very nice of you."

Tommy smiled. "You're welcome." Blushing, he said. "I've never seen you around school before, are you two new to the area?"

"You could say that." Blushing, Dawn replied.

Tommy's eyes lit up a bit. "Would you two like to be my friend?"

"I guess that's okay." Shrugging, I replied. "We'll see you around school."

Suddenly, Tommy shocked me by giving me a light peck on the cheek before running off, giggling. Mom, who had been watching, gave me a concerned look as I returned to her, rubbing my cheek, confused. I had not noticed that my ice cream was slowly melting onto my hand.

"Are you feeling okay?" Bemused, Mom asked.

"He-He gave me a kiss, then ran off." Looking lost, I said. "What was that all about?"

Mom giggled. "Remember last month, when Kat gave you a little peck and ran away?" Smiling, she asked. "I think Tommy has a crush on you."

I nearly dropped my ice cream hearing that, and turned to Tommy, who waved at me, still smiling ear to ear. I shyly waved back, then turned to mom, annoyed.

"If I didn't know better, I'd say you set me up for that!" Hissing, I whispered.

Mom merely smiled. "I didn't give you girls a push." Calmly, she countered. "It was your choice to go with him." She giggled. "Now you know what it's like to be on the receiving end of a young man's charms."

Dawn and I blushed at that, realizing just how easily we had fallen for Tommy's charms...
1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.title: A young man's charms.

1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.content:
It felt good to be back home. Mom and Dad helped us bring in our purchases and assorted items we had used while in the hospital. Once everything was in the house, Dawn and I hurried up the stairs to see our new shared room. It had ocean blue carpeting, with horizontal stripes of light blue transitioning into lavender, then dark blue, into black on the ceiling, with random tiny white dots simulating the night sky. On the one wall where our beds were, side by side, was a light pink accent wall that was painted to look like the sail of a ship. With the two beds being side by side with two nightstands in between, it reminded me of a two-hulled outrigger canoe.

The one window in the room, opposite of the beds, had a shade that matched the walls, giving the room a complete ocean scene. I would not say we were surprised, but we were certainly bemused. Dawn and I both loved the ocean, so it wasn't too bad, but it definitely needed a few tweaks here and there. To the left of the bed was an en suite with a double sink vanity, a tub, and a shower that carried a beach theme. Again, it wasn't all that bad, but I believed it needed more of a feminine touch to make it ours. As we were taking it all in, Mom peered in with a smile on her face. "Well, girls, do you like it?" Bemused, she said. "The Strong boys outdid themselves on yours and Finn's rooms, I think."

"I think they mistook us for little girls." Amused, I said. "It definitely needs a few tweaks."

Dawn nodded in agreement. "Never let boys decorate a girl's room." Grinning, she said.

Mom giggled. "Kat and I were supervising." Calmly, she said. "The ocean and beach themes were our idea, as the ocean seemed to calm you both as boys." She pointed to the window. "You can see the sun rise from that window. That really gives the room a magical look in the morning, which is why we picked this theme."

"It still needs some tweaks." Smiling, I said. "We love it, though. Thank you."

Mom, Dawn, and I shared a hug. "You are welcome, girls." Softly, Mom said. "Let's see how Finn likes his room, before we unpack and have lunch."

"What are we having?" Curious, Dawn asked.

Mom smiled. "Your father is firing up the grill for some hot dogs and hamburgers." Calmly, she replied. "Lunch will be ready in about ten minutes, so we better get moving."
1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.title: Never let boys decorate a girl's room.

1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.content:
Dawn and I walked across the hall to Finn's room, to find an almost science fiction theme. All four walls and the ceiling were painted to look like windows gazing out into space, with images of Saturn on the east wall and Jupiter on the west wall. The carpet was a dark blue, and the one window had a shade that matched the mural surrounding it. His bed, under the mural of Saturn, was normal, but had star themed sheets and pillow cases. His nightstand and desk were also normal, but his dresser was built into the north wall, next to a door that was painted to look like a hatch, that led to a en suite.

"Wow..." Looking around, I said. "I'm blown away by your room!"

"It's a bit much." Wincing, Finn said. "I prefer something simple."

With that, he walked out of his bedroom and entered ours, where he let out a low gasp. "Wow,... an ocean themed bedroom!" He turned to the window with the shade up, and marveled at how the light from the setting sun seemed to make the room come alive. The carpet shimmered as if it were real water, and the light upon the walls gave the illusion of the sky at dusk. It was truly beautiful to witness. "I underestimated the twins." Smiling, I thought. "Not bad..."

Finn turned to Dawn and I, hopeful. "Um... Want to switch?"

Had Finn first asked me when I first saw our shared bedroom, I would have jumped at the chance, but now I was not so sure. "Let's see what your room looks like at sunset." Calmly, I suggested. "Perhaps there is a similar surprise there."

We all walked back to Finn's room, to find that the paintings changed as the sun set! The murals on all four walls changed to that of a forest scene, with the night sky on the ceiling! Curious, I gave the murals a closer look and found that they were actually sliding panels that moved on a timer to different scenes. Seeing this, Finn was speechless. "Never mind..."

"We really underestimated the Strong Brothers." Softly, Dawn said. "They put some serious thought into these rooms."

I had to admit that our new bedrooms were incredible. At first glance, they were not much to look at, but once the sun went down, the real magic of their work showed itself in an epic way. Eager to see my room after dark, I went back to my new room, and found that there were glow in the dark dots that I did not see on all of the walls and carpet, mimicking the night sky, just like the ceiling with carpet mimicking the ocean.

"It's incredible..." In awe, I whispered. "It's as if we are actually out on the ocean at night."

Mom, who had been watching it all, giggled. "I take it you won't be tweaking your bedrooms."

I shook my head. "No,... it's perfect."
1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.title: Impressive themes.

1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.content:
Both Dawn and I woke to the sound of an alarm clock. It was not that we wanted to get up so early, we had to get used to getting up in time for school. Summer vacation was nearly over, we would be going back after the weekend. "I wonder if I will be graduating this year or going back to eighth grade..." Sighing, I said.

"Likely eighth grade, as we are now twins." Wincing, Dawn replied.

A knock came to our door and Mom peered in. "Rise and shine, girls." Firmly but kindly, she said. "You go back to school on Monday."

"Mom, what grades are we going to be in, since we are now twins?" Wincing, I asked.

Mom smiled at that. "We will discuss that after you are all more awake." Kindly, she said. "Get dressed and come down for breakfast, before it gets cold."

Albeit reluctantly, Dawn and I got freshened up and dressed before coming down, where Finn was already seated at the table. "I still can't get over how quickly I can get dressed and ready as a guy." Softly, he said. "It's almost mind-blowing."

"Well, you should know from experience that girls have more to do in the morning to get ready for the day." Serious, Mom said. "You may start eating now."

Dad walked in shortly after, looking slightly drained. He almost literally plopped himself down in his seat, as Mom poured him a cup of coffee. "Rough meeting with the school board, dear?" Wincing, she asked.

Dad sighed. "I've been through worse." Honestly, he said. "They understand that the situation involving our kids is complicated, but they did not write the laws surrounding their education." He took a sip of his coffee before turning to us. "We have a few options available to us, to make everything easier for everyone involved."

Finn swallowed a spoonful of oatmeal before asking, "What are they?"

"Well, despite their new ages, Cassidy has gone through enough classes to graduate this year, and Finn has enough education not to return to school." Serious, Dad said. "However, Dawn will have to finish school, unless she takes and passes an advancement test that will move her up into Cassidy's graduating class."

"What are the other options?" Wincing, Dawn asked.

Dad smiled. "Cassidy could agree to go back to your class, and go through school again." He chuckled seeing me wince then added, "You could also all take online courses until graduation."

Finn smiled. "It looks like I'm getting a long summer vacation."

"That does not mean I'm going to let you just laze around, young man." Sternly, Mom said. "You will be helping me with chores, and you will be taking college classes online."

Finn winced. "Yes, Mom..."

"So either I go back in grades with Dawn and graduate with her, or she takes an advancement test and graduates with me next year." Musing, I said. "That, or we take online courses..."

"I'll leave it up to you two." Serious, Dad said. "Only, I need your answer now. If Dawn agrees to take the test, she has to take it this afternoon."

Dawn and I turned to each other, startled. Only, like before, we were both certain of our answer.
1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.title: The next morning.

choices: skip to first day of school.
1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.content:
"I have enough credits to graduate now, Dad." Serious, I replied. "If I go back to eighth grade with Dawn, I can take college credit classes for four years, and not worry about going to, or paying out the nose for, college after graduation."

"I'm taking college credit courses now." Also serious, Dawn said. "I'll have enough credits to graduate next year, so I'm not too far behind Cassidy."

"Maybe I should go back to school for a while." After a pause, Finn said. "With my memory loss, I will likely need a few refresher courses."

Dad nodded. "It's settled then." Calmly, he said. "I will call the school board, and make all of the arrangements for your return to school."

"Just remember, little geniuses, to beware young suitors after your fortune, rather than your looks and personality." Serious, Mom said. "Your plight and fortunes have been all over the news."

"I got tired of watching the news because of it." Rolling my eyes, I said. "Don't they have better things to talk about?"

Dad chuckled. "You need not worry about them." Calmly, he said. "Something bigger will eventually surface, and we will be forgotten."

"I hope so." sighing, I said. "I want to go see that new movie, My Life in Miniature."

Dawn giggled. "It's about a small group of teens who are shrunk to doll proportions, due to a weird meteorite that crashed in their campsite." Bemused, she said. "The trailer showed them living in a dollhouse village."

"Sounds interesting." Smiling, Mom said. She giggled. "However, reality is stranger than fiction."

I blushed at that, knowing that Mom was referring to our change in age and gender. "I guess we should get working on picking our college credit classes."

"We will help you with that." Serious, Dad said. "For now, enjoy the weekend. You go back to school Monday morning."

I turned to Dawn and Finn. "Well, how do you two want to spend our last two days of vacation?"

"How do you top a vacation like we had?" Giggling, Dawn asked.

I giggled back. "Good question..."
1112131112112111221121213131111112111122.title: I go back in grades.

112.content:
I was in the middle of watching an episode of Manifest on my table, a few hours later, when I heard a knock on the door. I quickly paused the episode before turning to face the door. “Come in!”

I got a smile on my face when I saw Kat standing in the doorway; an equally big smile on her face. Running into the room, she hugged me and said, “I’m glad I got to see you before they took you in for the operation.”

“It’s not an operation, Kat; I won’t even be giving anesthesia.” Smiling, I said, “But, I am glad you got here before they brought me in.”

“Are you nervous?” pulling a chair up to my bedside, Kat said, “I’d be pretty nervous if I were in your position.”

“I’m a little nervous; mostly out of fear that it won’t work.”

“I know it’s going to work.” With a goofy grin, Kat said, “In a few days, once you’re out of the hospital, we’ll be able to hang out without you being in a wheelchair.”

“That’s the best news I’ve heard in a long time.” Looking at Kat, I couldn’t help but notice she was nervous about something.
“You’re asking me if I’m nervous; while you look worse than you did before your ballet recital.”

“I seem to recall breaking my leg at that recital; so I guess I had good reason to be nervous.” Sighing, Kat said, “But, you’re right, I am nervous; because there’s something I’ve been meaning to tell you for a while now.”

I couldn’t help but feel hurt that Kat seemed to be keeping something from me. We never kept any secrets from each other; after all, she was the first one outside the family that I told about the procedure. “Are you keeping something from me, Kat?”

“Yeah, but it’s only because I’m afraid of how you’ll react to it.” Taking a deep breath, Kat said, “I’ve had a crush on you since 7th Grade.”

If I’d had any liquid in my mouth, I probably would have done a spit take at that news. Looking at Kat, dumbfounded, I said, “Y-You have a crush on me? Why’d you never tell me before this?”

“I never said told you because it felt wrong to think of you that way; you’ve been like my big brother since I moved in next door.” Blushing, I said, “Plus there was the fact that you were 5 years older than me.”

“Yeah, well that’s not going to be an issue for much longer.” Pausing, I said, “Once we’re the same age; perhaps we could see where things go.”

“Really!?” louder than she probably intended, Kat looked at me and said, “Please tell me you’re not joking right now.”

I’d be lying if I said I didn’t think Kat was attractive; because she is. I just felt weird thinking about her that way; because, like she said, I thought of her as my little sister. We’re talking about a girl who I taught how to ride a bike. The more I thought about it, however, the more I realized there wouldn’t be any issues once we were the same age. “I’m not joking, Kat; I’d like to go out with you sometime.” Looking at her, I said, “Just promise me one thing; you won’t get mad if, for one reason or another, one of us decides that the two of us dating is weird.”

“I suppose I could agree to that.” Leaning over, Kat kissed me on the cheek and said, “I’ll see you later, Marcus.”

Kat left a few minutes later; walking past Mom and a nurse as they came into the room. Once Kat was out of earshot, Mom turned to me and said, “Kat seemed pretty happy; is there something I should know about?”

“Not right now, Mom.” Blushing, I said, “I’ll tell you later.”

“Okay then.” Gesturing to the nurse, Mom said, “Are you ready for the procedure?”

As the nurse helped me into the wheelchair, I looked at Mom and said, “I’ve been ready for the last four years, Mom.”
112.title: Awaiting the Procedure

12.content:
Primary Characters:
1. Marcus Scott (17 years old) - Was paralyzed from the waist down 4 years earlier after being hit by a drunk driver. Is the first human trial for a potentially revolutionary drug to cure paralysis.
         Cassidy Scott (13 years old) - the new female identity adopted by Marcus following his surprise transformation into a girl. While shocked about the sudden gender change, Cassidy realizes that being a girl is better than having to rely on others to help her around.

2. Gloria Scott - 42; Marcus/Cassidy's mother; blames herself for Marcus's paralysis, as she sent him on the errand that placed him in harm's way; supports him in his decision to go through with the procedure. As Marcus becomes Cassidy, teaches her how to fit in as a girl.

3. Kent Scott - 43; Marcus/Cassidy's father; opposes Marcus taking a chance with the untested procedure; views the change into Cassidy as proof that he was right to urge caution; loves Cassidy, but is slow to demonstrate it.

4. Glenn Scott - 15; Marcus/Cassidy's brother; admired Marus; has to deal with suddenly becoming the older brother; teases Cassidy over how quickly she adjusts to being a girl but will fight for her honor.

5. Kat Maddox (13 years old) - lives next door to the Scotts. Was, for a short time following the procedure, Marcus' girlfriend before he turned into Cassidy. Her feelings for Marcus translated into caring deeply for Cassidy.

info.brief_description: An untested medical procedure has some unforeseen side effects for a teenage boy.
info.description:
Marcus Scott has been paralyed from the waist down since he was 14 years old. Four years later, an untested procedure repairs the damage but with some side effects. He's regressed back to a 13-year-old and has to repeat High School. Only that's not the only side effect, he's slowly turned into a girl.
